loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: D. Léa est née le 15 Juillet 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léa est mariée à AMOUSSOU  Georges, un employé à la pâtisserie "Gerbes d'or" à Cotonou. Le couple a deux enfants. Un des enfants est scolarisé, et l'autre n'a pas encore l'âge d'être scolarisé. Tous les deux enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis 4 ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Léa vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sacs de riz, conserves, boissons en cannettes, etc.) dans sa boutique size à Kpankpan à Cotonou. Léa fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est depuis 5 ans que Léa exerce cette activité. Léa voudrait renforcer son stock de marchandise afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est pour cette raison que Léa sollicite ce premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Léa was born on July 15, 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to AMOUSSOU Georges, an employee at the "Gerbes d'or" pastry shop in Cotonou.  The couple has two children.  One of the children is in school, and the other is not yet school-age. Both of the children have been living with their parents in Agbodjèdo, a district in Cotonou, for four years.  The couple supports the family jointly.  To meet her needs, Léa sells a variety of goods (pasta, rice, canned foods, canned drinks, etc.) in her store located in Kpankpan in Cotonou.  She does her buying at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has been in this business for five years.  Léa would like to bolster her stock of merchandise in order to satisfy her customers better.  For this reason, she's requesting this first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, pasta

loans.name: Eleazar Enoc

texts.es:
Eleazar es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 18 años se dedica al arreglo y confección de prendas de vestir junto a su esposa. Esta actividad la realizan en su casa con una máquina de coser que funciona a pedal. Eleazar trabaja también como obrero agrícola por las mañanas. Estas actividades son la única fuente de ingreso familiar.

El uso constante que le brindan a la máquina de coser ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas técnicas, Eleazar no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacer las reparaciones necesarias por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación de su instrumento de trabajo.

Eleazar sueña con adquirir una máquina de coser industrial que haga el trabajo más facil y rápido. Por otro lado planea incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropa en el futuro. Este es su segundo préstamo con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eleazar, a family man and father, is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and two children, who are 2 and 19, in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province, in the Region of La Libertad, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 18 years he has worked with his wife in tailoring and alteration of items of clothing. They work in their house with a pedal driven sewing machine. Eleazar also works in the mornings as an agricultural worker. These activities are the only source of family income. The constant use of the sewing machine has caused it to begin to suffer some technical failures. Eleazar does not have sufficient money to make the necessary repairs so he has seen the necessity of requesting a loan of 700 soles from Edpyme Alternative that he plans to use for the repair of his work tool. Eleazar dreams of acquiring an industrial sewing machine that would make his work easier and faster. On the other hand he plans to move into the business of selling clothing in the future. This is his second loan with our institution. He has demonstrated that he is a responsible and punctual client from the moment of taking on his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses of repair and maintenance of his sewing machine

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: B. Louise est née le 28 Décembre 1968 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Louise vit depuis environs 20 ans à Agbato à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Louise est mariée à HOUEZEMOUDE  François et est mère d'un enfant. L'enfant est scolarisé et vit avec ses parents à Agbato. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Louise n'a pas été à l'école. Louise vend des tissus par le système de distribution, et aussi à Dantokpa marché international du Bénin. Louise mène également comme activité secondaire, la vente de bols en séries. C'est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa que Louise s'approvisionne. Louise exerce cette activité depuis une quinzaine d'année. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Louise sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer davantage son activité.
texts.en:
B. Louise was born on December 28, 1968 in Adjohoun, Ouémé County, Benin.  She has been living for about 20 years in Agbato in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to HOUEZEMOUDE François and is the mother of one child, who attends school and is living at home.  The couple supports the family jointly.  Louise did not attend school.  She sells cloth through the distribution system and also at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She also runs a secondary business selling sets of bowls.  Lomé, the capital of Togo, which is a country neighboring Benin, is where she stocks up, as well as at Dantokpa.  She has been in this business for about fifteen years.  Louise is a previous ALIDé client having already obtained four loans from this micro-finance institution.  These loans have been repaid.  She's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé with the goal of increase her working capital and to bolster her business further. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics (damask, Wax, Hitarget, etc.)

loans.name: Jorge Marciano

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 53 años de edad, es separado desde hace 18 años, tiene 2 hijos y actualmente vive con su madre y con su abuela en el sector Los Grados del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde muy pequeño. Cría vacas productoras de leche en los terrenos agrícolas que rodean su casa y siembra forraje para alimentarlas. La leche que producen sus animales la vende a una empresa acopiadora de la zona. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que sostiene a los suyos.

Debido al paso del tiempo las paredes de su establo, construidas de material rústico, están sufriendo deterioros, por lo que Jorge se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su establo.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su establo y comprar una procesadora de forraje. Esta es la segunda vez que Jorge trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Jorge is 53. He has been separated for 18 years, and he has two children. He currently lives with his mother and grandmother in the Los Grados sector in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. This is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture and with livestock since he was very small. He raises dairy cows on the fields surrounding his house. He plants fodder to feed them. He sells the milk his animals produce to a milk collection company in the area. This business is the only source of income he has to support his family. Due to the passage of time, the walls of his stable, which are made from rustic material, are deteriorating. That is why Jorge is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 800 PEN. He plans to buy construction material to improve his stable. His greatest desire is to expand his stable and buy a processor for the fodder. This is the second time that Jorge has worked with our Institution. He has demonstrated himself to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve the stable

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 24 years old, married, and has a child who is currently in school. She sells baby clothes, Pampers, powder, diapers, detergents, feeding bottles, etc. through hawking. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to sell to her customers on their doorsteps.
Rita is requesting a loan to inject more capital into the business to make further progress. She wants to use the loan to buy supplies of baby clothes, diapers, Pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastics, to increase her stock. Rita hopes to make more income to provide her child with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase baby items in bulk

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is 32 years old, married, and has a child who is currently in school. She sells fabrics through hawking. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to sell to her customers on their doorsteps.
Faustina is requesting a loan to inject more capital into the business to make further progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of fabrics to increase her stock. She hopes to make more income to provide her child with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Ded Progreso Group

texts.es:
MARTHA, TIENE 54 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 7 HIJOS YA ADULTOS. HACE TRES AÑOS Y MEDIO QUE FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "SARITA COLONIA DEL PROGRESO", ACTUALMENTE ES LA PRESIDENTA Y JUNTO CON NUEVE INTEGRANTES MAS OBTIENEN LOS CRÉDITOS PARA AUMENTAR SUS NEGOCIOS.
MARTHA SE DEDICA A LA  VENTA D. GOLOSINAS, EN UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA, HACE SIETE AÑOS COMENZÓ CON MUY POQUITO Y POCO A POCO EN BASE A ESFUERZO, TRABAJO Y AHORRO HA IDO AUMENTANDO SU MERCADERÍA.
CON SU TRABAJO, HA PODIDO COLABORAR ECONÓMICAMENTE EN LAS MEJORAS D. SU CASA Y AYUDA EN LA EDUCACIÓN UNIVERSITARIA D. UNO D. SUS HIJOS MENORES.
LE GUSTARÍA MAS ADELANTE EMPRENDER UNA EMPRESA D. SELLADO D. PLASTICO.
ELPRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA INVERTIR EN SU BODEGA.
texts.en:
Martha is 54 years old and has 7 older children. She has been part of the “Sarita Colonia del Progreso” group for the past three and a half years, and currently is serving as the group’s president. Martha and the other nine group members have obtained loans to build their businesses. Martha sells sweets in a space in her house. She started this business seven years ago with very little, and little by little with great effort, work, and savings she has increased her merchandise. Through her work, she has been able to contribute financially to house improvements, and also helps her two younger children with their university education expenses. In the future she would like to start a plastic sealing company. The loan that she has requested will be used to invest in her small neighborhood store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for her small neighborhood store.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. 
Desde hace 9 años comenzó su negocio de venta de madera, la cual extrae de árboles de eucalipto. Para ello, contrata peones para realizar la labor en menor tiempo, usando una motosierra como su principal instrumento de trabajo.

Con esta madera elabora puntales y mangos para diferentes herramientas, y también la vende por trozos (leña). Con este trabajo logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para los gastos de su familia.
Adicionalmente, Clemente también cultiva papa y maíz, productos con los que obtiene ingresos adicionales durante la época de cosecha, cada año. 

Este es su 14avo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, él siempre se ha mostrado muy comprometido en las tareas que le encomiendan en su banco comunal, por lo que es muy estimado en su grupo. Además renueva su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará madera al por mayor y pagará el transporte de ésta hasta su taller.
texts.en:
Clemente is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in their own house. 9 years ago he started his business selling wood, which he extracts from Eucalyptus trees. To do that, he hires workers to carry out the job in less time, using a chainsaw as his primary work tool. With this wood he crafts wooden props and handles for different tools; he also sells it by piece (firewood). Through this work he is able to obtain the necessary income to cover family expenses. Additionally, Clemente also plants potatoes and corn, which allows him he obtains extra income during each year’s harvest season. This is his 14th loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. He has demonstrated that he is very committed to the tasks assigned to him by his communal bank, for which he is highly regarded by his group. In addition, he renews his commitment to pay his loan quotas on time. With the money that he is currently requesting he will purchase wood wholesale and pay for its transport to his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Yoel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yoel tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y próximamente tendrá su primer hijo. Vive junto a su esposa en el sector Chuin del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace cuatro años, con los ahorros de su trabajo en una empresa agrícola de la zona, compró una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que trabajaba durante sus tiempos libres. Hace dos años fue cesado de su puesto y desde entonces se ha dedicado exclusivamente a trabajar con su vehículo. Por otro lado eventualmente también trabaja como obrero agrícola. Con estos ingresos el sostiene la economía de su familia.

Debido al tiempo de uso la mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas, por lo que Yoel se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Yoel desea brindarle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajao con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad  y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Yoel is 25, married, and will soon has his first child. He lives with his wife in the Chuin sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. This is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. Four years ago he used his savings from working at a regional agricultural business to buy a “mototaxi” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers). He worked with it during his free time. Two years ago his position was eliminated, and since then he has been working exclusively with his vehicle. He occasionally works as a field worker as well. He supports his family with these incomes. Due to the amount of time he uses the mototaxi it has started to have problems. That is why Yoel has seen the need to ask, for his first time, for a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. He will use the loan for repair and maintenance on his vehicle. Yoel wishes to give his child a good quality of life. He has worked with our Institution previously, and he has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for repair and maintenance of his mototaxi

loans.name: Nicasio Gustavo

texts.es:
Nicasio E. de 51 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento con dos servicios básicos que son agua y luz no cuenta con alcantarillado, su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Nicasio comenzó su negocio con la idea de un amigo que pusiera una tapicería de muebles porque no había en el sector este servicio y el le ayudaría con el primer ingreso.

Ahora Nicasio trabaja laqueando y tapizando muebles desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00, una de las mayores complicaciones en su negocio son los ladrones, la esposa trabaja con el ayudándole a coser los muebles, tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 200 metros de tela, 400 armazones y 200 esponjas, en el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio de tapizado para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Nicasio E. is 51 years old and has a cement house with two basic services, water and light, but no plumbing. His house is located in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Nicasio began his business with an idea from a friend who pointed out that there was no furniture upholstery store in that part of the city. His friend helped with the first payment. Now Nicasio works lacquering and upholstering furniture from 8am to 7pm. One the major challenges faced by his business is thieves. His wife works with him sewing the furniture. They have two grown up children. With the loan, he would like to buy 200 meters of fabric, 400 frames and 200 pieces of foam. In the future he would like to increase his upholstery business to secure the future of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric, frames and foam

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of fruits and red oil for resale

loans.name: Jesus De Nazareth Group

texts.es:
CARMEN, ESTA CASADA, TIENE 44 AÑOS D. EDAD, Y TIENE 4 HIJOS ADULTOS. ACTUALMENTE ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "JESUS D. NAZARETH",INTEGRADO POR 11 SOCIAS QUE RESIDEN EN LA ZONA D. SAN JUAN BAUTISTA EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
HACE CINCO AÑOS, LA SRA. CARMEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. ROPA EN BASE A PEDIDOS QUE LE SOLICITAN SUS FAMILIARES, AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS. ELLA INICIÓ TRABJANDO PARA UNA EMPRESA, QUE DEJABA MERCADERÍA EN LOS MERCADOS Y ELLA SE DEDICABA A LA COBRANZA, ESTUVO TRABAJANDO PARA ESA EMPRESA UN TIEMPO HASTA QUE APRENDIÓ EL MANEJO DEL NEGOCIO Y SE INDEPENDIZÓ.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO TENER MAS MERCADERÍA PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES, Y LE PERMITE AHORRAR.
ELPRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN PEDIDOS PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA.
texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Currently she is the president of the group “Jesus D. Nazareth” which is maD. up of 11 members who live in the San Jaun Bautista zone in the Comas district. For the past 5 years, Carmen has sold clothing by order. The orders are solicited from family members, friends and acquaintances. She began working for a company who left merchandize in the markets and she collected the money. She worked for the company for a while until she learned how to manage a business and then she went out on her own. With her work she has been able to obtain more merchandise to offer her clients and allows them to save. The loan that she is soliciting will be used for Christmas orders.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for orders

loans.name: Santos Guillermo

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 50 años que vive junto a su esposa y con uno de sus hijos en el sector Real Saucipe del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de un año trabaja como vigilante en un hotel turístico de Puerto Malabrigo, con el fruto de sus ahorros ha adquirido una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual trabaja en sus momentos libres. Su esposa de dedica a la venta de bebidas en el restaurante de su hermana, con estos ingresos ellos solventan la economía de su hogar.

Su unidad móvil está sufriendo algunas fallas debido al tiempo de uso brindado. Debido a esta situación Santos se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertirlos en la reparación, asi como en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Santos sueña con instalar una granja, ya que gusta mucho de criar animales. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Santos is a 50 year old father who lives with his wife and one of their children in the Real Saucipe sector of the Paiján district in the province of Ascope in the region of La Libertad, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over a year he has worked as a security guard in the Puerto Malabrigo tourist hotel. With his savings, he acquired a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport goods and passengers) in which he works in his spare time. His wife sells drinks in her sister’s restaurant. With these incomes they are able to support the household. Because of the amount of use it is getting, the motor unit requires some work. Santos is asking “Edpyme Alternativa” for a loan of 1000 Nuevos soles in order to make the repairs and in this way maintain his vehicle. Santos hopes one day to have a farm as he would very much like to raise animals. He has worked with our institution before and has been shown to be a responsible borrower and punctual with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: costs of repairing and maintaining a mototaxi

loans.name: Brenda Irene

texts.es: La señora Brenda Irene esta casada con el señor Gustavo quien labora para una empresa de electricidad y ella es supervisora de cuartos en un hotel de hospedaje, ellos anteriormente tenían un crédito con nosotros, lo terminaron de pagar siempre con puntualidad, se verifico que realizaron su mejora, y ahora están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de vitropiso en su hogar y la colocación de un portón en el frente de su vivienda para mayor protección de sus hijos que aun están pequeños y del hogar.
texts.en:
Brenda Irene is married to Gustavo who works for an electricity business and she is a room supervisor in a hotel, they previously had a loan with us, which they always paid on time, their improvements have been verified, and now they are applying for this loan to lay tiles in their home and to put a door in the front of their house for greater protection of their children who are still young and at home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placing of door and tiles in their home

loans.name: Claudio Ceferino

texts.es: El Sr. Claudio C. tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente vive en casa propia junto su esposa y sus dos menores hijos. Labora en el Fundo C Y J Inversiones SAC desde hace tres años desempeñando el cargo de obrero de campo. Su esposa también trabaja en el mismo fundo. Han construido la mitad de su casa de material noble con mucho esfuerzo gracias a ahorros producto de su trabajo, no poseen endeudamiento en ninguna institución financiera. Solicita crédito para continuar con mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que desean realizar acabados de paredes. Su sueño es alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida para bienestar de sus hijos quienes se encuentran aún pequeños. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar para alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señor Claudio C. is 37 years old and is in a common law marriage. He lives in his own house with his wife and two young children. He has worked as a farm hand for Fundo C Y J Inversiones SAC for the last three years. His wife also works for the same company. They have been able to build half of their house with quality materials and lots of hard work, and thanks to their savings from their jobs, they do not have any debts to financial institutions. Señor Claudio C. is requesting a loan to continue improving his house and specifically to put a finish on the walls. It is his dream to attain a higher standard of living for the well-being of his children who are still young. Both Señor Claudio C. and his wife are grateful for the support that we can provide to make their dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to his house

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel Padrón está casado con la señora Virgen del Carmen y son muy trabajadores, él se desempeña como cobrador en una empresa de venta de libros y con gran sacrificio abrieron una tiendita la cual fue apoyada con un crédito de nuestra Institución y con esfuerzo y buen manejo lograron iniciar un nuevo negocio de abarrotes en otra colonia,  así que cuentan ya con dos abarrotes del patrimonio familiar; desean aprovechar las ofertas que se presentan en estas temporadas y están solicitando un préstamo más para la compra de mercancía a mayoreo y obtener buenas ganancia.
texts.en:
Sr. José Ángel Padrón is married to Sra. Virgen del Carmen, and they are very hard-working people. He works as a collector in a book-selling business, and with a great sacrifice he opened a small shop that was supported with a loan from our Institution. With a great effort and good management, they managed to open a new grocery business in another neighborhood, so they now have two family-owned businesses. For such businesses with the bargains that they offer in these times, they are applying for this loan to buy more wholesale merchandise for greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his two grocery stores

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora María del Rosario M. obtuvo anteriormente un crédito en nuestra institución para solucionar una dificultad familiar, hoy esta pidiendo un refinanciamiento y por su buen historial de pago se esta otorgando este nuevo crédito para la instalación en el techo de su hogar de poliuretano, ya que las temperaturas en nuestra ciudad son extremas y la señora quiere una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, ya que ella recibe el apoyo de sus hijos que viven con en su hogar los cuales la apoyan económicamente.
texts.en:
María del Rosario M. previously took out a loan with our institution to resolve a family situation. Today, she is requesting refinancing. Due to her good payment history she qualifies for the new loan, which will be used to install a polyurethane roof on her house. The temperatures in our city are extreme, and María wants better living conditions for her family. She is supported by her children, who live in her home and depend on her economically.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of polyurethane roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four calves to fatten and sell

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es:
Las Pioneras es el nombre del grupo compuesto por Francisca Inés E. A., Claudia S. y Danelia Carolina C. F. quienes escogieron este nombre porque al empezar a trabajar con Adim sintieron que era un nuevo inicio para ellas y sus negocios.

Francisca Inés E. A. inició su propio negocio para ayudar en los gastos del hogar pero con el tiempo este le ayudo a sentirse realizada y ser independiente. Esta joven de 25 años vende colchones matrimoniales, unipersonales, almohadas y cojines  e invertirá el crédito en la adquisición de inventario en dichos productos. 

Claudia S. tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita característico del pueblo nicaragüense, este tipo de negocio tienen sus inicios en los años 30. Claudia desde las tres de la tarde empieza a colocar su rustico puesto de comida en la acera de su casa esperando la llegada de sus habituales clientes por su carne asada, enchilada, tajadas con quesos, pollo…etc.

Danelia Carolina C. F. vende ropa y cosméticos por encargo, ella inicio con pocos productos pero con el tiempo empozo hacer más clientes y a distribuir más.
texts.en:
Las Pioneras (The Pioneers) is the name of the group comprised of Francisca Inés E. A., Claudia S., and Danelia Carolina C. F.. They chose this name because when they started working with Adim they felt that it was a new start for them and their businesses. Francisca Inés E. A. started her own business to help with the household expenses. In time, this helped her feel fulfilled and independent. She is 25, and she sells double and twin size quilts, pillows, and cushions. She will use the loan to get more inventory of these products. Claudia S. has a “fritanga”, a popular restaurant with fried food that is characteristic of the Nicaraguan towns. This type of business started in the 30’s. At three in the afternoon Claudia starts to set up her rustic food stand on the sidewalk to her house. She waits for the arrival of her regular customers who come for her grilled beef, enchiladas, banana chips with cheese, and chicken, etc. Danelia Carolina C. F. sells clothes and cosmetics by order. She started with a few products. But, in time she started to have more customers and to distribute more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy king, queen, double, and twin quilts and pillows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase grocery products for resale

loans.name: Manuela Angelmira

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 21, 14 y 6 años de edad en el sector Chuin del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 5 años tiene una pequeña bodega - tienda que funciona en casa de su madre, allí ofrece diversos productos a sus clientes especialmente carne de pollo y verduras. Ella nos comenta que la idea de su negocio surgió debido a que nadie vendía carne de pollo por la zona y sus vecinos tenían que trasladarse a la ciudad de Paiján para adquirirlo, empezó vendiendo solo pollo, pero pronto sus vecinos le sugirieron empezar a vender verduras y desde entonces ha mantenido su negocio.

Adicionalmente trabaja como recolectora de espárrago en los sembríos cercanos, pero esta no es una actividad que le brinde ingresos estables con los cuales pueda ayudar a su familia. Manuela está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más variedades de verduras por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Manuela desea seguir trabajando para ver progresar a sus hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 42 years old, married and lives with her husband and her three children. They are 21, 14 and 6 and they live in the Chuin sector in district Paiján, province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad, situated three hours outside of Chiclayo.

For more that 5 years, she has had a small bodega, a store that functions out of her mother’s house. There she offers a diverse range of products to her customers, specifically chicken and vegetables. She told us the idea for the business was suggested because no one on the street sold chicken in that area and her neighbors had to go to the city of Paiján to buy it. She started selling only chicken but soon her neighbors suggested she start selling vegetables and since then she has maintained her business.

Additionally, she works as an asparagus harvester in nearby fields but this activity doesn’t provide stable income with which she can help her family. Manuela is thinking to increase her business by buying more varieties of vegetables for which she is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternative.

Manuela wishes to continue working to see her children progress. This is the second time she has worked with our institution and has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and responsible client when taking on payments.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of vegetables to increase her business

loans.name: Agahuseyn

texts.en: Agahuseyn Y. has made a living farming and raising cattle for the last 15 years. With two children and full responsibility for providing food for his family, he takes excellent care of his animals as a way to improve his family’s financial situation. Today, Agahuseyn needs to buy several calves so that he can raise them to sell when prices are good and he needs money. He is applying for this loan to make that purchase possible.

loans.use: to buy four calves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of 'pagnes' (African print cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of tufts of hair

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas A. is a 60-year-old farmer, and believes that he is the richest man in the world because he has 10 children. Abbas has two milk cows and makes a living selling dairy products to local customers and traders. He has more than 20 years of experience in this line of work, and his milk products are in very high demand in his village. Abbas cannot keep up with this demand, and has decided to apply for a loan for  1,600 AZN to buy two additional cows and fodder. Abbas is very grateful to everyone at Kiva who is helping him improve his life thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to buy two cows and fodder

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Emprendedoras es el grupo conformado por Elba C., Reyna M. y Olga R. tres mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y con muchos deseos de autosuperarse. La señora C. tiene un taller de carpintería oficio que aprendió de su padre y su especialidad es el diseño de muebles. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de madera, clavos, pinturas, pega, tornillos, bisagras, entre otros productos. 

Reyna M. vende prendas de oro y plata entre ellos anillos, cadenas, dijes y pulseras en distintos lugares y Olga R. tiene una tienda de ropa usada en su casa y vende también de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women Group is composed of Elba C., Reyna M., and Olga R., three determined, hard-working women with much desire to get ahead. Mrs. C. has a carpentry shop, a skill she learned from her father, and her specialty is designing furniture. She will invest her loan in buying wood, nails, paint, glue, screws, and hinges, among other things. Reyna sells gold and silver jewelry, including rings, chains, amulets, and bracelets in distinct places. Olga has a used clothing store in her house and also sells her goods on the street.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CARPENTRY SUPPLIES FOR FURNITURE MAKING

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El señor Jaime tiene 47 años está casado y tienen dos hijos, actualmente su esposa se encuentra en España trabajando, por lo tanto esta solo y dedicándose a su actividad y al cuidado de su hijos, don Jaime es muy responsable por que a pesar que tenía una oferta de trabajo en España junto a su esposa a decidido quedarse junto a sus hijos. Su actividad principal es la producción de leche cruda, cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para la construcción de un establo lo cual le servirá para la protección de su ganado ya que empieza la temporada de lluvia.

Entre sus sueños y metas se encuentra que sus dos hijos estudien una carrera profesional , aumentar  la producción de leche , realizar una construcción nueva a su casa y los mas importante vuelva su esposa para que puedan estar todos juntos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime is 47 years old, married, and had two children. At this time his wife is working in Spain, so he is caring for his children by himself. He is a very responsible person. Even though he had the opportunity to work in Spain with his wife, they decided that he should stay with his children. He sells raw milk to a processing plant that uses it to manufacture milk products. The money from this loan will be used to build a stable to protect his livestock now that the rainy season is beginning. His dreams and goals include: for his children to receive an education and become working professionals; to increase his milk production; build an addition to his home; and most importantly for his wife to return so that they can all be together again.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a stable

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Paz y Bien” se encuentra ubicada en la zona céntrica D. Huaycán, distrito D. Ate, departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 10 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace cuatro meses, quienes realizan diversas actividad producción, comercio y servicio.
Reyna Del Carmen quien a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 32 años, es madre soltera con tres hijos D. 5,6 y 14 años, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, calzado y juguetes desD. hace 4 años; empezó a raíz D. que se desempeño como vendedora  en un centro comercial, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria Reyna logro comprar su terreno y artefactos para su casa,  cubre los gastos D. luz y agua; ya que el padre D. sus hijos le apoya con la alimentación, salud y educación.
El reciente préstamo Reyna lo utilizara en la compra D. mercadería para la campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
The community bank "Paz y Bien" is located in the downtown area of Huaycan, a district of Ate, a suburb of Lima. It consists of 10 partners, working with EDAPROSPO. For the past four months, they have prospered in such work as production, trading and service. Reyna Del Carmen who has taken the role of president is 32 years old and is a single mother with three children of ages 5, 6 and 14 years. She has sold clothes, shoes and toys for the past 4 years. She began by being a saleswoman at the local shopping mall, and with the effort of her daily work, Reyna managed to buy her land and fixtures for her home, and in order to cover the cost of electricity and water, she started this business since the father of her children supported them with food, health and education. With the most recent loan, Reyna used it in to purchase merchandise for the Christmas holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes, shoes, etc. for the Christmas holiday season

loans.name: La Capulina Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Capulina está integrado por Esperanza del Carmen O., Esperanza del Socorro Reyes, Claudia Patricia S. y Doris Maricela P. C. cuatro féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras.

Esperanza del Carmen O. de 55 años desde hace 10 años ella empezó vendiendo tomate para poder sobrevivir, ya que la situación económica no era buena luego se introdujo al comercio de ropa por encargo.

Esperanza del Socorro Reyes de 40 años tiene un pequeño caramanchel de ropa en el Mercado Oriental desde hace siete años donde le ayudan sus hijos después de clase, Claudia Patricia S. vende ropa y Doris Maricela P. C. de 27 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Capulina Group is composed of Esperanza del Carmen, Esperanza del Socorro, Claudia Patricia, and Doris Maricela, four enterprising, struggling, hard-working women. Esperanza del Carmen is 55 years old, and 10 years ago she began selling tomatoes in order to survive. Since the economic situation didn't improve, she began selling clothing on commission. Esperanza del Socorro is 40 years old and she has had a small clothing stall in the Eastern Market for 7 years. Her children help her after school. Claudia Patricia sells clothing while Doris Maricela, 27 years old, has a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more poultry and increase his profits

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel D. de 48 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento con todos los servicios básicos su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Manuel comenzó su negocio porque quedo desempleado y necesitaba un ingreso para su familia con este empuje, dedicación y esfuerzo comenzó una pequeña tienda.

Ahora Manuel trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 con su esposa, comprar arroz a $ 0.30 y los vende a $ 0.35 la libra, atún los compra a $ 0.80 y los vende $ 1.00 c/u, colas a $ 0.75 y los vende a $ 1.00 c/u una de las mayores dificultades de su negocio es la competencia ya que el negocio esta ubicado en un sector comercial.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, y otros víveres para el negocio, en el futuro quiere expandir más su negocio y poder así mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuel D. is 48 years old and has a house constructed of cement with all basic services. His home is located on the Perimetral (ring road) of Guayaquil. Manuel started his business because he was unemployed and needed income for his family. With this inspiration, dedication and effort, he opened a small store. Today, Manuel works from 6 in the morning until 10 at night, along with his wife. They purchase rice at 30 cents a pound and sell it for 35 cents; they buy tuna at 80 cents and sell it for $1.00 a unit; and they buy bottles of soft drinks for 75 cents each and sell them for $1.00. One of the greatest challenges for their business is competition, since their shop is located in a commercial zone. With the funds from this loan, Manual wants to buy rice, sugar and other food products for his shop; in the future he would like to further expand his store so that he can eventually improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité se inicio mediante la iniciativa de la señora Angélica E. quien organizo toda para conformar la cooperativa ya que tenia muchas conocidas quienes querían trabajar  y de esa forma pudieron llegar junto  a la Fundación Paraguaya  y pudieron encontrar  ayuda  crediticia y técnica asistida método con se trabaja  dentro del proyecto  contacto Mujeres Emprendedoras.  
Cada integrante realiza una actividad diferente de acuerdo a las facilidades con que cuenta.
Así se comenta el caso de la señora Pastora P. quien se  dedica a la venta de comestible, ella tiene un pequeño copetín en la vereda de su casa en una casilla donde vende sus preparados como empanada , panchos, milanesas y gaseosa. Ella trabaja desde  muy temprano para lograr buenos ingresos para poder ayudar a su marido quien es albañil  y no posee un sueldo fijo para poder mantener a sus 5 hijos.
 Así la Sra, Pastora como muchas otras señoras lucha todos los días para lograr el bienestar de su familias.

La sra. Maria Leticia E. se dedica a la decoración, invirtió el dinero  el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo                                              de manera pueda ofrecer buena mas calidad en su trabajo a sus clientes.

La sra. Yolanda O. se dedica a la artesanía en cueros, invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo ( cuero, termos, pegamentos, accesorios) logrando ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías a sus clientes. 

La sra. Maria Liz M. se dedica a la venta de lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de Lencería en  general de manera que pueda ofrecer buena variedad y calidad de lencerías a sus clientes.

La sra. Angelina E. posee un despensa, invirtió su dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general ( azucar, harina, yerba, lacteos, etc.) logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías en general a sus clientes.

La sra. Mirtha Liliana A. se dedica a la costura, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo (telas, hilos, accesorios, etc) logrando de esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad de prendas  a su clientela.

La sra. Maria P. dedica es modista, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo (tela, hilo, accesorios) logrando de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de prendas a sus clientes. 

La sra. Cecilia B. se dedica a la venta de frutas invirtió el dinero en la compra de semillas y elementos para el cultivo de sus frutas.

La sra. Vicenta A. se dedica a la venta de Frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de frutas en general, logrando obtener mayor variedad de frutas que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Eusebia C. de R. se dedica a la venta de frutas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de frutas en general, logrando de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de frutas a sus clientes.

La sra. Zunilda Elizabeth R. se dedica a la venta de  verduras y frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de verduras y frutas en general (al por mayor).

La sra. Fabiana C. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ropas, para  ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Marcelina R. de Vera se dedica a la venta de ropa, invirtio el dinero en la compra de prendas de vestir en general,           obteniendo de ese modo variedad y calidad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Sonia Rosalina G. se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería, invirtió el dinero en la compra buena variedad de mercaderías para  sus clientes.

La sra. Francisca Pabla O. se dedica a la frutas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de frutas en general logrando de ese modo ofrece buena variedad de frutas a su clientela.
  
La sra. Mirtas G. de Ferreira se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboracion de los productos de limpieza, logrando asi  ofrecer buena variedad de productos de limpieza a sus clientes.

La sra. Elvia Antonia E. se decica a la decoracion de cumpleaños, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( accesorios, tela, cintas, etc.)logrando asi ofrecer calida en su servicio a su clientela.

La sra. Victoriana E. Q. es artesana, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, pegamento, cuero) logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad y calidad en su trabajo a sus clientes.

La sra. Alicia Raquel T. es Artesana, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( cuero, termos, pegamentos) logrando asi ofrecer variedad de mercaderias  a sus clientes.

La sra. Lilian E. Q. se dedica a la venta de artículos de  mercería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de artículos en general, logrando así ofrecer variedad de artículos a sus clientes.

La sra. Ramona Q. de E. posee un copetín, invirtió el dinero en la compra de bebidas, panificados, embutidos, etc, logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad de minutas y bebidas a sus clientes.

La sra. Sabina P. de R. es artesana, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cuero, etc.) logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad de mercaderías a su clientela.

La sra. Elena M. de R. se dedica a la venta de comestibles, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles, logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad de minutas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee was founded on the initiative of Angélica E., who carried out the organizational tasks to form the cooperative, since she knew many people who wanted to work, and in this way they could approach the Fundación Paraguaya together and find help with credit as well as technical assistance, by working with the project Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women). Each member pursues a different line of work, in accordance with her particular skills. For instance, in the case of Pastora P., she sells food, operating a small snack bar in a booth outside her home, where she sells her preparations such as empanadas, hot dogs, cutlets and soft drinks. She starts work very early in the morning so that she can receive a good income and help her husband -- who is a mason and does not have a fixed salary -- provide support for their 5 children. Like many other women, Pastora struggles every day for her family's well-being. Maria Leticia E. works in the area of decoration. She invested the funds in purchasing supplies for her business, so that she can offer higher-quality work to her customers. Yolanda O. makes handicrafts in leather; she invested the money in purchasing materials for her work (leather, insulated bottles, glue, accessories, etc.), so that she can offer an attractive variety of products to her customers. Maria Liz M. sells lingerie; she invested the money in purchasing a range of lingerie so that she can offer an excellent variety of good-quality products to her customers. Angelina E. has a small shop. She invested her funds in purchasing general merchandise (sugar, flour, herbs for traditional tea, dairy products, etc.), so she can offer a good variety of grocery products to her customers. Mirtha Liliana A. is a tailor. She invested the money in buying supplies for her work (fabrics, thread, accessories, etc.), so that she can offer a greater variety of garments to her clientele. Maria P. makes fashion clothing; she invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (fabrics, thread, accessories), so that she can offer a greater variety of outfits to her customers. Cecilia B. sells fruit; she invested the funds in buying seeds and supplies for fruit cultivation. Vicenta A. sells fruit; she invested the funds in buying fruit in general, in order to offer a greater variety of fruit to her customers. Eusebia C. de R. sells fruit of various kinds; she invested the funds in buying fruit in general, in order to offer a greater variety of fruit to her customers. Zunilda Elizabeth R. sells fruits and vegetables; she invested the funds in buying a variety of fruits and vegetables on a wholesale basis. Fabiana C. sells clothing; she invested the funds in buying clothes, in order to offer a broad variety of garments to her customers. Marcelina R. de Vera sells clothing; she invested the funds in purchasing a variety of garments, to achieve variety and quality in the articles of clothing she offers to her customers. Sonia Rosalina G. sells sewing supplies; she invested the funds in buying a good variety of merchandise to offer to her customers. Francisca Pabla O. sells fruit; she invested the funds in buying fruits in general, in order to offer a good variety of fruit to her clientele. Mirtas G. de Ferreira sells cleaning products. She invested the funds in buying supplies for preparing cleaning products, so that she can offer a good variety of cleaning products to her clients. Elvia Antonia E.'s business is decorating for birthday celebrations. She invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (accessories, fabric, ribbons, etc.), so that she can offer quality service to her clientele. Victoriana E. Q. is an artisan. She invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (straw, glue, leather), so that she can offer variety and quality in her work for her customers. Alicia Raquel T. is an artisan; she invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (leather, insulated bottles, glue), so that she can offer a variety of merchandise to her customers. Lilian E. Q. sells sewing supplies; she invested the funds in buying a general range of articles so that she can offer a variety of merchandise to her clients. Ramona Q. de E. operates a snack bar; she invested the funds in purchasing drinks, breads, sausages / sandwich meats, etc., so she can offer a variety of convenient foods and beverages to her customers. Sabina P. de R. is an artisan; she invested the funds in purchasing supplies for her work (straw, leather, etc.), so that she can offer a variety of merchandise to her customers. Elena M. de R. sells food; she invested the funds in purchasing ingredients to prepare her products, so that she can offer a variety of convenient foods to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and supplies for the members' diverse businesses

loans.name: Claudia Yessenia

texts.es:
La señorita Claudia Yessenia M., ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente. 
Claudia Yessenia  y su mama la señora Norma Alejandra E., se dedican a la elaboración y venta de alimentos, es por eso que desean tener otro negocio, pero en este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para invertir en el nuevo proyecto. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder acondiciona un local para la venta de abarrotes, y planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtendrá con este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia has already had a loan with FVP and she paid it off punctually. Claudia and her mother, Mrs. Norma Alejandra E., have been dedicated to making and selling food. And now they want to open another business. But at this moment, they don't have the necessary money to invest in a new project.

Claudia is requesting a loan in order to prepare a shop space where she can sell groceries. She plans to repay the loan with earnings obtained from this new business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PREPARE A PLACE TO SELL GROCERIES

loans.name: Oswaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Oswaldo José C. Canda, es un agricultor de la zona de Cobilaco, ubicado en la zona Rural del municipio de La concepción, gracias al apoyo de sus padres a logrado trabajar en sus cultivos de piña, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con recursos económicos para poder aplicar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una mejor producción y mejorar la calidad del producto,  don Oswaldo tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian y trabaja en el campo con el , los sueños es poder apoyarlos siempre en su estudios para que sean unas personas de bien , la esposa labora como comerciante en el mercado de Managua para cubrir partes de las necesidades del hogar , ya que son de familias campesinas y el dinero no le ajusta para cubrir todos los gastos . Contento con el financiamiento ya que comprara los fertilizantes para mejorar su cosecha de piña. También agradece Afodenic por el préstamo  y el plazo otorgado.
texts.en:
Mr. Oswaldo is a farmer in the Cobilaco zone located in the rural municipal zone of La Concepcion. Thanks to the support of his parents he has been able to work cultivating pineapple. The largest obstacle to this work is that he doesn’t have the economic resources to purchase fertilizer and other supplies necessary to improve the yield and quality of his harvest. Mr. Oswaldo has three sons that study and work on the farm with him. His dream is to be able to always support them in their studies because he hopes they will be good people. His wife works as a businesswoman in the market in Managua. She does this in order to help with the necessities of the home. They are country people and the money that they earn does not cover all their expenses. He would be happy with the loan that would pay for fertilizers that would improve his pineapple harvest. He thanks Afodenic for the loan and for their time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies that will improve his harvest.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro O.  solicitante es de la Ciudad d Guayaybi  Calle Toro Piru Mborumbi 2.,es propietario de un taller de moto y motosierra, anexo lavadero  y gomería.
Su negocio tiene  en su propia casa, con una clientela  bien formada, que le genera buenos ingresos.
El mismo lleva 5 años de casado con 2 hijos, y se encuentran trabajando hace 1 año en esa actividad y le hacen falta muchas herramientas para relizar su trabajo en forma optima.
Además de la reparación mediante el crédito otorgado pudo comprar cubierta nuevas para comercializar con sus clientes  y aumentar sus ganancias. 
  Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías varios, para surtir mas su negocio ya que estos meses hay mucha venta .
texts.en:
Genaro O. is from the city of Guayaybi and lives on Calle Toro Piru Mborumbi 2. He owns a motorcycle and chainsaw workshop, attached to a laundry room and tire repair shop. His business is located in his home and has an established customer base, which generates good income. Genaro has been married for 5 years and has 2 children. He has owned his business for 1 year and lacks many tools necessary to do his work well. In addition to business repairs, the loan would allow him to buy new tires to sell to his customers, thus increasing income. He requests this loan to buy various merchandise to stock his business with. There have been many sales in the last few months.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work tools for tire repair shop.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis P. es padre de familia, tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian 
Con un crédito anterior de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta los acabados del interior y exterior. Tiene el proyecto de poner buen material para que la casa este más segura y duradera.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la mejora que desea realizar y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene como guardia de seguridad de una compañía, ya que su esposa la señora Cecilia González se encargara de los gastos familiares ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
José Luis P. is a father; he has 3 adolescent children who are currently in school. With his last loan from FVP he constructed a room, but lacks the interior and exterior finishings. He wants to use good materials in his building project so that the house is safe and sturdy. He is requesting a loan for the improvement he wishes to make and plans to repay it with his income as a security guard for a private company. His wife Cecilia González covers household expenses through her work selling used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior finishings.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIMBANDI depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de poursuivre son activité de vente de bétail. En effet, elle achète des bœufs, les engraisse et les revend. Elle participe à l'éducation scolaire de ses enfants et au bien-être de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a 43-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de SIMBANDI for seven years and has obtained from it fourteen loans, which she always managed well and repaid.  Her loan is enabling her to pursue her business selling livestock.  Basically, she buys cattle, fattens them, and then sells them.  She takes part in educating her children and in the family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business selling livestock

loans.name: Idalia Maria

texts.es:
La señora  Idalia Maria tiene 38 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos
Uno esta casado y la de 17 años es la que le ayuda administrar el negocio, una pulpería, y una pequeña tienda de ropa, que ha mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener, con dinero propio de ahorro de su trabajo ya que trabaja como cajera para poder mantener el equilibrio en su negocio ya que muchas veces están bajas las ventas, por gracias a Dios ha logrado invertir en muchos productos de necesidad del cliente, da al crédito pero los clientes los selecciona ya que mucha gente no paga y tiene que saber a quien le da crédito. Con este préstamo lo quiere para comprar granos básicos, leche de pote, productos de limpieza, ropa variada para dama y niños, a si como comprar cosméticos para atraer nuevos clientes y poder tener una variedad, para sus clientes. Todo esto lo  ha logrado con apoyo de la institución gracias a sus financiamientos y su trabajo ha logrado salir a delante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Idalia Maria is 38 years old and a single mother of 2 children. Her son is married and her 17-year old daughter administers the business, a local store and small clothing shop. It took Idalia a lot of work to set up the store, using her savings from her work. She works as a cashier to maintain her business when sales are low. By the grace of God she has been able to invest in many products her customers need. She offers store credit, but only to select customers because many people don't pay and she has to approve who she gives credit to. With this loan she wants to buy staple grains, canned milk, cleaning products, and various clothing for women and children, as well as cosmetics to attract new customers and to offer a variety of products to shoppers. She has achieved all this with the support of the institution, AFODENIC. Thanks to this financing and her work, Idalia has been able to advance her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned milk, cleaning products, and clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Ruben Samuel

texts.es:
Rubén V. de 32 años de edad, vive en la zona de la Perimetral en Guayaquil, tiene todos los servicios básicos en su vivienda, Rubén comenzó trabajando en la Bahía de Guayaquil en un local de reparación de bicicletas, una vez que aprendió todo con respecto a reparaciones quiso ser independiente e instalo en su casa un servicio de reparación de bicicletas.

Rubén ahora trabaja en su local desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h00, una de las complicaciones que tiene es cuando hay los racionamientos de energía por parte del Gobierno y no puede realizar su trabajo, esta en unión libre con su pareja  en la que ella atiende una lavandería y ayuda con los gastos familiares,  tienen 6 hijos menores de edad y todos estudiando en escuelas fiscales.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar llantas y tubos para su negocio, en el futuro quiere vender repuestos de motos y poder así agrandar su negocio para que todos sus hijos puedan ingresar a la Universidad.
texts.en:
32 year old Rubén lives in the Perimetral area of Guayaquil and has all the basic services in his home. Rubén started out working at the Bahía de Guayaquil in a bicycle repair shop, but once he learned all about bicycle repair he wanted to be independent and so he started a bicycle repair business in his home.

Rubén now works in his place from 8 in the morning until 10 at night. One of the complications he faces is that when the government enforces power outages he cannot do his work. He lives with his common-law wife and she works in a laundromat and helps with the family expenses - they have six young children who all go to public school.

He wants to use the loan to buy tires and inner tubes for his business. In the future he wants to sell spare parts for motorcycles and grow his business so that his children will be able to go to university.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and inner tubes

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama N. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du BANC VILLAGEOIS de SIMBANDI depuis 7 ans et a eu 14 expériences avec le crédit. Depuis plusieurs années, elle vend des céréales, des arachides, de l'huile de palme et du miel. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adama N. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who are in her care.  She has been a member of BANC VILLAGEOIS de SIMBANDI for seven years and has had fourteen experiences with borrowing.  For several years, she has been selling grains, peanuts, palm oil, and honey.  This business brings in the profits enabling her to support her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her commercial business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a la garde et la charge de 03 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents et proches. Son crédit lui permet de mieux développer son activité de vente de balais, des balais fabriqués à partir des feuilles de palmiers. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 43-year-old woman who is married and without children.  She is the guardian of three children, who were entrusted to her by parents, friends, and relatives.  Her loan enables her to develop further her business selling brooms made of palm fronds.  She takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her commercial business

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
EL Señor Santiago D. Vera es de la Ciudad de Guayaybi, se dedica al negocio de venta de bebidas en general y minutas (empanadas, chipas, milanesas, croquetas, en la segunda actividad  su esposa le ayuda en la preparación de los comestibles.
También se dedica con sus hijos, a la venta y mantenimiento de Antenas Parabólicas,   por toda la zona de Guayaybi.
El negocio cuenta con algunas carencias como falta de herramientas de trabajo y mercaderías además de la necesidad de mejorar la casilla donde realizan sus ventas de comestibles como(pinturas´luces´butacas, carteles, mostrador), para brindar comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Santiago Dominiguez Vera is from Guayabi city. He has a business selling general drinks and snacks like empanadas, chipas, milanesas, and croquetas which are a variety of breads with different fillings. His wife helps with their preparation. With his children he also sells and maintains satellite dishes throughout the Guayaybi area. This business has a few shortcomings such as the lack of tools and materials. Also, they need to improve the store where they sell their food with things like artwork, lights, chairs, menus and a display case to make their clients more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools, materials and store improvements

loans.name: Ndèye Aminata

texts.fr: Ndèye Aminata S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du BANC VILLAGEOIS  de SIMBANDI depuis 6 ans et demi et a eu 13  expériences avec le crédit. Elle gère son petit restaurant où elle sert le petit déjeuné, elle vend parallèlement de l'huile de palme. Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui ont permis de participer à la construction de leur maison conjugal et à l'éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ndèye Aminata S. is a 40 year old woman who is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Simbandi for six and a half years, and has experience with thirteen previous loans. She runs a small restaurant where she serves breakfast and sells palm oil. The profits generated from her business allow her to contribute to the construction of her home and the education of her children.

Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforcing her business activities

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Comité “San Miguel” se formó con la unión varias vecinas de la ciudad de Guarambaré. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, la costura, preparación de comidas rápidas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.  Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
1
