Venta de Merceria 18 Angela B. Alonzo Venta de Escoba

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food supplies (meat, fat, fruits) and other groceries, as well Christmas items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Sebastiana

texts.en:
Maria Sebastiana G. T. is 58 years old and lives in the Isla Trinitaria zone of Guayaquil. This zone has scant basic services, but luckily Ms G.'s cane home has electricity and water.
Maria used to work as a cook in a restaurant. The gruelling schedule of this job left her tired from being on her feet all day. Five years ago, she was able to change careers by setting up a small grocery store. The top-selling products at her store are rice, sugar, and oil. This new position has allowed Ms G. to spend more time with her family and she is now less tired. She has two children, aged 16 and 19. The 16-year-old helps maintain the store from 6 am to 10 pm.
Ms G. is requesting a loan to buy more rice, cola, and sugar for her store. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions and secure her cane home.

loans.use: To purchase rice, cola and sugar for her store

loans.name: Lesbia Rosa

texts.es: Doña Lesbia tiene 55 años de edad, madre de cinco hijos, todos casados, su profesión es la costura, desde joven estudio el curso para la costura y lleva cuarenta años ejerciendo pues ha sido su fuente de ingreso para mantener  a su familia, de sus cinco hijos solo cuatro le ayudan económicamente, la falta de financiamiento no le ayudado a crecer en su negocio pues cose a los clientes y hace ropa para vender pero en poca cantidad, cuando inicio lo hizo con apoyo de su mama ya que adquirió experiencia junto con ella, el cual agradece infinitamente por el pasó que le permitió para poder trabajar, ya que hay ventajas por que pudo cuidar a sus hijos como trabajar a la misma vez. Con este préstamo desea poder hacer las divisiones de su casa ya que no tiene la privacidad  deseada, lo que a veces es muy incomodo para ella, pero por falta de dinero no ha logrado terminar este trabajo en su casa, solo a través del préstamo esta logrando las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 55 years old, the mother of five children, all married. She is a seamstress. When she was young she took sewing courses and has now been working in this career for 40 years. This has been the source of income for her family. Four of her children help her financially. A lack of financing has kept her from expanding her business. She sews for her customers and makes clothes to sell, but in small quantities. When she started, she had the support of her mother, and acquired experience alongside her, which she appreciates as it allowed her to gain experience in order to work, and she likes the advantages of being able to care for her children and work at the same time. With this loan, she will be able to put up partitions in her house, as there is currently no privacy, which has been uncomfortable for her at times. Because she didn't have much money, she could not do this work on her house; it is only through this loan that she is able to make improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: G.s. Pablo Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Pablo II está conformado por Gregoria y Petrona De Los Milagros ambas tiene diferentes actividades económicas, anteriormente ellas habían realizado financiamientos en Fundación León 2000 que son muy importantes para su negocio. Gregoria se dedica a la elaboración de repostería hace mas de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido de gran ayuda pues han sido muy importantes. Petrona en cambio se dedica a la elaboración de bordados para toallas, manteles y sabanas por lo que ambas ha puesto de su parte para solicitar este nuevo financiamiento para proporcionarle a sus negocios los materiales necesarios. Ellas sueñan con mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Pablo II group consists of Gregoria and Petrona de los Milagros. They each have different jobs. They have previously received financing from Fundacion Leon 2000, which are very important for their business. Gregoria has been a baker for over 16 years, which has been a great help to her. Petrona embroiders towels, tablecloths and sheets. They have requested this financing to purchase materials for their respective businesses. They dream of improving the living conditions of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo "Luz y vida" esta representada por la señora María Elvira y conformada por 21 miembros que ingresan a un primer ciclo dentro de la institución demostrando en sus reuniones previas mucho compañerismo y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. Cada una de las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de comida, pan, empanadas, abarrotes en tiendas comerciales, repuestos para motos, refrescos, hamacas y también a prestar servicios como portería, transporte en moto taxis y empleos en general. Las socias están concientes que lo que realmente hace la diferenta entre un negocio y otro es el trato que se brinda a los clientes para que se hagan fieles a los productos ofrecidos por las socias es por esto que no tienen mucha competencia en su mercado laboral. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas que les ayude a generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a su experiencia las socias cuentan con experiencia en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que tienen la capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados para hacer crecer sus negocios y mejorar cada día mas sus ingresos ya que de ello depende el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elvira represents the “Luz y vida” group which has 21 members. They are beginning the first loan cycle with the institution and have shown a lot of friendship and desire to work and get ahead in their prior meetings. Each one of the group members works at a different sales job such as selling food, bread, snacks, groceries in stores, spare parts for motorbikes, soft drinks, hammocks, and also in services such as doorman, transportation by motorbike taxis and general jobs. The group members are aware of what really makes the difference between one business and another, the treatment given to the customers so that they become faithful to the products offered by the group members. This is why they don’t have much competition in their job market. The purpose of the new financing is to acquire goods, supplies and tools that will help them generate better incomes in order to be able to give their families a better quality of life. As for experience, the group members have experience at institutions similar to the Agrocapital foundation. Therefore, they have the capacity to administer the funds granted to them, to grow their businesses and improve their income more each day since the well-being of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe  tiene 37 años de edad, procreo dos hijos, los cuales cursan el colegio, su esposo es jubilado, y de mucho apoyo, su pequeña casa es humilde de tabla y ya muy vieja por falta de dinero no ha logrado hacerla de concreto, por gracias a Dios esta trabajando como enfermera profesional desde hace catorce años,  aunque han sido muchas las limitaciones económica para su familia logro terminar su secundaria. Cuando inicio lo hizo como aseadora hospitalaria  y luego la ascendieron por que estaba pasando un curso, el cual fue una gran alegría poder trabajar en lo que le gusta y por que sus ingresos serian mejores. Con este financiamiento comprara piedra, arena, cemento para comenzar a construir una pequeña cocina  el cual es de mucha necesidad. Sus planes es poder terminar su carrera de medicina aunque es una carrera muy alta de costo es por eso muchos estudiantes no conseguimos terminar por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Doña Guadalupe is 37 years old and procreated two children who are in college. Her husband is retired and with much support, her small house is humble and already very old for lack of money. It hasn’t been made with concrete. Thanks to God, she has been working as a professional nurse for 14 years although there have been many economic problems to attain her secondary education.

When she started she worked as a hospital assistant and just advanced because she was passing a course. This was a big achievement that she can now work in what she likes and her income will be better. With this financing, she will buy rock, sand and cement to begin constructing a small kitchen which is much needed. Her plans are that she can finish her medical career although this is a costly career and it is for this reason that many students don’t finish their studies due to economic reasons.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rocks, sand, cement to build a small kitchen

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: El joven Carlos de 29 años de edad, casado, su esposa procreo tres hijos los tres estudian, ella trabaja como niñera para poder aportar con los gastos ya que todo esta caro y desean seguir mejorando su vivienda,  el se desempeña como  operario de maquinas de construcción desde hace tres años el cual espera poder seguir trabajando para poder terminar sus proyecciones. Con este financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción como: zinc, reglones, clavos, piedra, arena y cemento y comenzar la obra para hacer un bajarete en frente de la casa ya que le entra todo el sol y como su casa es baja es muy caliente por dentro es por eso la necesidad de poder hacer esta mejora para poder estar mas cómodo con su familia agrádese a la institución por el apoyo del financiamiento ya que hará posible uno de sus metas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man who is 29 years old and married. With his wife he has three children who all study. She works as a nanny so she can contribute to the household expenses as everything is expensive and they wish to continue improving their lives. He works as a construction machine operator and has waited for three years to continue working so he can finish his projects. With this financing, he will buy materials for construction like zinc, asphalt, hammers, rocks, sand and cement.

He can start the building work to put grating in front of his house so all the sun can enter. As his house is very low, it is very hot inside and it is for this they have the need to make this improvement so his family can be more comfortable. His family appreciates this institution for their financial support as it will now be possible to meet one of his goals.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rocks, sand, cement, zinc, asphalt and hammers to build grating in front of his house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una tienda de barrio que funciona en su domicilio, además atiende en su mismo domicilio un café internet y una sala de juegos de billar, vive en casa propia junto a su familia. El destino del credito será para para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad y otros productos navideños para venderlos en estas fiestas de navidad, es muy buena clienta por eso accedio al credito financiado por Kiva con tasa preferencial. La Sra. es una cliente muy cumplida y conocida por la institución ya que trabaja con nosotros desde nuestros inicios.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her own home with her family and operates a small grocery store, an Internet cafe, and a billiards game room in her home. She will use the financing to buy stock and Christmas items to sell during this Christmas season. She is a very good client, therefore, she received a very good interest rate on her Kiva loan. The Institution is well-acquainted with her and considers her to be a very responsible client; she has been with us since the beginning.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Daniela del Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 48 años  de edad,  desde hace veinte años puso una pulpería el cual administra todo esto lo ha logrado con apoyo de su esposo como los financiamiento que Afodenic  a dado ya que ha invertido en productos varios. Su esposo trabaja en construcción, procreo cinco hijos  tres independientes y dos están estudiando. Con las ganancias ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa, hace poco la pinto para que se viera bonita y poder atraer la clientela con una mejor visión de su pulpería. Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, pastas colgate, productos enlatados de sardinas, atún, salsa inglesa, salsa de tomate, pollo, carnes y lácteos para poder sastifacer las necesidades a su clientes ya que es lo que se consume día a día.  Sus créditos han sido para aumentar el inventario y para aumentar las ventas y mejor en esta temporada ya que espera vender más,  ya que las ventas  han estado bajas.Da las gracias a la institucion por los ciclos aprobados y por hacer posible su rentabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Daniela is a hard working woman. She is 48 years old and for the past 20 years she has run a small home-based grocery store. She has accomplished this with the help of her husband and with financing from Afodenic, which has allowed her to invest in a variety of merchandise. Her husband is a construction worker. They have five children, three of them are adults and two are students. Her earnings have allowed her to make improvements to their home. She recently had it painted so that it would look nicer and so that customers would be more attracted to her store. She will invest the money from this loan in basic items, such as: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soap, toothpaste, canned sardines, tuna, Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, chicken, meats, and milk products in order to satisfy the needs of her customers, as these are the things that they use daily. She has used her past loans to increase her inventory and sales. She hopes to do so this season, as her sales have been a bit low. She thanks the institution for approving her past requests and for making it possible for her to say in business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in basic food products for resale

loans.name: Fanny Rosmery

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a vender agua a diversos pobladores de las zonas alejadas del distrito que no cuentan con este servicio básico. El agua la extrae de un pozo hecho por sus abuelos en la casa donde reside. Ella la vende a un precio cómodo y las personas siempre recurren a ella, e incluso cuando se corta el suministro de agua en el distrito sus  vecinos acuden a su domicilio a solicitar el agua que necesitan.

Por otro lado también se gana la vida haciendo limpieza en algunas Instituciones de la zona, durante el dia divide su tiempo y visita a los locales e incluso casas que previamente han solicitado sus servicios. Estos dos ingresos son la única fuente de ingreso con la que su familia se sostiene.

Fanny ya ha trabajado con el fondo Kiva y esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas que la apoyaron. Durante los últimos meses ha estado ahorrando dinero y ha empezado a realizar uno de sus sueños: construir su casa. Las obras ya han empezado pero necesita completar el dinero para terminar de construir el techo de una habitación. Por ello se encuentra solicitando nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Fanny, 35, is a single mother of 4 children, who are 13, 10, 8, and 6 years old, respectively. They live inFanny's mother's house, which is located in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is located 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 15 years she has sold water to residents of isolated communities in the district that lack this basic service. She extracts the water from a well that her grandparetns dug on the property where she lives. She sells at a reasonable price and people always come to her. In fact, even when water supplies are cut in her district, neighbors come to her home to request water. She also earns income by providing cleaning services to some institutions in the area. During the day, she divides her time between these locations and even some private homes that have requested her services. These two activities produce her only source of income to support her family. Fanny has worked with Kiva in the past and she is very grateful to Kiva donors who have supported her. During the past few months she has been saving money to make one of her dreams come true: to build her house. Construction has begun but she needs additional funds to finish the roof on a bedroom. She is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternative for 300 new soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Rolando Vargas Quisbert

texts.es:
"Don Rolando, tiene 33 años de edad, es conductor de taxi vive en casa propia y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, se encuentra casado con doña Paola Lizeth, ella tiene como actividad, el manejo del un  Snack que se encontraba ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani; Don Rolando tiene como actividad principal la de chofer propietario de un taxi, y su otra actividad esta relacionada con la cerrajeria. 

El crédito que solicita está dirigido a la utilización como fondo en garantia de la nueva rotiseria que abriran en la av. Buenos Aires, ya que su rotiseria de la zona de Tembladerani no genera muchos ingreso y piensan cerrarlo para cambiarse a una zona comercial. "
texts.en:
Don Rolando is 33 years old and drives his own taxi to earn a living. He is married to Doña Paola Lizeth and they live in their own home with their two small children. In addition, he manages a snack bar located in the Tembladerani District. Don Rolando’s main business activities are driving his taxi and working as a locksmith.

This loan will be used as a security deposit for opening his new rotisserie shop on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Tembladerani District. The current rotisserie restaurant in the area does not generate much income and Don Rolando thinks it will close down and move to a commercial area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Security deposit for a new rotisserie shop

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 39 años, es madre soltera, y vive en la compañía de sus tres hijos que estudian y le apoyan mucho, en su  casa que es propia.Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, que comercializa  por los distintos caseríos o simplemente la intercambia con algunos productos comestibles que los lleva  a vender al mercado de su ciudad, en esta actividad ya tiene 1 año,  y le gusta mucho porque gracias a ella esta sacando adelante a sus hijos quienes valoran su trabajo y siempre sacan buenas calificaciones en señal de agradecimiento. Además este negocio le es muy rentable porque siempre vende toda su mercadería .Ya tiene pensado para el futuro  incursionar en la venta de papaya al por mayor.Es el segundo préstamo con MFP y  le gusta  mucho trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos tienen una buena relación y son muy organizados.
texts.en:
Anita is a 39 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her three school-age children who provide her with a lot of support. She sells used clothing in different villages or barters them for food products that she can sell at the city market. Anita has been in this business for a year and enjoys her work. Her children have been able to succeed because they value their mother’s work and always earn good grades in school to show their appreciation. Also, Anita’s business is very profitable because she is always able to sell all of her merchandise. In the future, she hopes to enter the papaya market as a wholesale vendor. This is her second loan with MFP. She is enjoys working with her Communal Bank because all the members have good working relationships and are very organized.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Reyneria

texts.es: Reyneria de 58 años, es casada y vive con sus dos hijos mayores, quienes trabajan y la ayudan; también con  su esposo, quien se dedica a la compra y venta  de madera, en su acogedora casa que  es propia.Ella vende gran diversidad de ropa para todos los gustos, tanto para adultos y niños; esta mercadería  la vende por las distintas calles donde vive, y semanalmente comercializa  por los caseríos cercanos o por la carretera, en esta actividad se desempeña ya  6 meses y le va muy bien ya que no tiene mucha carga familiar y solo se encarga de sus gastos y los de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona intercambiando ideas con sus clientes. Le es muy rentable porque sus productos salen a diario, y solo trabaja con pedidos. Posteriormente quiere alquilar un local en donde podrá aperturar su tienda de ropa.Es la segunda  vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque siente que existe compañerismo y sobre todo porque todos los integrantes son responsables.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo  en la compra  de mayor cantidad de ropa  para seguir vendiendo y además mandará a construir un pequeño kiosco para poner otro tipo de negocio (venta de bebidas heladas: gaseosas y cervezas).
texts.en:
Reyneria is 58 years old, married, and lives with her two adult children who work and support her. Her husband buys and sells wood from their cramped home. Reyneria offers a wide variety of clothing for adults and children that everyone likes. She sells her merchandise on different streets near where she lives and travels weekly to nearby villages or along the highway. Reyneria has already been in this business for six months and has done very well because she does not many family responsibilities and only assumes the expenses for herself and her husband. What she enjoys most about her work is traveling to different places and the social interaction with her customers. Her business is very profitable because her products are sold every day and she only works based on the orders she receives. Sometime later she wants to rent a space where she can open a clothing store.

This is her second loan with MFP. Reyneria likes her Communal Bank because there is a feeling of camaraderie and all the members are responsible. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan to buy a large quantity of clothing to keep her business going. In addition, she plans to build a small kiosk for selling cold beverages, such as sodas and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of clothing

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa y sus  hijos en su casa propia.Desde muy niño ha estado ligado a las actividades tanto agrícolas como ganaderas, y cuando empezó  su vida independiente al lado de su esposa vio que lo mas  rentable para su economía era  la actividad ganadera , desde entonces cría vacas y toros que le sirven para la venta de leche,además vende algunos de estos animales después de tres meses de engordarlos;  también tiene una granja  apícola  de donde extrae miel de abeja cada tres meses para venderla a buen precio en el mercado  de la urbe cercano a su localidad . Su más grande anhelo es mejorar la raza  de su ganado vacuno.Es la décima vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP,  y es uno de los mejores miembros  de su banco comunal y lo demuestra siendo parte de la junta directiva de su  grupo.El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y abono para la siembra de alfalfa que comercializa y además  es  el alimento indispensable de sus animales.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in their own home. Since he was a boy, he has been involved in agricultural activities such as raising livestock. When he became independent, he and his wife found cattle ranching to be financially profitable. Benjamin raises cows and bulls for dairy production. He also sells some of these animals after three months of fattening. In addition, he raises bees and collects honey every three months. Benjamin sells the honey at a nearby market and is able to command a good price. His greatest desire is to improve the breed of his cattle.

This is the tenth loan he has taken with MFP. He is one of the best members of his Communal Bank as demonstrated by his role as part of the group leadership. The money from his loan will be used to buy seeds and compost for planting alfalfa, which he sells and also uses as an essential food for his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa seeds & compost

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es: Guísela tiene 29 años y vive  con su pequeño hijo de 8 años en la casa  de un familiar.Desde hace 4 años decidió generar sus recursos propios y empezó a dedicarse a dos negocios en paralelo  que le eran muy  rentables, la venta de yogurt y  de verduras, es así que durante las mañanas  sale a  vender verduras de manera ambulante  en el mercado central de su ciudad ,y  a partir del medio día vende  en el mismo lugar su yogurt  hasta altas  horas de la noche; de esta manera logra obtener ingresos diarios que distribuye para las necesidades de ella y de su hijo. Guísela desea seguir progresando en la vida y uno de sus  anhelos es tener  un puesto de ventas estable donde pueda ofrecer sus productos sin problemas.Es la tercera oportunidad que  tiene un crédito con  MFP, por lo cual renueva su compromiso de ser responsable y puntual como siempre.Una parte del dinero lo invertirá en  la compra de  yogurt al por mayor y la otra en la compra de verduras.
texts.en:
Guísela is 29 years old and lives with her 8 year old son in the house of a relative. Four years ago, she decided to earn her own income by starting two profitable businesses at the same time selling vegetables and yogurt. In the mornings, she sells vegetables as a street vendor at the city central market. Starting at noon, she sells yogurt from the same spot until late at night. This is how she earns daily income to meet the needs for herself and her son. Guísela wants to progress in life and one of her goals is to have a stable vending location where she can offer her products without encountering any problems.

This is her third loan with MFP. Guísela renews her commitment to be responsible and punctual as before. Part of the proceeds will be used to buy yogurt wholesale and the remainder will go toward buying vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables & yogurt to sell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa que es propia.Realiza diversas actividades tales como la costura, cría animales y también se dedica a la agricultura que es la labor a la que dedica mas tiempo, sobretodo cuando se acerca la época de la siembra y cosecha; siembra papa, maíz, habas y arveja en grandes cantidades, y siente que su labor es recompensada cuando ve que su cosecha ha sido fructífera y puede comercializar toda su producción con mucho éxito en el mercado cercano a su comunidad, entre todos los productos mas rentables que siembra están el maíz y las arvejas por lo que esta analizando la posibilidad de incrementar sus extensiones de terreno.Es la 13ava oportunidad  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y su perseverancia en el banco comunal  es notable, es por eso que  se siente muy bien de pertenecer a su equipo ya que ella es una de las socias  más antiguas.Una parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su  próxima campaña de siembra y la otra  en la compra de telas para su pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 42 years old, lives with her husband and six children in their own home. She does many things such as sewing, raising animals and farming, which is the job that occupies most of her time; above all, when the planting and harvesting season approaches. She plants potatoes, corn, beans and peas in large quantities. She feels that her work is worthwhile when she sees her crops have been fruitful and she can sell the entire crop successfully in the market place near her neighborhood. Among all the most lucrative products that she plants is corn and beans. For this reason, she's analyzing the possibility of increasing her land holdings. This is the 13th opportunity she's had for credit with MFP, and her perseverance in the banking community is commendable. So, she feels very good belonging to this team now that she is one of the most long-standing members. A part of the money will be invested in buying sacks of fertilizer for her next planting and the other part in the purchase of looms for her small sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer for the next plantings

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely  tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo  y sus  2 hijos en una casa alquilada.Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, diariamente trabaja en los terrenos de cultivo que ha heredado de sus padres y siembra principalmente la papa, maíz, arveja y flores, su esposo  es el que realiza el trabajo rudo , y ella se encarga de vender los productos, mientras esperan la cosecha  crían diversos animales como carneros, cerdos y cuyes que tienen en su granja ;así tienen grandes expectativas para el futuro, y una  de ellas es la de adquirir mas extensiones de terreno para seguir sembrando gran cantidad de productos naturales.Es la sétima oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP y es una  de las socias más entusiastas que cumple siempre con responsabilidad con cada una de sus cuotas.El dinero del préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes para sembrar nuevamente.
texts.en:
Nely is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a rented home. Since childhood she has been a field worker. She works daily on the land that she inherited from her parents, where she grows potatoes, corn, peas, and flowers. Her husband does most of the physical work, while she is in charge of selling the products. While they are waiting for the harvest, they raise various animals, such as sheep, pigs, and others on their farm. They have great hopes for the future, including acquiring more parcels of land so that they can grow greater quantities of crops. This will be her seventh loan through MFP as she is one of the most enthusiastic and responsible borrowers, who has always made timely payments. She will use the money from this loan to buy bags of fertilizer so that they can prepare the land for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana  tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.DesD. hace 28 años se dedica a la venta D.  leña al por mayor, abastece a una buena parte D. comunidades aledañas a la zona donD. vive,  para realizar esta labor utiliza  2 instrumentos básicos que son una  motosierra y un camión, los cuales  adquirió recientemente  para transportar su  mercadería ; su esposo es el copiloto en el transporte y  siempre esta pendiente D. la extracción D. madera y también D.  la comercialización, D. esta forma  toda su familia participa  en el negocio que permite mantener la estabilidad económica . Ana desea tener  más capital D. trabajo para  abastecerse D. mercadería  y  así almacenar gran cantidad D. madera  para tener D. reserva en las épocas D. escasez.Es la  décima vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP y es una D. las socias más colaboradoras D. su banco comunal.El dinero del préstamo  lo utilizará  para abastecerse D. mayor cantidad D. madera y empezar a ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old, and lives with her husband and four children in their own home. For 28 years she's been selling timber wholesale, supplying a good part of her neighboring communities in the area where she lives. To do this work she uses 2 basic pieces of equipment: a power saw and a truck, which she recently bought to transport her merchandise. Her husband is the co-pilot in transporting the wood, and he is always keeping an eye on removing the wood as well as selling it. In this way the entire family participates in the business and maintaining their economic stability. Ana wants more working capital to stock up on merchandise and thereby maintain a reserve quantity of wood in storage during periods of scarcity. This is the tenth time she has received a loan from MFP and she is one of the most collaborative members of her community bank. The money from the loan will be used to purchase the majority of wood to begin to expand the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on timber wood for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 39 años, vive con su madre y sus 2 hijos en la casa que es propiedad D. su mamá.DesD. hace 6 años venD. granos al por mayor y menor, lleva la mercadería hacia otras ciudades y en ocasiones también venD. en su misma ciudad, además compra durante la semana y reparte los fines D. semana; por el tiempo D. permanencia en su negocio tiene clientes estables que consumen  sus productos y los cuales siempre están al pendiente D. ver que los granos que venD. (trigo, maíz, cebada) sean D. buena calidad. Desea  tener en el futuro una gran tienda distribuidora D. granos para ampliar y  mejorar su negocio.Es la quinta oportunidad que  tiene un crédito con  MFP, y  es una D. las socias más puntuales en sus pagosEl dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en impulsar su capital D. trabajo y también comprará varios sacos D. granos para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old, and lives with her mother and her 2 children in a house that is owned by her mother. For 6 years she has sold grains at wholesale and retail; she takes the merchandise to other cities, and on occasion also sells in her own city. She buys the grains during the week and distributes on the weekends. During the time she has had her business she has attracted regular customers who use her products and who are always on the lookout for grains to sell (wheat, corn, and barley) that are of good quality. In the future she wishes to have a large store where she can distribute grains to enlarge and improve her business. This is the 5th opportunity that she has had to take a loan with MFP, and she is a member who is very punctual with her payments. The money from this loan will be invested in boosting her working capital and also she will buy a number of sacks of grains to market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sacks of grain to market

loans.name: Unidas En El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
Marisol cuenta con algo de nostalgia que fue su ex esposo la que la impulso a dedicarse a la cocina. El era barman en un restaurante y siempre observo que la comida que servían no era buena y  la gente no estaba contenta el  siempre decía  que su esposa cocinaba mejor, es así que  consigue que la contraten para un evento y ese fue el despegue para que se haga conocida, con su buena sazón y con la ayuda de su mama es que empieza en este negocio. Ella  misma preparo sus tarjetas personales ofreciendo sus servicios a toda persona que conocía, de esta manera ella misma se publicito y los resultados fueron buenos por que la empezaron a llamar de todos lados. La contratan para fiestas de cumpleaños, aniversarios, eventos etc.
En verano también  se ayuda por que recibe contratos de familias para sus casas de playa, por lo cual obtiene buenas ganancias, también  vende productos herbalife todas estos trabajos la ayudan a cubrir sus necesidades y la de sus 2 hijos por que ella es separada y  los mantiene sola, a Marisol le agrada mucho la cocina y se siente feliz. Para mas adelante ya esta pensando en poner su propio restaurante donde pueda atender a todos sus clientes, lo que ahora hace es eventual y ella quiere algo seguro y estable, sabe  que en este proyecto  recibirá la ayuda de sus hijos  y de EDAPROSPO la entidad con la que se siente agradecida por que ha logrado muchas cosas, su actual préstamo lo va a usar comprando productos de herbalife por que tiene muchos productos por entregar a sus clientas.


*La Señora Marisol F. Es la que viste polo plomo
texts.en:
Marisol explains nostalgically that her ex-husband helped her become a cook. He was the barman in a restaurant and he always noticed that the food they served wasn’t good and the people weren’t happy. He always said his wife cooked better and that’s how she got them to hire her for an event. That’s how it took off and she became known. She started in this business with her good seasoning and the help of her mother. She made her own personal cards offering her services to every person she knew. She advertised herself and the results were good because they began calling her from all over. They hire her for birthday parties, anniversaries, events, etc. In the summer she also helps herself because she gets contracts from families for their summer houses. She makes a good profit for this. She also sells Herbalife products. All these jobs help her cover her needs and those of her 2 children. She is separated and she supports them herself. Marisol likes cooking a lot and she feels happy. She is already thinking of opening her own restaurant in the future where she could wait on all her customers. What she is doing now is temporary. She wants something safe and stable. She knows that she’ll have her children’s and EDAPROSPO’s help con this project. She’s thankful for the organization because she has achieved a lot of things. She’ll use her current loan to buy Herbalife products because she has many products to deliver to her customers. *Mrs. Marisol F. is the one with the gray shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE HERBALIFE PRODUCTS

loans.name: Mou

texts.en: Mou S., 26, is married and lives with her young child in Kampong Chnang province. Her husband is a taxi driver who makes around $10 USD per day, while she sells cake and school supplies. Mou S. is asking for a loan of $1200 USD, which will be used to reinvest in her business and fix her leaking roof.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and fix leaking roof

loans.name: Mab

texts.en: Mr. Mab P. is 40 years old and lives with the other members of his family in a small wooden house in Kompong Tom province. He and his wife earn a living by making rattan cupboards, and have been in this line of work for many years. He has applied for this loan to buy a horse to carry his products to market for sale. (Mab P. was not available on the day we took this photo, so we see his wife here instead of him.)

loans.use: To buy a horse to carry his products to market

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. Since 1995, she has been selling pork at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about US $33 in revenue per day, while her husband, pictured here, makes US $1 a day as a soldier. This couple has four school-aged children. Yem S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 she needs to complete the construction of her shop.

loans.use: To complete construction of shop

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn Y., 62, is married and lives with one of her children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She sells desserts and works as a farmer, making US $3 each day, while her husband also does some farming and works as soldier, making about US $3 each day as well. Sorn Y. is asking for a loan of US $200 to purchase another farmland to grow more rice. She sees this new rice field as a good economic investment and will use it to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun T., 20, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a garment factory worker and typically makes about US $2 of profit a day, while her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver and makes US $4 every day. This couple has two young children. Chhun T. would like to take out a loan of US $300 as her husband needs to replace an old and unreliable motorbike.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Kun R. is 24 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. Since 2005, she has been selling pork at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about US $6 of profit per day, while her husband, pictured here, makes US $2.50 a day as a motorbike dealer and a also fixing televisions. This couple has two young children. Kun R. is asking for a loan of US $1000 as her husband needs to purchase motorbikes for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mr. Vet So Of The Village Bank Group

texts.en: This is for a village bank loan, a group which consists of nineteen people, and they all live in Krouch village in Kandal province. Mr. Vet S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He alS. owns a rice milling machine. His wife, Mrs. Haen Kal, uses the rice to make wine to sell. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Vet S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. He is 65 years old and the father of a child who helps the parents work. Mrs. Koy Ny M. did not come to take a loan but her husband is, S. he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn L. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Merlyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a good housewife, living at home and looking after her two children. Her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver who is able to make about US $3 of profit every day. This couple also is supported by the children who are garment factory workers. Em S. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 as her husband needs to purchase a taxi. This will allow her husband to earn more than before.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Thien

texts.en: Mrs. Thien T. lives in Bram Bei Mum village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Em Phat, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they earn not much income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Thien T. decided to ask for a loan to add her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband, to be motorbike taxi driver. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living with this loan. She is 41 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary M. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a fish seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khoem Horn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sary M. is 51 years old and the mother of seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: By purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer P. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Jennefer is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennefer owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of coconuts in the local community. Jennefer has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

In 2009, Jennefer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennefer is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jennefer from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha L. is a villager in Preal village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Now she wants to expand her breeding pigs business; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy four more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Huon, is a teacher in the local teacher. This couple has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is just 2 years old. Her husband and a child are presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy four more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs.S. is a humble villager who lives in Kompong Tom province. She was born in 1966 and is raising a family, which has seven other members. To make a living, S. sells a few groceries in front of her home and earns an average of $2 a day. She is married, and two of her children work while the other four attend school. Her husband earns a living as a military policeman in Cambodia's Ministry of the Interior. She has been very busy at her business because many clients want to buy her products. To meet the needs of her customers, S. has applied for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn L. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has five adult children.

Merlyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L. is from the village of Walkway, Bonbon, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old, single, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling souvenir items, such as t-shirts, blouses, and other items, in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Evangeline joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy C. lives in Tea Sa Kyvy village in Takeo province. She is 32 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. Channy C. is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Yan Ouch, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he uses the rice to make products to sell. Now Mrs. Channy C. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and pig food.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pig food

loans.name: Danilyn

texts.en:
Danilyn E. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Danilyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Danilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Danilyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Mr. Noeurn N. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. He is 35 years old and the father of three children who attend the local school. Mr. Noeurn N. is a duck breeder. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks for breeding to earn more income. His wife, Mrs. Sin Lai, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is shown with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn C. is 40 years old and lives in Pour village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Uch Sam Ol, is a soldier. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one of whom is a construction worker, and the other two of whom are enrolled in the local school.
Mrs. Sorn C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her soil is infertile, it has a lot of insects, and it is far from an irrigation system. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna D. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Rosanna is single and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosanna owns & operates a business buying and selling coconut in the local community. Rosanna has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosanna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosanna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosanna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosanna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy H. lives in Trapeang Ta Uy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces some problems because her field has infertile soil, a lot of insects, and is far from an irrigation system. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Kam Sothy, is a fisherman. Mrs. Savy H. is 29 years old and the mother of three children. One of her children attends the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline

loans.name: Merasol

Merasol D. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro. She is 30 years old. Merasol is married and has two school-aged children. Merasol has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom K. is a villager in Sra Mor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy farming supplies to support her rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline, and to pay for plowing. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sovan, is a duck breeder. Mrs. Sokhom K. is 40 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children stays at home to do housework, three are enrolled in the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, & gasoline, and to pay for plowing.

Mario M. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. He is 54 years old. Mario is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mario owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells both food & daily use products in the local community. loans.name: Jory

texts.en:
Jory S. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Jory raises crops, mainly planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month. In 2007, Jory joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jory is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeun T. is a villager in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which affects her crop. To deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Saer An, is a fisherman who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Saroeun T. is a mother of six children. Three of the children attend the local school, two are farmers and the youngest one is four years old and too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev R., 30, is a low-income person living in Kompong Tom. To earn a living, Khiev R. built a stall next to her house, in which she raises many pigs to sell. Khiev R. is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband helps deal with the family’s financial situation by working as a salt trader. Besides their businesses, the family cultivated a rice crop during the farming season. Khiev R. needs a loan to buy cow, which she will raise for plowing the farmland or for breeding in the future.

loans.use: To buy cow

She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma C. is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a "sari sari store", selling a variety of products such as sugar, canned goods, soap and toothpaste to local community members. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Mrs. Soun K., 55, owns a large plantation that she inherited from her grandparent, where she plants many kinds of fruit from which to earn a living. She grows papaya, jackfruit, coconut, and mango, which she will sell when they are ripe. Her husband assists with her in planting crops. He owns a small garage where he provides a vehicle washing service. Soun K. has seven children: one is married and the others single. Two of them are employed: one son is a painter and one daughter farms rice. Soun K.’s son has had a painting trade for years, but he doesn’t have a good location for his service. That is why Soun K. is applying for a US$1200 loan to purchase a shop.

loans.use: To purchase a shop

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita O. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Pablita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Pablita owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members using her motorcycle. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Pablita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch U., 61, is a widowed mother of three children who are already married and employed at different jobs. One of her daughters, who is in the picture above, assists her in weaving silks.

To makes a living, Touch U. owns a few looms on which she weaves silk skirts to sell (the silk skirts that Cambodia’s people wear to join in wedding parties or traditional ceremonies). She also weaves many sets of silk before selling and almost all of her clients need to wait a few days or a week in advance.

Recently, Touch U. got orders from her regular customer and so is asking for a loan to buy more necessary raw materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more necessary raw materials

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Mr. Larry J. is a rice farmer. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. He keeps himself strong so he can do good work at the farm. He wants to have an abundant harvest to improve his income. Difficulties are not absent from his life, but he is eager to face them and move on.

Larry is now preparing his land for the next planting. He lacks finances so he sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines and a KIVA partner. He applied for a loan of 9,000 PHP. He will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. He will also buy crude oil for the tractor. This loan will surely help Larry in his goal of having an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San P., age 45, is a hard working woman who currently lives in Banteay Meanchey province, about four hundreds kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Here she has established a small family with other members. 

Presently she owns a hand cart which she uses to sell fried meatballs by hawking (selling) around her district and she normally earns approximately $3 per day. 

San P. is married to Bunsong, 49, a car repairer. This couple has been blessed with eleven children. San P. will be using her loan to decorate her cart and to buy essential ingredients for her enterprise.

loans.use: To decorate her cart and to buy essential ingredients.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B., from the village of Pandan, Mambajao Camiguin Province, is 47 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marina sells eggs and sometimes longganiza (sausage) in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is now requesting a new loan, her second, of 6000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Marina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Rice farming is Jerry J.’s way of living. He is 58 years old, married and has three children. His oldest child is sixteen years old. He doubles his effort in doing his farming duties to have good harvest. He has to provide for his family and his children’s education. Jerry shares with us that he is now preparing his land for planting. He makes sure his crops will grow healthy on his land. He lacks financially so he applied to CEVI for a loan. He applied to borrow PHP 9,000. He will use this loan to purchase farm necessities such as seeds and fertilizers. This loan will help Jerry have a good harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works on the farm for a living. She is 59 years old and resides in a town in Agusan Del Sur. She tends her farm for rice crops, which is one of the major agricultural crops in her province. Her income comes from farming alone. She hopes though that someday she would be able to expand her business or engage in another type of business.

Lilia is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The main reason she joined the MFI is her inability to finance her business. She requested to loan PHP 7,000. She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. is from the town of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Rebecca owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Roek

texts.en:
Roek R., 49, is a determined and  hardworking woman who resides in the best territory of Banteay Meanchey, a province of Cambodia.

Presently Roek R. owns a small store along the street located near the taxi parking. At her store she sells some snack foods and soft drinks to the taxi drivers and passengers.  She can make an income of about US $5 a day and uses it to meet her family’s needs.

Her husband works with her in her business selling items. Roek R. now has three married and three single children.

Roek R. will be using her loan for different purposes. She will decorate her old house and build a bathroom for her family’s sanitation. With the rest of the loan, she will increase the financial capital of her business.

loans.use: To decorate an old house and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Margarita

Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margarita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Margarita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old and widowed with one adult child. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been in business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Saom C., 50, is a married mother who is blessed with two school-aged kids – a boy and a girl – who assist her in her business when they are not studying. To generate a daily revenue, she built a small shop in front of her own family home where she sells meats and soft drinks, mostly to her neighbors. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who is a recycling seller. Rice will command its lowest price in this coming season, so Saom C. thinks that it is an opportune time to generate additional income by buying rice in bulk from farmers, which she will resell.  It is for this purpose that she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 59, is a farmer. She plants rice on her land. Now a widow, she makes sure to enjoy farming duties as she spends most of her time there. She wants to double up her harvest so she works hard to achieve that. Her farm is the only source of income she currently has.

Maria joined CEVI early this year, and this is her third time to ask for a loan. She said that her previous loans were really helpful to her business. She is now requesting for a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies needed at her farm. This loan could help Maria reach her goals.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta V. is a woman with big dreams and the bravery to fight challenges in order to achieve her dreams. She is 59 years old and married to Alfredo V., 60, who is a fisherman. Her children have their own families with whom they live. Violeta lives in the town of Tanay, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a chance of having start-up capital for generating income. During her first loan in ASHI, she carefully invested it in her fishing business and it gave her a reasonable income. Now on her seventh loan, she requests 20,000 PHP for the revival of her fishing business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase a white fishnet, green fishnet, black fishnet, rope, bamboo and labor expenses. This loan will help her business, which was destroyed from a huge typhoon, ”Ondoy”. 

As a mother, Violeta dreams of sending her grandchildren to school and on to completing college degrees and finding jobs for a better living. She hopes that her business will expand for them so they will have savings for future use. She also enjoys seeing that the loan from ASHI will change their lives and accommodate her family's needs. Through the support of ASHI, Kiva partner, she will, step-by-step, realize her dreams.

loans.use: Purchase of white fishnet, green fishnet, black fishnet, rope, bamboo and labor expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Lucia is 30 years old and is married to a driver. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Almarina

texts.en:
Almarina L. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use and make more alcohol to sell. Almarina is 40 years old and is widowed. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more materials to use and make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie T., 51, is a rice farmer. She has four adult children. She is seeking additional capital for her business so that she will be able to have an abundant harvest to buy her family an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crops well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 41, is married and blessed with five children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Jocelyn owns a Calamansi (a citrus fruit) farm and also raises pigs. She works hard for her family and to give her children proper education. She also hopes to expand her business.

Jocelyn is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and this is third time to apply for a loan. Her previous loans were used to finance her farm and her hog-raising business. She is now applying for 9,000 PHP. This loan will be used for feed and other farming needs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, 50, does farming for a living. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is 19 years old. 

Marcelina helps her husband tend their rice farm. She also plants fruits and vegetables to have another source of income. She wants to provide for her family’s growing needs and save for her children’s education. She sought the help of an MFI in the Philippines, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She has applied for a loan of 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that she lacks. This loan will help Marcelina grow her farm immensely.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Alai

texts.en:
Alai M. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans, maize flour and rice to sell. Alai is 28 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.
