loans.use: To stock bags of beans, maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Nedilen

texts.en:
Nedilen O. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Nedilen is married and has 4 school-aged children. Nedilen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector rating a fishing business, buying fish for sale. Nedilen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nedilen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nedilen is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used towards expansion of her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Nedilen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the needs of her family.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa A. is from the village of Maluno. She is 43 years old and married with children.

To make a living Nerissa sells personal products from Avon, such as lotion, deodorant, perfumes, and other home products in the local community. Nerissa has been engaged in her business for several years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nerissa joined ASKI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nerissa is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mtama Kulanga Group

texts.en:
Tatu M. is a widow with two children, aged 14 and 10.  She has a business selling vegetables, fruits, water, juice, cooking oil and paraffin.  She has been in this business for six months now, and works from 8 am until 8 pm every day. Tatu manages to make a monthly profit of around $91.  She hopes for a loan to buy a weighing machine so she can start selling sugar, wheat flour and rice.  This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group,  Mtama Kulanga,. The group has 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Tatu is in the first row, third from the left, in the corner wearing a head cover.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine so she can start selling sugar, rice and wheat flour

loans.name: Rosaline Chepwambor

texts.en:
Rosaline is 36 years old, married and is blessed with four children. She runs a cereal business at Tarakwa 
in Eldoret. She has applied for a loan from KADET, which she intends to use to buy more cereals for her store. 
Her future dreams are to grow her business and be able to build a permanent store for her cereals,  
and also be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is  61, married and is from Agusan Del Sur. She has ten children;  her oldest, who is 35, no longer lives with them. Margarita is involved in rice farming, which supplies her income to feed, clothe and sustain her family. Currently, she is short of capital for her business. She applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of Php 7000. She will use this loan to finance her farm and hopefully get a better income from the next harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 55, married and has six children; her oldest, who is 30, does not live with them. She works hard on her rice farm and is now preparing the land for planting. She requests a loan of Php  7,000, which she will use to buy seeds and fertilizers. She will also pay the laborers who help at her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Dan Omondi

texts.en:
Dan O. is 35 and married to Catherine Omondi, who sells vegetables to earn a living. They have two children, Kevin and Diana. They live in Kisumu city, near the shores of Lake Victoria. 

Dan has a Grinding (Posho) mill business, where he grinds maize into maize flour for his clients. Dan has been in this business for the last five years and his clientele has grown tremendously due to the high demand for maize flour in the area. He only has one grinding machine and is not able to meet the demands of his customers.

Dan hopes to get some money from Kadet Ltd to buy another grinding machine and employ one more person to help him run the business. 

He is currently educating his brother’s children, who are orphans, and he hopes to use the profits to pay their school fees and improve his family income.

loans.use: Buying an extra grinding machine

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 53 years old. Lilia is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as drinks, mineral water and grocery items in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Eucila

texts.en: Eucila is 36 and has been married to Felipe for 16 years. They have five children; the oldest is 16. Eucila plants rice on her farm and works hard to produce high quality rice, a food all Filipino's eat. She wants a better income to provide for her family’s growing needs. Eucila needs additional capital for her farm. She applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of Php9, 000, which she will use to purchase farm supplies. She will also buy diesel for the tractor. This loan will surely help Eucila in her business.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia, a 56-year-old entrepreneur, is married to Bonifacio, and they are blessed with four children, the oldest being 33 and independent.  Lilia is involved in rice farming and also owns a rice mill but admits that she still needs additional capital for her business. Like other mothers, she wants to improve her family’s living condition. A member of CEVI, which she joined for its financial services and to be an active businesswoman, she is now applying for a loan of Php9,000 to finance her farm. This loan will surely help Lilia in both her business and her goals in life.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C., from the village of Centro 2, is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store whose income is derived from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a 50-year-old married woman, blessed with four children. Her oldest is now 23. She lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur, where most of the people are farmers. She is also a farmer. She cultivates her land, raising rice crops. She also makes ice candies and sells them to her neighbors. She believes that if she works hard enough, she could be successful someday.

Rosela joined CEVI in 2008. She likes its program and said that it is a big help to farmers like her. She is now applying for a loan of Php 9,000. She will use this loan to purchase farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jovelie

texts.en: Jovelie married at an early age. She is still only 20 years old, married for three years and has two kids. She is involved in rice farming. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband is also a barber and has his own shop. Jovelie shares that she is happy to have the businesses her family has. She wants to maintain them and save for her children’s future. She also mentioned that she still needs additional capital for their farm. The farm is being prepared for planting and it needs farm inputs. She applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of Php 9,000, which will be used to finance the farm. This loan will help sustain Jovelie’s rice farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita B. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 49 years old. Chita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Chita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Chita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Chita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Chita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nitty

texts.en:
58-year-old Nitty is a married woman with one child. She is a rice farmer. She helps her husband till their land. When her husband is not too busy on the farm, he uses a motorcycle to transport people around the community. The income her husband gets provides for her family’s daily needs.

Nitty needs additional capital for her farm, which she cannot provide right now. She has applied to CEVI and requested a loan of PHP 9, 000. This loan will be used for seeds, fertilizers and other farm implements.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Nsasa Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Rose is 36 years old and the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is married and has 4 children aged 12 – 18 years, all of whom attend secondary school. She hopes to see her children achieve the highest possible level of education.  

Rose has a drug shop business that she has owned for 10 years. Because she operates in a rural setting, many customers pay for her merchandise on credit, and though it is sometimes difficult to collect the money she is owed, she is still able to make 140,000 UGX in profit every week. She says that her good customer care keeps her customers coming back to her, which has allowed her to plan an expansion. She is a very determined lady, and she needs a loan to be able buy more drugs for her drug shop.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
49-year-old Julieta is a farmer. She is married and has nine children. Her oldest child, who is now 30, does not live with them anymore. She cultivates rice on her land, and also plants vegetables, which she sells. 

Julieta joined CEVI in 2008 to gain access to financial services. She wants to be an active entrepreneur. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 9,000, which will be used for farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. This loan will help Julieta grow her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Glory Jean

texts.en:
At 25, Glory Jean already has two children with her husband Allan. Her eldest child is only five years old, her source of inspiration to work hard. She wants her children to have proper education and a better future.

Glory Jean is involved in rice farming. Aside from that, she runs a small sari-sari store. She joined CEVI a year ago to gain access to financial services.

She is now applying for a loan of 9000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies. She will also add inventory to her general store.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks in the local community known as "suman". These are made of rice with coconut milk wrapped with banana leaf. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and for her children’s education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina, 56 years old, is a married woman with four children. She is engaged in a rice farming business. She helps her husband till their land for rice crops. She also makes hotcakes and other delicacies which she sells around the community.

Like any other mother, she wants her family to be happy and well provided for their needs. She wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

As Florentina needs additional capital for the farm, she has applied to CEVI and requested a loan of 5000 PHP. She will use her loan to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Mr. Norberto C. is a father with two children. He has been married to Victoria since 1998.

Norberto is a rice farmer and he also drives a tricycle. He uses his income from driving to buy feeds for the pigs he raises. He works hard for his family and his children’s education. He wants all of them to have proper education and to have a decent job someday.

Norberto joined CEVI in 2007 and is grateful for the opportunities he gained access to. He is now requesting to borrow 10000 PHP. He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will surely help Nortberto maintain his farm

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Loreta's Group

texts.en:
Loreta P. is from the village of Villa D., Angadanan, Isabela.

She is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Loreta is 42 years old. She is married and has 4 school-age children. Loreta operates a general store where she sells food and daily use products to the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Loreta joined ASKI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her fourth loan, for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. Loreta plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kanemu Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
S. Musa is the leader of his lending group in Mpigi. He is a hardworking and devoted man still single with no child of his own but he takes care of two dependents.

Musa has a retail shop in Kibibi that he has owned for two years and he is able to make 100,000/= a week as profits from his sales. He says that he is successful because he is so hardworking plus having a ready market for his goods.

Musa hopes to expand his business further as well as educate his children plus have a much better life from what he has today. He needs a loan to be able to buy more goods for his shop since loans help with increased investment and hence more profits. This is his first loan and he hopes his business will grow much bigger.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Amador

texts.en:
Amador is a 51-year-old farmer. He is married and has six children to take care of, his oldest child being 23.

Amador tills his land for rice crops. When free of farming duties, he uses his skills as an electrician, repairing broken appliances. He works hard to provide for his family, especially his kids’ education.

Amador has been a member of CEVI for quite some time now. The financial service he obtains is really helpful to his business. He is now requesting a loan of  Php 10,000 which he will use to finance his farm. He will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mbalwa Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Margaret is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 52 years old and a widow with three children aged 29 to 21 years with only one child still at the university. Margaret also helps to take care of two orphans.

Margaret has had a poultry business in Namugongo for twenty years from which she is able to earn 200,000/= a week as profits. She says that her major challenge is lacking enough feed although her major business trick is being able to feed her chickens well.

Margaret needs a loan to be able to buy more feed for her chickens as well as booking more day old chicks for business expansion. In future, Margaret needs to build rentals for an increased monthly income.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens and to book day-old chicks

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en: Rosefina D. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two children: one adult and one student. Rosefina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling surplus shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Rosefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosefina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to support the school expenditures of her student child. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Wantoni B Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Robert is the leader of his group in Mukono. He is a single parent with two children of whom one is in school while the other is not yet in school.

Robert has a retail shop in Wantoni and also has an office that caters for girls and boys that would like to find employment like maids, shamba boys (gardeners) and casual laborers.

Robert is grateful for his previous loan because he was able to make profits that helped him pay his workers and save. He needs a new loan to be able to restock his shop with more goods so as to make more profits.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Ivunamba Group, Jinja

texts.en:
M. Mariam is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hardworking and devoted lady with a business selling new clothes from Ivunamba. Mariam sells mostly ladies’, children’s, and girls’ clothes plus bags and belts which she buys from Jinja main town and at times from Kampala, depending on the sales and the season.

Mariam needs to buy more new clothes and shoes for her shop to be able to make more sales during the Christmas season. The profits she makes from it would help to pay her children’s school fees and general welfare.

Mariam takes care of some dependents.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Olga Mario

texts.pt:
Olga Mário M. nasceu no Distrito de Chokwe, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos e 1 enteado de 14, 12, 5 e 2 anos de idade, onde os 2 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu do Distrito de Chokwe para cidade da Matola devido a guerra de destabilização em 1983 com os seus pais. Em 1999 saiu com seus pais para Boane afim de fixar sua própria residência, onde vivem actualmente. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 20 anos, aprendeu esta actividade com sua mãe na Matola quando tinha 10 anos de idade e faz cerca de 10horas por dia. Não possui nenhum empregado, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através das autoridades comunitárias durante os encontros de mobilização. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, ovos, farinha e outros) para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 11.000.00mt para Habitação e comercio.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de habilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Olga Mário was born in the District of Chokwe, in the Gaza Province, in the South of Mozambique. She is 31 years old, married and the mother of 3 children and one stepson who are 14, 12, 5 and 2 years old. The two oldest are in school. She only went to school until the 6th grade due to her parents lack of financial resources. She owns the house where she lives with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left the Chokwe District to go to Matola with her parents due to the destabilization war of 1983. In 1999, she left with her parents to Boane in order to establish the home where they now live. She has had her own business for over 20 years. She learned the businees from her mother in Matola when she was 10 years old. She works around 10 hours a day. She has no employees and makes around 7.000.00mt a month which goes towards house expenses and savings.

She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through community leadership during mobilization meetings. This loan, in the amount of 8.000.00mt, is her fourth. She intends to purchase supplies (beans, eggs, flour and others) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt and 11.000.00mt and were used in housing and her business.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her construction and offer better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of vegetable oil and others

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: S. Félicienne est née le 07 Mars 1975 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Félicienne est mariée à KIKI Gérard, un peintre auto. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Sègbèya, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Félicienne vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, lait, mayonnaise, riz) et aussi des tissus à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Félicienne s'approvisionne. Félicienne a huit ans d'expérience dans ce métier, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Félicienne a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. Félicienne rencontre actuellement quelques difficultés financières. Félicienne voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroître son activité, afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Félicienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Félicienne was born on March 7, 1975 in Ouidah, a historic village in Benin.  She is married to KIKI Gérard, an automobile painter.  The couple has three children who are all in school.  The family lives in Sègbèya, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  The couple provides for the family jointly.  To address her needs and to ensure that her children's needs are met, she sells a variety of goods (pasta, canned foods, milk, mayonnaise, rice) and also cloth, out of her home.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stocks up.  Félicienne has eight years of experience in this trade and is now on her third ALIDé loan.  She repaid the two loans she had obtained from ALIDé.  Right now, she is meeting with a few financial difficulties.  She would like to increase her working capital and to grow her business, so as to satisfy her customers better.  For these reasons, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying canned foods, mayonnaise, and sacks of rice

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma T. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 31 years old, is married, and has four children. Two of them are are in high school and elementary grade while the remaining two are infants. Irma owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Irma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Irma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Cristina Tomas

texts.pt:
Cristina Tomas D. S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade, divorciaD. e mãe de 3 filhos de 18, 14 e 12 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

 Nunca mudou de cidade continua a viver em Maputo desde a infância, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 4 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Aprendeu esta actividade com suas amigas que o exercem ha mais de 7 anos, consegue um rendimento mensal de 2.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainD. poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas de Xitique que também são clientes. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, ovos, farinha, sabão, açúcar e outros) para aumentar o volume D. sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 8.000.00mt todos para mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no comércio e concluir a sua obra para oferecer melhores condições de habilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Cristina Tomas was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in the South of Mozambique. She is 42 years old, divorced and the mother of 3 children who are 18, 14 and 12 years old. All of the children are in school. She only went to school until the 6th grade due to her parents lack of financial resources. She owns the house she lives in with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has lived in Maputo all her life. She has had her own business for over 4 years and doesn't have any employees. She learned the activity from her friends who have been in the business for more than 7 years. She makes 2.500.00mt a month which goes towards house expenses. She saves some money through "Xitique", a traditional rotational savings system.

She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through her "Xitique" friends who are also members. This loan, in the amount of 8.000.00mt, is her fourth. She intends to purchase supplies (cooking oil, eggs, flour, soap, sugar and others) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt and 8.000.00mt and were used for the same activity.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to invest in her business and finish her construction to offer better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna AlmeiD.-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (soap, cooking oil, rice and others)

loans.name: Sergio Vasco

texts.pt:
Sérgio Vasco B. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de 1 filho de 4 anos de idade. Fez somente 5ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 4 irmãos que vivem com ele.

 Nunca mudou de cidade continua a viver em Boane desde a infância, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 10 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Aprendeu esta actividade com os pais e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia, onde vende mais cerveja, refrescos e vinho. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt por semana, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrigerantes, vinhos e outros) para aumentar o volume e diversificar a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt para mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir uma viatura como forma de facilitar o transporte da sua mercadoria e ainda para aplicar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Sérgio Vasco was born in the District of Boane, in the Maputo Province, in the South of Mozambique. He is 27 years old, married and the father of a 4-year old. He only went to school until the 5th grade due to his parents lack of financial resources. He owns the house where he lives with his family and 4 siblings he also supports.

He has lived in Boane since his childhood and has never lived anywhere else. He has had his own business for over 10 years and has no employees. He learned the businees from his parents and works around 10 hours a day. He sells mostly beer, sodas and wine. He makes around 2.000.00mt a week which goes towards house expenses and his savings account.

He has never had loans from other banks. He came to know about Hluvuku through his neighbor who is also a member. This loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, is his second. He intends to purchase supplies (beer, sodas, wine and others) to increase and diversify his inventory. The previous loan was for 7.000.00mt used for the same purpose.

In the future, he would like to request more loans to buy a car to make transporting his inventory easier and to invest in his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (beer, sodas and others)

loans.name: O. Rosine

texts.fr: O. O. Rosine est née le 11 Septembre 1981 à Sakété dans le département de l’Ouémé au Bénin. Rosine vit au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. Mariée à IFOUWEMI A. Mathias un transitaire, Rosine est mère de deux enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Agbato. C’est surtout le mari de Rosine qui assure les charges de la famille. Mais Rosine vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne l’entretien et l’éducation des enfants. Rosine n’a pas été à l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Rosine exerce ce métier depuis 6 ans. Rosine vend également des mèches et des produits pour cheveux dans son atelier situé à Agbodjèdo à Cotonou. Rosine s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rosine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Rosine voudrait renforcer son capital afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
O. O. Rosine was born on September 11, 1981 in Sakété, Ouémé County, Benin.  She has been living in the Agbato district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for a dozen years.  Married to IFOUWEMI A. Mathias, a forwarding agent, Rosine is the mother of two children, both of whom are in school and living together with their parents in Agbato.  Her husband in particular ensures that family expenses are covered.  But she works in aid of her husband concerning the care and education of the children. Rosine did not attend school but learned how to style hair.   She has been working at this trade for six years.  She also sells hair extensions and hair products in her salon, located in Agbodjèdo in Cotonou.  She stocks up from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  She has already benefited from two loans from ALIDé that have been repaid.  She would like to bolster her capital in order to increase her inventory of goods, so as to satisfy her customers further.  This is what's leading her to requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and hair products

loans.name: Lourino Sergio

texts.pt:
Lourino Sérgio B. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade. Fez 12ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa da mãe e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Maputo para a vizinha Republica da Africa do sul a procura de emprego em 2006, mais tarde regressa a casa e consegue um emprego como motorista numa das empresas em Boane. Aprendeu a 8 anos numa escola de condução em Maputo, faz um horário único das 7.30h as 15.30h. Para além do Salário, tem também um negócio próprio onde vende cervejas, refrescos e outros produtos. Deste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 500.00mt diário que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Já teve empréstimos no banco PROCREDITO e mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrigerantes, vinhos e outros) para aumentar o volume e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt e 10.500.00mt todos para mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de voltar a estudar e solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua obra mobilar a casa e contrair o matrimónio.
texts.en:
Lourino Sérgio was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in the South of Mozambique. He is 31 years old, is single and the father of a 5-year old. He went to school until the 12th grade but didn't graduate due to lack of financial resources. He lives in his mother's house and supports two nephews who live with them.

In 2006, he left Maputo to neighboring South Africa to look for a job and returned home later. He found a job as a driver for a company in Boane. He learned to drive 8 years ago at a driving school in Maputo. He works from 7:30am to 3:30pm. Besides his salary, he has his own business where he sells beer, sodas and other products. His business makes 500.00mt a day which goes towards house expenses and his savings account.

He has requested loans from PROCREDITO bank but decided not to continue to. He came to know about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a member. This loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, is his third. He intends to purchase supplies (beer, sodas, wine and others) to increase and diversify his inventory. The previous loans were for 7.000.00mt and 10.500.00mt and were used for the same purpose.

In the future, he would like to go back to school and request more loans to finish his contruction, furnish his home and get married.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (beer, sodas and others)

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr: T. Latifatou est née le 01 Juillet 1979 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Latifatou est mariée à DASSI Gafari et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Latifatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Gbénonkpo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Latifatou  vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Latifatou n’a pas été à l’école. Il y a environs 7 ans que Latifatou mène comme activité principale, la vente de friperies de façon ambulante. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, Latifatou a commencé également la vente de jouets. Latifatou s’approvisionne à Missèbo à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Latifatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour agrandir davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
T. Latifatou was born on July, 1, 1979 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to DASSI Gafari and is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  She lives together with her children and husband in the Gbénonkpo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She works in aid of her husband to cover family expenses.  Latifatou did not attend school.  For about seven years, she has been running a business selling second-hand clothing door-to-door.  As the year-end holidays approach, she has also started selling toys.  She stocks up at Missèbo in Cotonou. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  She's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé to expand her business further and to do better in satisfying her customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying toys

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 46 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.  Theresa is a focused, hard working woman. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her business selling foodstuff at retail prices. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She wishes to thank all Kiva lenders.

Theresa is a LAPO client. During our visit to her stall, she was about to go to the market to purchase more foodstuff to sell.  The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rui Zacarias

texts.pt:
Rui Zacarias B. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 36 anos de idade, casado sem filhos. Fez somente 8ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa dos pais, pois a sua ainda esta em construção e sustenta os seus pais e 3 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

Nunca saiu de Boane, desde a infância ate hoje ainda continua vivendo lá. De profissão é motorista numa empresa denominada SUNDAWS na cidade de Maputo e nos tempos livres faz trabalhos de construção civil. Trabalha das 8.00h as 17.00horas, tem um salário mensal de 6.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu pai que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco e porta) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.300.00mt e 5.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt todos para mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua obra mobilar a casa para oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Rui Zacarias was born in the District of Boane, in the Maputo Province, in the South of Mozambique. He is 36 years old, married with no children. He only went to school until the 8th grade and didn't finish due to his parents lack of financial resources. He lives at his parents' house because he is still building his own. He supports his parents and 3 nephews who live with them.

He has never left Boane, he has been living there since childhood. He has a job in Maputo as a driver for a company called SUNDAWS. In his free time he works in construction. He works from 8am to 5pm and makes 6.000.00mt a month which goes towards house expenses and his savings account.

He has never had loans from other banks. He came to know about Hluvuku through his father who is also a member. This loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, is his fourth. He intends to purchase construction materials (cement, zinc plates, and door) to continue with his construction. The previous loans were for 8.300.00mt, 5.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt, all used for the same purpose.

In the future, he would like to request more loans in order to finish his construction, furnish his house and provide his family with better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, zinc plates and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling consumables

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Z. Félicienne est née en 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à MOUSTAPHA Latifou un tailleur, Félicienne est mère de deux enfants. Seulement un enfant est scolarisé. Le second n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou depuis près de deux ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Félicienne n’a pas été à l’école.  Pour satisfaire ses besoins, Félicienne vend divers produits (pâtes dentifrices, brosses à dents, pommades) de façon ambulante. Félicienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Il y a trois ans environs que Félicienne exerce cette activité. Félicienne a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. Félicienne rencontre en ces périodes, de difficultés financières. Félicienne voudrait renforcer son capital afin de maîtriser les diverses exigences de ses clients. C’est la raison pour laquelle Félicienne sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Félicienne Z. was born in 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Latifou Moustapha, a tailor, and is the mother of two children. Only one of them attends school, while the other is still too young. The family has been living for nearly two years in the neighborhood of Gankpodo in Cotonou. The couple provides together for the family. Félicienne did not attend school.

Félicienne hawks various products (toothpaste, toothbrushes and pomades) to make a living. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for about three years. She got once a loan from Alidé and repaid it on schedule. Félicienne currently encounters financial hardship, which is why she wants to increase her working capital to meet the various demands from her customers. Therefore she came to Alidé and applied for a second loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, toothbrushes and pomades

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell jewels, colored sticky labels and medals

loans.name: Felismina Abrao

texts.pt:
Felismina Abraão M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 1 filho de 10 meses de idade. Fez 12ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu filho e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Nunca saiu de Maputo, desde a infância ate hoje ainda continua vivendo lá. Tem um negocio próprio amais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e faz um horário das 7h as 18horas todos os dias. Aprendeu esta actividade com os seus pais onde vende mais cerveja, refrescos e vinhos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrigerantes, cervejas, vinhos e outras bebidas alcoólicas) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt os dois e todos para mesma actividade.
 
Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para fixar um estabelecimento comercial convencional e aumentar ainda mais a quantidade diversificada da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Felismina Abraão M. was born in Maputo, south of Mozambique. She is 29 years old and a single mother to a boy who's 10 months old. She finished 12th grade but had to drop school due to financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her son and doesn't support anyone else. She never left Maputo. She runs her own business selling beer, wine and soft drinks for the past 10 years. She learned this activity from her parents, she has no employees and works from 7AM to 6PM every day. She makes around 2.500,00MT (U$80) per month which she uses for household expenses and saves some every month. She has never had loans with other banks and this is her 3rd loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 10.000,00MT (U$350) in order to buy more merchandise (soft drinks, beer, wine and other alcoholic beverages) to diversify her products and improve her business. Her previous loans were also for $350 and for the same reason. She is hoping to pay this one in time like she did with the others so in the future she can ask for another loan to open her own liquor store and improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Beverages for reselling

loans.name: Nulu's Group

texts.en: Nulu L. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hard working and friendly lady with a strong sense of humor and school-going children. She takes care of other siblings and orphans also in school. Nulu has a salon business in Mpumudde village from which she is able to make profits that help her run her home as well as contributing to her children’s education with the help of her husband. Other sources of income are a transportation business in which she contracts someone to ride a motorcycle, cows at home, plus a kiosk. She says that her major challenge is not having enough capital to make her salon much bigger. Nulu needs a loan to be able to buy more braids and weaves since most people like to plait their hair during certain seasons. She would also like to stock some hair chemicals and hair goods for business continuity.

loans.use: To buy more braids, weaves, and hair goods for the expansion of her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes

loans.name: Mounirath

texts.fr: Z. Mounirath est née en 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mounirath vit depuis 8 ans environs à Hlacomey à Cotonou. Mariée à HOUESSOU Mondja, un couturier, Mounirath est mère de deux enfants. Seulement un enfant est scolarisé ; le second ne l’est pas encore. Mounirath vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Mounirath n’a pas été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Mounirath vend des pâtes dentifrices de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Mounirath s’approvisionne. Mounirath exerce cette activité depuis environs 6 ans. Mounirath a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Mounirath sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mounirath Z. was born in 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living for approximately eight years in the neighborhood of Hlacomey in Cotonou. She is married to Mondja Houessou, a tailor, and is the mother of two children. Only one of them attends school, while the other is still too young. Mounirath lives with her children and her husband. The couple provides together for the family. Mounirath did not attend school.

Mounirath hawks toothpaste to make a living for herself and her children. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for about six years. She got once a loan from Alidé and repaid it on schedule. She came now to Alidé and applied for a second loan to boost her activity level and better meet the demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell beef, goat and mutton meat

loans.name: Omukayembe Bakyara Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: K. Lydia is 50 years old and married with 6 children. Three are still in school and she takes care of three dependants. Lydia is a business lady selling produce from Mukayembe Trading Centre for four years. At the start of her business, people sold maize, but now things are changing, and she is changing too. She now sells other produce, like matooke and cassava, too. Lydia is able to make a 25,500 profit per week. She says that this is mostly attributed to the location of her business, and in the future, Lydia would like to become a wholesale supplier of produce. She needs a loan to be able to purchase maize grains to increase her existing capital and make some more profit for school fees. Lydia is so friendly and would like to see that her children are well off.

loans.use: Purchasing more maize grains for increasing capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Mr. Huon S. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is an ice cream seller. Since his business is doing well, he needs some more money to buy a motorbike to transport the ice cream to sell. He hopes to increase his income and improve his business with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Chet Rith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Huon S. is 29 years old and the father of two children who are just 5 and 3 years old. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes

loans.name: Gift Of Kasina Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: James K. is a friendly and hard-working man. He is married with one child and has a retail shop, a business that he started one year ago in Kasina Local Council One. In the shop, James sells mostly general merchandise, and he is able to make a 22,500 profit per week. His dream is to become the leading retailer in town. He is also involved in a brick laying business and works closely with his wife in both businesses. He needs a loan to be able to lay more bricks with the help of a few hired men so that he can make as many bricks as possible in just a short while.

loans.use: Employing laborers to help with his brick laying business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mr. Long V. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Muon Ny Mol, is a cake seller. Now Mr. Long V. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living with this loan. He is 30 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Paula Pedro

texts.pt:
Paula Pedro B. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 28 anos de idade, casada mãe de 1 filho de 8 anos de idade que vai a escola. Fez 10ª classe, parou porque na altura esteve grávida e sofreu uma operação durante o parto, obrigando lhe parar durante longo período. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela e de vez enquanto ajuda seus pais na cidade de Maputo em despesas alimentares.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane em 1998 com o seu esposo para iniciar um novo lar. Tem um negocio próprio desde 2004, conta com um empregado e faz em media cerca de 8 horas por dia. Aprendeu esta actividade com a sua tia que fazia o negócio na cidade de Maputo desde 1989,onde vende mais refeições, humburguers, e refrescos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal. 

Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito THUMA, por varias insatisfações decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (frangos, peixe, carne, refrigerantes, cervejas, vinhos e outras bebidas alcoólicas) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 7.000.00mt ambos para mesma actividade.

Um dos sonhos é comprar uma carinha basculante para carregar areia e pedra para a comercialização.  
Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para o comércio e terminar a sua obra.
texts.en:
Paula Pedro B. was born in Maputo, south of Mozambique. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of a 8 year old boy who goes to school. She studied until 10th grade but had to drop school because she got pregnant and had to had a surgery during her pregnancy. She lives in her own house with her family and a sister who lives with them. She also helps her parents who still live in Maputo with money for food. She left Maputo to start a new life in Boane with her husband in 1998. She has had her own business since 2004, where she sells meals, burgers and refreshments. She makes around 9.000,00MT (U$290) per month, that she uses to support her household and put some away in a savings account. She has had other loans with the credit cooperative THUMA but was unsatisfied with them. She found out about Hluvuku through a friend who's also a client. This is her third loan in the amount of 10.000,00MT (U$350) that she'll use to buy more food products (chicken, fish, meat, soft drinks, beer, wine and other alcoholic beverages) to diversify what she sells and improve her business. Her other loans were for the same purpose. One of Paula's dreams is to buy a tilting carriage in order to carry sand and rocks and sell it around. In the future she would like to get more loans in order to improve her business and finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry S. lives in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Yi Sam Ath, are farmers who own 3-hectare field of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm, they face an obstacle because their field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Ry S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the rice farming. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to support rice farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes

loans.name: Arc-En-Ciel Plus Group

texts.en:
Godet K. is a leader of a community bank named “Arc-en-Ciel Plus,” “Rainbow” in English, which is composed of 26 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Godet, 37, single, sells shoes. He has been in business since 1988. He has acquired solid experience and his business has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. With the next loan, he intends to purchase 25 pairs of shoes to increase the inventory of his business. Currently, he earns a profit of about $20 every week. His dream is to open a general boutique in his area.

loans.use: To purchase 25 pairs of shoes to sell in order to reinforce the working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy T. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this farm, she needs some money to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support the rice farming. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Ty, is a construction worker. Mrs. Thy T. is 50 years old and the mother of a child who is a farmer and helps with the farm work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support the rice farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy deep-frozen food

loans.name: Cornelio Nera

texts.pt:
Cornélio Nera M. nasceu na cidade de Pemba, Província de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique, tem 59 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 22, 21, 16, 11 e 07 anos de idade todos vão a escola. Fez 8ª classe, parou quando foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da cidade de Pemba para Boane sozinho cumprindo serviço militar em 1969, mais tarde fixou sua residência e foi buscar a sua família. Tem um negocio próprio desde 1979 altura em que ficou desmobilizado, não tem empregado e faz em media cerca de 12 horas por dia. Para alem desta actividade recebe uma pensão de desmobilização no Ministério da defesa no valor de 4.209.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal. 

Já teve empréstimos na antiga organização da cooperação Suíça Helvetas que já não esta trabalhando, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento e maquina de fabricar blocos) para a construção do murro de vedação na sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 2.500.00mt e 8.000.00mt ambos para mesma actividade.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aquisição de uma motobomba para a sua machamba e para a conclusão da obra.
texts.en:
Cornélio Nera M. was born in Pemba, Cabo Delgado Province in Northern Mozambique. He is 59, married and the father of five children aged 22, 21, 16, 11 and 7, all of them students. He finished 8th grade but had to drop school when he was drafted to the army. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else. He left Pemba to Boane during his army years in 1969, and later on he fixed residency there and started a family. He has his own business since 1979, at the time when he became disabled. He has no employees and works around 12 hours per day. Besides his business, he also gets a monthly disability check from the army in the amount of 4.209,00MT (U$135), which he uses to support his family and put some away in a business account. He heard of Hluvuku from a friend who's also a client and this is his 3rd loan in the amount of 10.000,00MT (U$350) that he'll use to buy construction supplies to build a wall in his house. His previous loans were for 2.500MT and 8.000MT for the same purpose. In the future Cornelio hopes to get more loans to buy a motor pump for his machamba (a large garden where crops are grown that provide most all the food for the people in the villages) and to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell groceries

loans.name: Korb

texts.en: Mrs. Korb N. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sophal, is a duck breeder. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Korb N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food for breeding. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions and pagnes

loans.name: Suubilyamukama Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en: Josephine N. is a married lady with five children. The eldest is at the university and the last born is still in primary school. She also takes care of orphans. She has had a boutique in Jinja for over 15 years selling new clothes like gomesi (colorful full-length dress), bitenge (similar to sarongs), and casual wear. Although she says that she has challenges, like transportation costs and inconsistency in the quality clothes, she is able to make a 150,000 profit per week. This is attributed to her good customer care skills and the availability of stock due to her loans. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier and build a house for her children as their mother. She needs loans for business growth, because they help her have a steady supply of products and school fees. She is such a hard working lady who wants the best for others.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: I. Colette est née en 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Colette est mariée à AGBOTON Florent, un vendeur de madriers. Colette a deux enfants, mais un est scolarisé. Le second enfant n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. Colette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Il y a deux ans de cela que la famille s’est installée au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Colette n’a fait que l’école primaire. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Colette vend depuis trois ans, des pâtes dentifrices et des pommades de façon ambulante. Colette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Colette a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Colette désire agrandir son activité afin d’acquérir de nouvelles parts de marché. C’est la raison pour laquelle Colette sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Colette I. was born in 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Florent Agboton, a merchant of construction beams, and is the mother of two children. Only one of them attends school, while the other is still too young. Colette lives with her children and her husband. Two years ago the family relocated to the neighborhood of Adogléta in Cotonou. The couple provides together for the family. Colette attended only primary school.

To help her husband to provide for the family, Colette has been hawking toothpaste and pomades for three years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She got once a loan from Alidé and repaid it on schedule. Colette wants to expand her activity and get new market shares. Therefore she came to Alidé and applied for a second loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell fish

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha T. is 35 years old and now lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She has three children, one of whom is a laborer and helps the parents’ work and the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Tha T. is rice soup seller. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Bo, is a farmer who owns 5.5-hectare (13.75-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

On this plantation, Mrs. Tha T.’s husband faces some problems because his field has infertile soil and has a lot of insects which are damaging his crops. Thus, Mrs. Tha T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline in order to support his rice farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline in order to support her husband's rice farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell light sandals

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mr. Choeun S. is a villager in Roung village in the Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Saom Koy, is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more duck food and ducks for breeding. Thus, Mr. Choeun S. decided to request for a loan for this purpose. 

He is 40 years old and the father of five children, two of whom help the parents work while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing more ducks for breeding and duck food

loans.name: Suubi Lyamukama Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
J. Milly, 50 years old, is a hardworking and friendly lady. She is married with eight children, some of whom have gone to the University while the others are in secondary school. She also takes care of orphans who are also in school.

Milly has been a businesswoman with a poultry and farming business in Kitigoma for eighteen years and her major challenge for her poultry business is the scarcity of water for her chickens. For the farming business, she has had experience since childhood. She is able to make 200,000/= as weekly profits and she attributes this to her good customer care and the loans that increase her capital.

In future, Milly would like to become a wholesale supplier of chickens and eggs to big hotels, eating places, schools and universities plus build rentals for her children’s education in future while she is gone.

Milly needs a loan to be able to buy insecticides for her farming and feed for her chickens for better growth.

loans.use: To buy insecticides for her plantation and feed for her chickens

loans.name: Noussirath

texts.fr: Z. Noussirath est née en 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Noussirath est mariée à HOUNHOUI Louis, un électricien auto. Le couple a deux enfants, mais un est scolarisé. Le second enfant n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou, depuis environs trois ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Noussirath n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a cinq ans déjà que Noussirath mène comme activité, la vente de pâtes dentifrices, des médicaments et des pommades, de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Noussirath s’approvisionne. Noussirath a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Noussirath rencontre en ces périodes, des difficultés d’ordre financières. Noussirath voudrait rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux satisfaire la demande des clients. C’est pourquoi Noussirath sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Noussirath Z. was born in 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Louis Hounhoui, a car electrician. They have two children. Only one of them attends school, while the other is still too young. The family has been living for approximately three years in the neighborhood of Adogléta in Cotonou. The couple provides together for the family. Noussirath did not attend school.

Noussirath has been hawking toothpaste, drugs and pomades for five years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She got once a loan from Alidé and repaid it on schedule. Noussirath currently encounters financial hardship, which is why she wants to boost her activity level to better meet the demand from her customers. Therefore she came to Alidé and applied for a second loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, drugs and pomades

loans.name: Ney

texts.en:
Mrs. Ney S. lives in Chung Ankor village in the Takeo province. Her husband is presented in the picture. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy farming supplies to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support the rice farming. 

Her husband, Mr. Pin Phum, is a construction worker. This couple has a child who is just 2 years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support rice farming

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn B. is 45 years old and she lives in Roung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sam Kim, is a duck breeder. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Since her husband’s poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it. In order to do this, Mrs. Vorn B. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducklings to raise and duck feed.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings and duck feed for her husband's business

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: E. Antoinette est née le 26 Octobre 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SOTON Mathieu,  Antoinette n’a pas encore d’enfant. Antoinette vit ensemble avec son mari au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, depuis 4 ans. Antoinette  n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Antoinette vend des chaussures à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est aussi dans ce même marché que Antoinette s’approvisionne. Antoinette a 11 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et est à son sixième crédit à ALIDé. Antoinette a bien remboursé les cinq crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Antoinette sollicite ce sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans l’optique d’élever davantage le niveau de son activité et ainsi de faire face à la demande de plus en plus  nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Antoinette E. was born on October 26, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mathieu Soton and hasn't yet children. She has been living for four years with her husband in the neighborhood of Agbato in Cotonou. Antoinette did not attend school.

To meet her daily needs, Antoinette sells shoes in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She also gets her supplies at this market. She has 11 years experience in this trade. She came to Alidé and applied for her sixth loan. She repaid on schedule her previous five loans from Alidé. Antoinette applies for this new loan to boost her activity level and thus meet the ever increasing demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea P. was born in 1983.  She now lives in Chung Ankor village in Takeo province, where she resells mats. Her husband, Mr. En Kloem (shown at left), is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice.  Mrs. Phea P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline, as well as buying more mats to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's standard of living as a result of this loan. This couple has two children.  One attends the local school, the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, gasoline, and more mats to resell.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa S. is 53 years old and lives with her husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband drives a truck between their hometown and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where more than 30% of the Mongolian total population resides. Tsetsegmaa runs a small food store at the center of the town. She sells basic food products such as soft drinks and cookies.  Her store is conveniently located right next to a secondary school, so most of her customers are students and their parents. Tsetsegmaa says that her daily income is pretty good. 

She purchases her food products from wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar and her husband usually transports these goods.  Tsetsegmaa would like to expand her business by adding more varieties of food products that her young customers would like to purchase. She is requesting a loan so that she can offer a greater variety of products in her store.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Buhbaatar

texts.en:
Buhbaatar B. is 44 years old and lives with his two teenage children in Gobi-Altai province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Since his wife's death two years ago, he has been caring for his two children and running his small business, selling livestock raw materials. Buhbaatar buys the skin, hide and meat of cattle, sheep and goats from local families. He sells these materials at a higher price in the local market. 

Buhbaatar has been in this business since 2003.  He has many herders who like selling their livestock's raw materials and meat to him. Before his wife's death, he and his family moved from the countryside to the town where they currently live. He says that he bought the house that his family lives in with profits from his business.  In the future, he would like to replace the furniture in his home, as it is old, and some pieces are broken.  Buhbaatar adds that he is working hard to set aside some money to open a saving account for his children. He requests a loan to purchase skin, hide and meat for his small business.

loans.use: To purchase skin, hide and meat to resell

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan T. is 29 years old and currently lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two daughters are 2 and 8 years old. 

Amgalan is a talented carpenter. He runs a small wood carpentry and processing shop, called "Arts Ovor."  He started this wood processing business with his father in 2000. When he started, his capital was about 450,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,450 MNT). Since the start, his small business has grown and now his working capital has reached  3,500,000 MNT. He hopes to expand his business and eventually buy a small car for his family. He requests a loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood
