Ahignon assure toute seule ses charges. Ahignon n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge, Ahignon vend des œufs dans les cafétérias. C’est à Abomey Calavi, non loin de Cotonou, que Ahignon s’approvisionne. Ahignon a 15 ans d’expérience dans ce métier et est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Ahignon a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu de ALIDé. C’est dans l’optique de renforcer son capital et de rehausser son activité, que Ahignon sollicite ce deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Ahignon is born in 1966 in Benin. She is a widow without a child. Ahignon has been living alone for two years in Cocotomey in the district of Abomey Calavi in Benin. Ahignon takes care of her expenses all alone. She has not been to school. In order to take care of herself, she sells eggs in the cafeteria. She gets her supplies in Abomey Calavi, not far from Cotonou. Ahignon has 15 years of experience in this work and she is on her second loan from ALIDe. She has repaid correctly the first loan that she got from ALIDe. Ahignon is requesting a second loan from ALIDe with the aim of strengthening her capital and revamping her business.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 70 crates of eggs

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder es un joven trabajador de 35 años, es soltero y vive solo en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la fabricación de muebles, para lo cual implementó un taller en su vivienda. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos, por ello que se dedica a tiempo completo, trabajando todos los días de 5 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. El trabajo es duro y pesado, pero Eder tiene bien claros sus ideales de hacer crecer su negocio para que en el futuro pueda darle una buena calidad de vida a la familia que piensa conformar. 
A él le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues lo hace sentirse bien y gratificado, por lo que desea hacerlo crecer y en un futuro contratar a otras personas que lo ayuden y así producir más.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos, además es muy respetado por sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una máquina para facilitar su trabajo en la elaboración de muebles y así aumentará su producción.
texts.en:
Eder, a young worker, age 35, is single and lives alone in his own house. For 5 years he has been involved in making furniture, for which purpose he set up a shop in his home. This activity is his principal source of income because he engages in it full time, working every day from 5:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. The work is hard and tiring, but Eder has a clear idea of increasing his business so that in the future he can provide a good quality of life to the family he is thinking of starting. He likes his work a lot since it makes him feel good and gratified, which is why he wants to make it grow and in the future contract with other customers so that he can produce more.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he has always been characterized by being very punctual with his payments. In addition, he is highly respected by his colleagues in the group. With the money that he is now applying for he will buy a machine in order to assist his work of manufacturing furniture and will, thus, add to his production.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase  of machinery

loans.name: Esther

texts.fr: S. Esther est née le 15 Octobre 1961 à Agbangnizoun au Bénin. Esther vit depuis 24 ans environs à Akossavié dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi au Bénin. Mariée à TOVODOUNNON Antoine, un agent permanent d’Etat, Esther est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Akossavié. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Esther n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis environs 20 ans, Esther mène comme activité, la vente de parfums, bougies, divers objets traditionnels et des canaris  dans son quartier. C’est à Agbangnizoun que Esther s’approvisionne. Esther a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. Esther sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son capital et élever le niveau de son activité. Esther ambitionne fabriquer elle-même les canaris dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
S. Esther was born on October 15, 1961 in Agbangnizoun in Bénin. Esther has been living for about 24 years in Akossavié in the commune of Abomey Calavi in Bénin. Married to TOVODOUNNON Antoine, a permanent government employee, Esther is the mother of 4 children, all enrolled in school. The family lives together in Akossavié. The couple are jointly responsible for supporting the family.

Esther did not attend school. For about 20 years, Esther has been selling perfume, candles, various traditional items, and pottery in her neighborhood. She buys her merchandise at Agbangnizoun. She has already received one loan from ALIDé and repaid it in a timely manner. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to increase her working capital and raise the level of her business. Her ambition is to make pottery herself in future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various traditional objects and 40 clay pots

loans.name: Tamenkoh Ii Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each from Kiva lenders through SMT. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales, earn more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Fatmata K. on the left is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Magburaka forty-six years ago. She is married to a miner and they have three children. Two of their children are in junior secondary school and one is in primary school.

Fatmata sells bowls, baskets and slippers/flip-flops. Fatmata has over ten years of experience in this business. With her share of this loan, she will buy bowls, slippers, and baskets.

loans.use: Buy bowls, slippers, and baskets

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comparte la vida con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 5 añitos de edad.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, actividad que la mantiene ocupada gran parte del día, siendo un trabajo muy cansado. Luz sale todos los días a las casas de sus vecinas y amigas ofreciendo las novedades que adquiere, además es muy querida en su barrio, ya que además de vender siempre da buenos consejos sobre los colores y modelos que mejor les quedan a sus clientes. 
Felizmente las ventas son buenas, lo cual beneficia a su familia, es por ello que está pensando en mejorar su negocio para que en el futuro pueda tener una tienda donde ofrecer con mayor comodidad sus prendas.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para estas fiestas navideñas, en las que espera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luz, 27, is a hard-working woman, who shares her life with her husband and two children, who are 6 and 5 years old, respectively. For the last 3 years she has sold clothing and footwear, an activity that keeps her busy most of the day, and a very tiring line of work. Luz makes her daily rounds to homes of her friends and relatives offering her wares. She is very well-liked in her neighborhood because, besides selling, she always offers good advice regarding the colors and styles that best suit her customers.. Happily, her sales are good, which is of great benefit for her family. She is, therefore, wanting to improve her business so that in the future she can have a store from which to offer her goods with greater comfort. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with her repayment. The funding requested now will be used to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to have sufficient stock available for the Christmas season, which is when she expects her sales to increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. sus 3 hijos; Jorge D. 18, Leonardo D. 15 y María D. 14 años.
Ella está acostumbrada a atrabajar para el bienestar D. su familia, es así que desD. hace 3 años se dedica a la venta D. ropa, actividad que le permite tener libertad para realizar las labores en su hogar y dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos, los cuales son su fuente D. inspiración. 
A María le gusta mucho su trabajo y es por ello que da todo D. sí para mejorar sus ingresos. Un día normal en su rutina comienza temprano en la mañana dedicándose netamente en las labores del hogar, posteriormente ofrece sus productos D. casas en casa D. sus clientas y también hace entrega D. los pedidos que le hicieron.
En un futuro, le gustaría tener un bazar donD. pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre le ha ido muy bien con todos los pagos, pues es una persona bastante responsable. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para vender en estas fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her three children; Jorge, 18; Leonardo, 15; and Maria, 14. She is used to working for her family’s well-being, so she has been selling clothing for the past three years. This allows her to have the freedom to also take care of her home and dedicate time to her children, who are the fountain of her inspiration. Maria likes her work very much and she gives it all she can so that she can improve her income. On a typical day, she starts her routine early in the morning beginning with her household chores. She then shows her household products to customers in their homes and delivers any previous orders. In the future she would like to have a small shop where she can sell her products in larger amounts. This will be her third loan through MFP and she has always done well with her payments, as she is a very responsible person. She will use the money from this loan to buy larger quantities of products that she will sell over the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: Auxiliadora tiene 58 años de edad, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que realiza en Fundación León 2000 ya que han sido de gran ayuda para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Su actividad económica es una pulpería  ella ha ido aumentando su inventario, por lo que tenía mucha necesidad de  sufragar los gastos de su familia, y siempre le ha gustado trabajar con su negocio. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de de gaseosas, jugos arroz, frijoles, aceite, leña, gas, jabón, detergente entre otros productos. Por lo que siempre sueña con que su negocio se mantenga activo y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora, 58, has had previous loans from Fundación León 2000 that have been very useful to her to improve her business. She has a small grocery store. Little by little she has been increasing the number of items in her inventory so that she can better meet her household expenses. She has always enjoyed tending her store. She is asking for financing to buy soft-drinks, juices, rice, beans, oil, firewood, gas, soap, detergent, etc. She always dreams that her store will stay active and continue to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 39 años es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla, quien junto a su esposo, Pedro de 41 años, viven en su propia casa y lo que más desea es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para ello, Ana tiene una pequeña panadería, donde elabora los panes más sabrosos y deliciosos del poblado de Taraco (Distrito de la provincia de Huancane). Es así que sus días empiezan desde muy temprano, prepara la masa y luego termina por poner el pan al horno. Ya son muchos los clientes que prefieren comprar el pan de Ana, ya que la calidad con están hechos son inigualables. Es entonces que lleva mas de 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le agrada es el proceso del horneado por que siente que ya culminó su trabajo. A pesar que se levanta de madrugada para cumplir diariamente con su producción, siendo muy agotador, le llena de satisfacción, por lo que se dedica a distribuir sus panes a los diferentes puntos de venta. Por tal motivo desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender los panes que ella misma elabora. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, para así poder acceder a nuevos créditos. Además se le considera una compañera muy alegre y solidaria con lo demás miembros de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, lo invertirá en la compra de más ingrediente para aumentar la producción de pan que ella misma elabora.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old. She is a very happy and simple woman. She lives with her husband, Pedro, who is 41 years old, in their own home. What she wishes for the most is to improve her family's quality of life. For this, Ana has a small bakery, where she makes the tastiest and most delicious bread of the town of Taraco (District of the province of Huancane). This is how her days begin very early: she prepares the dough and later she finishes by putting the bread in the oven. There are already a lot of customers who prefer to buy their bread from Ana, since the quality it's made with is unequaled. She has spent more than 7 years undertaking this activity and what she likes the most is the baking process because she feels like her work is accomplished. Getting up at dawn to finish her production every day, despite being very exhausting, fills her with satisfation. This is why she distributes her bread to the different points of sale. For this reason she wishes to have a store where she could sell the bread that she makes herself. This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to make all of her payments on time, to be able to access new loans. In addition, she is considered to be very cheerful and supportive with the other members of her communal bank. With the thousand nuevos soles she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of more ingredients to increase production of the bread that she makes herself.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan”, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 7 hijos. No pudo concluir sus estudios primarios.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años y su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para incrementar su capital y comprar más productos.
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà cereales como: tunta, chuño, habas y cebada.
Su deseo para el futuro es que todos sus hijos tengan su casa propia.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 45, is a member of the "San Juan" communal bank. She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno department. She is a single mother of 7 children. She never finished elementary school. She is a cereals merchant. She has been cooperating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 3 years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy merchandise. She now needs 2000 new soles to buy tunta (freeze-dried white potato), chuño (freeze-dried potato), broad beans and barley. Her dream for the future is that all her children have their own homes. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tunta (free-dried white potato), chuño (freeze-dried potato), broad beans, barley.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco.  The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish).  Hilda is 53 years old and lives in Cusco with her daughter, aged 17 and her son, aged 26.  Her son in a nurse in Cusco and her daughter is finishing high school and looking to continue her studies in a university or an institute.  

Hilda’s business is buying and selling health and beauty products, which she has been doing for the past 5 years.  She generates orders through a catalogue she circulates and then fills the orders by buying inventory from a distributor.  She has several loyal customers and relies mostly on word of mouth to gain new clients.  Hilda has several new orders but can’t afford to buy the inventory to fill them at the moment, and therefore needs a loan.  She hopes to grow her business so that she can contribute to her daughter’s education.

Hilda appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.
texts.en:
Hilda is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco. The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish). Hilda is 53 years old and lives in Cusco with her daughter, aged 17, and her son, aged 26. Her son is a nurse in Cusco and her daughter is finishing high school and looking to continue her studies in a university or an institute. Hilda’s business is buying and selling health and beauty products, which she has been doing for the past 5 years. She generates orders through a catalogue she circulates, and then fills the orders by buying inventory from a distributor. She has several loyal customers and relies mostly on word of mouth to gain new clients. Hilda has several new orders but can’t afford to buy the inventory to fill them at the moment, and therefore needs a loan. She hopes to grow her business so that she can contribute to her daughter’s education. Hilda appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise to fill several back-orders

loans.name: Esther Peregrina

texts.es:
La señora ESTHER tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria.  Está separada de su esposo y tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de carne que trae de la sierra.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles pudo viajar a la sierra a traer carne de res y cerdo para vender.  Con este crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará, también, para comprar más carne de res y cerdo. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
ESTHER, 48, lives in the PORVENIR district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE II communal bank. She finished 11th grade, is separated from her husband, and has 4 children who are dependent on her. She sells meat that she brings from the mountains. With her first, 300 new sol, loan she traveled to the mountains to get beef and pork to sell. With this new, 1000 new sol, loan she will buy more beef and pork. She dreams with increasing her sales to make higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef and pork.

loans.name: Abbako Tech/voc Makeni Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers are teachers and staff members of a technical vocational institute in Makeni town. The institute was established in 1985 to create “education for self reliance” for the children of Makeni and its environs. Today, the school has a total of twenty-three staff and 145 pupils. The institute is made up of a Junior Secondary School and a Tech Voc, where pupils are trained in various technical and vocational skills like weaving, tailoring, carpentry; “gara” tying and dyeing; secretariat and business study courses, and a lot more.

Teachers from this institution, like many other teachers within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf. Muctarr S. (back row, third from left) is the head of this group of teachers. The 47-year-old is a Head of Department at the institute. He has served at this institution for twenty-four years now.

Muctarr is married to a secretary and they have four children who are in secondary and primary schools respectively. With his share of this loan, Muctarr will buy house-building materials like cement and corrugated iron.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like cement and corrugated iron

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco.  The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish).  Valentina is 28 years old and lives in Cusco with her common law husband and her 8 year-old daughter.

Valentina supplies restaurants and hotels in the city of Cusco with local fine meats and other food products, which she has been doing for the past 8 years.  She mainly distributes alpaca meat, local cheeses and eggs.  Valentina wants a loan to stock up on inventory in anticipation of the busy holiday season.  She hopes in the future to expand her business by distributing additional food products to the hotels and restaurants of Cusco.

Valentina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.
texts.en:
Valentina is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco. The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish). Valentina is 28 years old and lives in Cusco with her common law husband and her eight year-old daughter. Valentina supplies restaurants and hotels in the city of Cusco with local fine meats and other food products, which she has been doing for the past eight years. She mainly distributes alpaca meat, local cheeses and eggs. Valentina wants a loan to stock up on inventory in anticipation of the busy holiday season. She hopes in the future to expand her business by distributing additional food products to the hotels and restaurants of Cusco. Valentina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Foodstuffs to distribute to businesses in Cusco

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Javier Álvarez vive en el Centro Poblado Juan Velazco Alvarado perteneciente al distrito de Santiago en casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus menores hijos. Actualmente labora como obrero de campo en parcelas de la zona alternando labores en la empresa North Bay del Perú SA. Su esposa también realiza labores de campo en la empresa Gourmet Farms Perú SRL. No posee endeudamiento en ninguna entidad financiera. Solicita crédito para continuar con mejoras progresivas de su vivienda ya que ésta es de caña y adobe. Son personas muy trabajadoras que con sus ahorros producto de su trabajo han comprado su terreno y acondicionado su vivienda para sus hijos. Su sueño es logar construir su vivienda y poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Álvarez agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar para alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Javier Álvarez lives in the central town of Juan Velazco Alvarado, part of the district of Santiago, in his own house with his wife and his small children. He currently works as a field labourer in smallholdings in the area, alternating with work for the company North Bay del Perú SA. His wife also does field labour for the company Gourmet Farms Perú SRL. He does not have any debts with any financial institution. He is requesting a loan in order to continue work with better progress on their house, which is made of straw and sun-dried brick. They are very hardworking people who, with their savings from their work, have bought their land and made a suitable home for their children. Their dream is to succeed in building their house and to be able to offer a better quality of life to their children. Mr. Álvarez is grateful for the support that we can offer him to attain his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of housing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 29 años es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, vive en su propia casa y lo que más anhela es mejorar su calidad de vida. Es por ello que Elizabeth se dedica diariamente a la confección de tejidos artesanales en su pequeño taller, donde trabaja sin parar para cubrir la cantidad de prendas que le han solicitado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, es así que ya lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad, pese a que se queda todo el día en su taller hasta cumplir con sus pedidos, pero lo hace con mucho empeño ya que desea en un futuro tener una tienda de tejidos, donde pueda vender sus prendas con mayor comodidad. 

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, por tanto promete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, para no perjudicar a sus compañeras de su banco comunal, ya que se le considera como una persona muy responsable y estimada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old and is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home and what she longs for most is improving her standard of living. That is why she dedicates herself daily to the production of artisan weavings in her own workshop. Here she works nonstop to cover the quantity of pieces that have been requested from her in Desaguadero city (Puno Province, the border between Perú and Bolivia), since it is there that she sell her garments. What she likes most about her work is weaving, which she has done for 9 years and with great skill, even though she must remain all day in her shop until she fulfills her orders. She does this with great dedication since her wish is to have a shop where she can easily sell her garments. This is her sixth loan with MFP and promises to make timely payments so as not to jeopardize her communal bank colleagues since they consider her a responsible and esteemed person. With the thousand soles (Peruvian Soles) loan she will buy the wool required to produce more artisan garments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wool to make artisan weavings

loans.name: Rosa Enriqueta

texts.es: Rosa Enriqueta tiene 66 años, ella tiene 4 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería ella ha trabajado mucho para obtener lo que necesita en su negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita por lo que anteriormente ya había trabajado con Fundación León 2000 a ella le gusto mucho la manera en cómo la atendieron y la facilidad de su financiamiento. Ella está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento con el fin de comprar granos básicos, golosinas, jugos, pollo, carne y queso. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para mantener así una vida digna y activa.
texts.en:
Rosa Enriqueta is 66 years old and has 4 children that work independently. She runs a small grocery store and has worked very hard to start this business. This is not the first loan that she has requested, as a she had previously worked with Fundacion Leon 2000. Upon her first visit, she enjoyed the way that she was treated and the ease with which she received her loan. She is requesting this new loan to purchase basic grains, sweets, juices, chicken, meat, and cheese. Her wish is to expand her business to be able to sustain a dignified and active life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital to purchase basic grains, sweets, juices, chicken, meat, and cheese.

loans.name: Trancito Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora  Trancito G. es socia del banco comunal La Prosperidad, tiene un gran lazo de amistad con todas las socias de su bankito y nos comenta que formó parte del banco comunal porque una amiga le invitó a formar parte del mismo, se encuentra tres años trabajando con  los préstamos que  la fundación otorga y se siente satisfecha con los logros alcanzados, ella vive en el sector la Católica en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 47 años de edad y es divorciada hace 30 de su primer compromiso,  en él  procreó cuatro  hijos de los cuales la  primera es casada y vive independiente en su nuevo  hogar,  sus otros tres hijos son solteros y  trabajan para ayudarla con los gastos del hogar, tuvo otro compromiso del que concibió dos hijos más que ahora tienen 18 y 15 años, ellos son estudiantes en el colegio San Vicente y en el Instituto CEDEC, de su segundo compromiso  también  se separó  hace 17 años porque su  esposo viajo al extranjero y no regresó, gracias al esfuerzo familiar construyeron su casa propia donde vive junto a sus hijos.

Transito se dedica a la  costura desde que tenía 20 años, arte que  aprendió  en una academia durante  tres años de estudio,  ella trabaja en su casa reparando y confeccionando  pantalones de hombre y mujer, así como  ofreciendo sus servicios en almacenes quienes le dan su mercadería para que trabaje.

Nuestra socia nos comenta que los créditos recibidos los ha invertido en mejorar cada día su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones, y más suministros para la confección de sus prendas de vestir.

Su meta es incrementar su negocio y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Trancito G. is a member of the La Prosperidad Communal Bank. She has a great circle of friendship with all of the members of her bank. She tells us that she became part of the communal bank because a friend invited her to join. She has been working with loans from the foundation for three years. She feels happy with what she has achieved. She lives in the Católica area of the city of Cuenca. She is 47, and she has been divorced for 30 years. She had four children. The first is married and lives independently in her new home. Her other three children are single and work to help her with the household expenses. She had another relationship and had two more children. They are now 18 and 15. They are students in the San Vicente School and in the CEDEC Institute. She has been separated from her second husband for 17 years because he traveled abroad and did not return. Thanks to the family’s effort they built her own house where she lives with her children. Transito has been a seamstress for 20 years. She learned this skill during three years of study in a school. She works in her home mending and making pants for men and women. She also offers her services to stores who give her merchandise so that she can work. She tells us that she used the loans she received to improve her business everyday. With the new loan she will buy fabric, needles, zippers, buttons, and more supplies to make her clothes. Her goal is to increase her business and to get ahead with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and more

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es: Oscar Javier es un hombre que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. El tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de aires acondicionados,  el comenzó su negocio con un pequeño taller de refrigeración en su humilde vivienda ofreciendo sus servicios de mantenimiento de refrigeradora ciertos vecinos y algunas amistades, es así que poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia y obteniendo muchos clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento porque instalara un equipo de refrigeración por lo que necesita ciertas herramientas necesarias. El sueña con establecer un taller y pueda proporcionar capacitación a personas que deseen aprender este medio de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Javier is a man who really wants to get ahead. He is 39 years old and has 2 children in his care, his business provides maintenance and repair of air conditioners, he started his business with a small airconditioning workshop in his humble home offering his maintenance services for cooling units to certain neighbours and some friends, in this way little by little he gained experience and won many customers. At present he is asking for this financing because he is installing air conditioning equipment for which he needs certain necessary tools. He dreams about establishing a workshop and be able to provide training to people who want to learn this way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sagrada  Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Ciudad de Benjamín Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo y la linea de crédito que manejan es de 100.000 Gs. a 300.000 Gs.
En su mayoría  de las clientes se dedican a la  venta de panchos    también están las demás miembros del grupo que con mucho esfuerzo responsabilidad ven el fruto de muchos años de sacrificio cuentan ya con despensa, copetín, vendedora de productos como frutas , venta de comida,venta de panchos y venta de  yuyos. Y gracias al crédito concebido por la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva tienen el deseo de superarse cada vez más, y seguir avanzando más.

texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) group is from the city of Benjamín Chaco. This group is currently in its first loan cycle and the members have loans ranging from 100,000 to 300,000 Paraguayan guaranis (PYG). The majority of the members sell "panchos" (hot dogs). Others, as a result of great effort and responsibility, are reaping the rewards of many years of sacrifice and now have their own "despensa" (mini-market), or "copetín" (fast food stall), or they sell produce such as fruit, or they have a stall selling food, "panchos" or medicinal herbs. Thanks to the loans granted by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, these women have the desire to keep trying harder and to progress. 1 Deisy Noemi A. Acosta Sells Clothing 2 Karis Antonela V. Sells Clothing 3 Catalina Beatriz F. Cuevas Sells Clothing 4 Maria Estela L. Sells Groceries 5 Blanca Z. Sells Meat 6 Josefina Romina G. de Acosta Sells Hardware 7 Ecolastica A. Sells "Panchos" (Hot dogs) 8 Clotilde G. de V. Sells Food 9 Maria Isabel Martinez Sells Vegetables 10 Nilda M. Mendez Samaniego Sells Food 11 Catalina T. Baez Sells Medicinal Herbs 12 Fernanda A. Aguiar Sells Food 13 Miria Beatriz M. Servin Sells "Panchos" (Hot dogs) 14 Soledad de Jesus M. Sells Food 15 Natalia Soledad V. Gayoso Sells "Panchos" (Hot dogs)

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, sugar, noodles, rice, flour, drinks, meat and hot dogs. Also to buy fruit and clothing.

loans.name: Tanislaa

texts.es: Tanislaa L. A. tiene 57 años, por lo que su actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general actualmente ella tiene muchos pedidos de ropa nueva, a pesar de la edad que tiene ella es una mujer admirable porque hay muchas personas a su edad que no tienen trabajo, pero ella misma dice que tiene que trabajar por sus 2 hijos de diferentes edades de 14 y 17 años, esta es su razón por salir adelante para brindarles a ellos la oportunidad de estudiar. Ella inicio este negocio con capital propio hace 13 años, y por medio de los financiamientos que han  sido su gran apoyo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, trajes, vestidos, faldas y algunas tallas extra grande que algunos clientes solicitan. Ella desea enseñarles a sus hijos el negocio pues ellos tienen que aprender a valerse por si mismos.
texts.en:
Tanislaa L. A. is 57. She sells general merchandise. She has a lot of orders for new clothes. In spite of her age, she is an admirable woman because there are a lot of people her age who do not have work. She says that she has to work for her two children, 14 and 17. This is her reason to get ahead, to give them the opportunity of an education. She started her business 13 years ago with her own money and with the loans, which have been a great help. The loan she is asking for is to buy pants, shirts, outfits, skirts, and some extra large sizes that some of her customers ask for. She wants to teach her children the business. They have to learn to fend for themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Renovadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Renovadoras” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio Las Garzas, de la ciudad de San Antonio. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable.
La historia de Doña Juana es muy conmovedora, la misma se encuentra con 5 hijos y su marido no tiene empleo, ella hace de todo con la ayuda de su marido para mantener a su hijos, actualmente ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas para la venta.

texts.en:
The Mujeres Renovadoras formed with the union of various neighbors from the Las Garzas neighborhood in the city of San Antonio. All of the group’s members work in independent activities like sales. The members formed a very united group, which is capable of working together. The majority of its members work by selling, and they are colleagues among themselves. All of the group’s members are mothers who work to strengthen the household economy and to develop their enterprises in a sustainable manner. Juana’s story is very moving. She has five children, and her husband is unemployed. She does everything, with help from her husband, to support her children. She currently makes food to sell. 1 Lina G. de Rodas Sells Clothes 2 Mónica Gómez Sells Clothes 3 Victoria B. Sells Clothes 4 Damaris Gómez Pastry Shop 5 Mirtha E. Sells Cosmetics 6 Olga C. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets 7 Idalia C. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets 8 Luciana Agüero Sells Drinks 9 Mónica Valdéz Snack Bar 10 Gregoria R. Food Store 11 Rafaela M. Pastry Shop 12 Teresa R. Sells Clothes 13 Juana Liz R. Sells Food 14 Lilia F. Food Store 15 Maria Lucia P. Sells Fruit

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and ingredients

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana is 33 years old. She lives with her son, daughter and husband in La Suiza de Turrialba, a rural region near the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Roxana´s completed primary school. The credit consultant who has been working with Roxana over the last few months describes her character as persevering, hardworking and strong.

Roxana has developed her sales abilities by selling hand-made clothing, cosmetics, and various household items, to clients in her community in La Suiza de Turrialba. Going from door to door, Roxana provides her clients with four different catalogues to peruse, offering a range of personal and household products. Every 22 days, a representative from each catalogue company holds a meeting in the community to collect the orders from Roxana and other women. Within a week, the items are delivered to Roxana´s home, who then delivers the products to her clients. Many micro-entrepreneurs in Costa Rica make their living this way. 

Roxana launched her business with an investment of 25,000 colones that she used to purchase the catalogues. At the moment, she has 20 regular clients and hopes to use this loan to increase that number. She has been selling clothes for the past ten years. In a good month, she can earn 200,000 colones, in a bad month, only 140,000. Roxana started her business so she could contribute to family income and because she enjoys the work.

An obstacle for Roxana is the fixed margin imposed by the catalogue companies. Vendors are required to charge the price dictated by the catalogue. This strict regulation has hampered Roxanas ability to tailor prices to her client’s needs, and thus limited her earnings. Roxana knows of a supplier in San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica, who offers better prices for products. She is applying for a loan from Fundacion Mujer to purchase more inventory items from this supplier. By travelling to San Jose once a week to purchase items, Roxana is confident she will be able to earn more profit from her sales as she will be able to dictate her margins and final prices. 

Although this will be her first loan with an official financial institution, Roxana has benefited from many loans from suppliers in the past who have not presented any negative references. Roxana has always enjoyed working in sales and earning her own source of income. Financial independence is something she values highly. Her goal is to open a clothing store. She wants her business to grow so that she can provide a higher standard of living for her family. She says ¨the money I earn is not for my husband, not for me, but for my family.¨

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Olga Heminia

texts.es:
Olga Cusco de 60 años de edad, vive en la zona Perimetral en Guayaquil, tiene todos los servicios básicos en su vivienda, el padre de Olga tuvo este negocio de frutas desde hace muchos años atrás ella desde muy pequeña lo ayudaba y aprendió como trabajar con frutas cuando el padre murió ella paso a heredar el negocio.

Ahora Olga comprar  mangos a $ 12.00 la caja, sandias a $ 1.00, y comprar piñas a $ 0.90 c/u, una de las mayores dificultades de su negocio es cuando se escasea las frutas y suben los precios, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio en conjunto con sus 5 hijos, uno de 23 años, 28 años, 30 años, 31 años y el ultimo de 35 años. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 12 cajas de mangos, 100 piñas, 4 cajas y arreglar un poco mas el negocio, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos tengan un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Olga Cusco, 60 years old, lives in the Perimetral zone of Guayaquil. She has all the basic services in her home. Olga’s father had this fruit business for many years. From an early age, Olga helped him and learned how to work with fruit. When her father died, Olga inherited the business. Her husband assists her, as do her five children, aged 23, 28, 30, 31, and 35.

Now, Olga buys mangos for $12 a box, watermelons for $1, and pineapples for $.90 each. One of the greatest difficulties of her business is that when fruits are scarce, the prices rise.

With this loan, Olga will buy more fruit, including 12 boxes of mangos and 100 pineapples, and also improve the fruit stand. In the future, she wants to finish construction on her house, and that her children have their own business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mangos, pineapples, and watermelons

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelino tiene el negocio de venta de ropa americana en una feria nocturna de nuestra ciudad, el tiene un puesto fijo,  este mercado donde vende es conocido como el barrio chino por ser un lugar donde se vende productos de segunda mano y ademas es un lugar donde se puede encontrar de todo, ademas de la actividad que tiene de venta de ropa americana que es de lo que recibe mayor ingreso tambien vende ocasionalmente celulares que le ofrecen a medio uso de oferta, el quiere tener  un capital unicamente para celulares y aprovechar el puesto que tiene para iniciar paralelamente esta otra actividad, el es de constitucion robusta lo que le ayuda a no tener problemas en este mercado de mucho peligro.
texts.en:
Marcelino sells American clothing in a nighttime market in La Paz. He has a fixed location in the market. This market is known as the “Chinese Neighborhood” because second-hand goods are sold there and it is a place where you can buy anything.

Although clothing sales are the biggest part of his business, Marcelino also occasionally sells used cell phones. He would like to have some capital solely to invest in cell phones and take advantage of his sales location to start this parallel business. Marcelino is of “robust constitution,” which helps him avoid problems in this dangerous market.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raul se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su local ubicado en el 4to anillo, donde atiende todos los dias y además tiene su Rockola, su esposa le ayuda en las noches cuando sale del trabajo mientras que sus hijos se quedan en casa al cuidado de su tia. Ellos trabajan arduamente para poder darles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y poder comprar una casa para vivir independientemente ya que ahora viven en casa de un familiar. Ellos necesitan el prestamo para aumentar capital y comprar sillas y mesas que le estan haciendo falta. Ellos son clientes antiguos en la institucion y son muy responsables.
texts.en:
Mr. Raul works selling beverages in his business on 4th Avenue where he serves his customers every day. He also has his Rockola jukebox. His wife helps him in the evenings when she leaves her work, the children staying home where an aunt cares for them. Raul and his wife work hard to provide their children with better living conditions and to be able to buy a house where they can live independently, since they now live in the home of a relative. They need the loan to increase their capital and to buy chairs and tables that they need. They have been clients of the institution for a long time and are very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco. The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish). Angelica is 44 years old and lives in Cusco with her husband, who is a painter by trade, and the two youngest of her five children.

Angelica sells toys on the street and around markets in Cusco, which she has been doing for the past five years. She mainly sells small toy cars and dolls in Cusco, and occasionally ventures to some of the smaller surrounding towns to sell there as well. Angelica wants a loan to increase her inventory of toys in anticipation of the upcoming holidays. She plans to sell toys at several big Cusco Christmas markets this season.

Angelica is pictured with her granddaughter, Kitana.

Angelica appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy toys to sell in the Christmas market.

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
La sra. Lady se dedica a la venta de coca por take, un take es la medida que utilizan los vendedores de coca, equivale a 50 libras cada uno. La coca en su estado natural es muy apreciada en Bolivia desde tiempos incaicos por sus beneficios medicinales, lo utilizan en mates para el dolor de estómago, en cremas para dolores musculares, y las personas que tienen un trabajo que requiera un mayor esfuerzo fisico, como los mineros, mastican las hojas ya que éstas quitan el sueño y el hambre. La cliente compra la coca que traen de los Yungas del departamento de La Paz, toda esta mercadería llega al mercado de la coca ubicado en la zona de Villa Fatima, se registra a los propietarios y luego la venden, las personas que comercian con la coca deben tener un permiso especial para vender este producto. La sra. Lady tiene su permiso ya que su papá es yungueño, y le permitieron trabajar en este rubro. Es una cliente muy responsable, su esposo es chofer asalariado, ambos se apoyan para los gastos de la casa. El crédito que solicita ahora es para incrementar la cantidad de takes de coca ya que para fin de año algunos comerciantes descansan y no traen coca para vender, por esto el take de coca sube de precio. 						
						
Si deceas conocer mas sobre la hoja milenaria visita la siguiente pagina http://www.bolivianet.com/cultura/encuentro/coca/la_coca.html
texts.en:
Lady works selling coca leaves by the take. A take is a measurement used by coca sellers and is equivalent to 50 pounds. Coca in its natural state has been valued in Bolivia since Incan times for its medicinal benefits. It is used in teas for stomachache and in creams for muscle pain. People who have jobs that require great physical exertion, such as miners, chew the leaves because they relieve fatigue and hunger. The borrower buys coca brought from the Yungas region in the department of La Paz. All of the merchandise arrives at the coca market located in the Villa Fatima area. The owners are registered, and then they can sell it. The people who work in the coca business must have a special permit to sell this product. Lady has a permit because her father is from the Yungas region and so they have allowed her to work in this sector. She is a very responsible borrower. Her husband is a salaried driver and they both count on one another for household expenses. The loan she is asking for now is to increase the number of takes of coca, because towards the end of the year some merchants take a break and do not bring coca to sell. For this reason the price of a take of coca goes up. If you would like to know more about the coca leaf visit the following page: http://www.bolivianet.com/cultura/encuentro/coca/la_coca.html

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of takes (sacks) of coca

loans.name: Lucila Berta

texts.es: Lucila Berta tiene 49 años de edad, su actividad económica es ofrecer el  brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio como un medio de vida para su familia. Además tiene 1 hija de 10 años, de la que se hace cargo pues ella tiene la enfermedad de síndrome de Down y ella la baña, la viste y está pendiente al cuido de su hija. Asimismo se dedica a impartir clases en un colegio llamado Asunción, en donde labora como docente desde hace 30 años, ella está muy orgullosa de ser una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora. Su deseo es ampliar su taller y establecer boutiques en donde sus prendas de vestir sean las mejores.
texts.en:
Lucila Berta is a 49-year-old tailor, something she has been doing for more than seven years. In addition, she takes care of a 10-year-old daughter with Down Syndrome. She bathes her, dresses her, and is key to her care. At the same time, she gives classes at Asunción high school, where she's worked as a teacher since she was 30. She is very proud to be an enterprising and motivated woman. Her wish is to expand her workshop and establish boutiques where her garments will be the best.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: Ilqar A. is married and is 43 years old with daughters. He began his business 20 years ago with a small store, which adapted according to market demands. Initially Ilqar offered a small number of food products in his store but expanded due to his location and client needs. His wife works with him and helps in the business. Ilqar is asking for a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase additional merchandise in order to offer a more diverse range of products to his clients. He wants to be able to keep an up-to-date inventory and meet the preferences of his clients. Ilqar thanks you for your support to continue to improve both his business and the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
El esposo D. Aidee es albañil D. obras D. construcción y precisamente fue el quien le dio la idea D. preparar alimentos y darle pensión a sus trabajadores, es así como empieza en el negocio D. las comidas, al principio algo temerosa pero con muchas ganas D. trabajar ella empieza a cocinar y los trabajadores D. su esposo quedaron tan  contentos con la comida que les preparaba que se empiezan a recomendar unos a otros. D. esa manera fue aumentando la cantidad D. comensales. Por otro lado también empezó a trabajar en un comedor D. su zona lo cual le genera otro ingreso. Con sus ganancias D. los trabajos que realiza ha podido avanzar la construcción D. su casa y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Lo que Aidee quiere es tener un restaurante en su misma casa, ella tiene el local adecuado, pero aun no le alcanza para implementarlo es por eso que lo alquila para juntar algo D. capital.
Con el  reciente préstamo que EDAPROSPO le entregara, avanzara con la construcción D. su local  por ejemplo tarrajear las paredes,D. ese modo muy pronto vera su sueño realizado, lo mas importante es que el lugar donD. vive es para ese tipo D. negocio, por que es una avenida donD. transita mucha gente, ella esta segura que le ira muy bien por que cuenta con el apoyo D. su familia.

* La Sra. Aidee esta vestida con polo morado
*El joven que aparece en la foto esta como invitado antes pertenecia al grupo.
texts.en:
Aidee's husband is a construction worker and it was his idea to proviD. lunch options to his workers. This is how Aidee began her food preparation business. Initially she was timid but enthusiastic to work. She began to cook and her husband's workers were so happy with the food that they began to recommend her to others. In this way, Aidee increased the number of diners she served. She also began to work at a local cafeteria to generate more income. With her earnings she has been able to advance construction on her home and to help her husband with household expenses. Aidee wishes to have a restaurant in her home. She has some space but it's not enough, so she is currently renting out the space to build capital. With the loan EDAPROSPO will proviD. she will be able to continue construction by plastering the walls with cement. Soon she will achieve her dream of having her business in her home, which is important because her house is on an avenue with a lot of foot traffic. She is sure the business will do well because she has help from her family. * Aidee is wearing a purple shirt. * The young man that appears in the photo is a visitor; he was previously a member of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continue construction on home.

loans.name: Frans

texts.es: Frans de 18 años, es un joven trabajador que vive en casa de sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida. Es así que vale de su juventud para trabajar muy duro y ayudar a sus padres, aportando en los gastos de su hogar. Desde ese momento sale todos los días a recolectar leche en el poblado de Taraco (Distrito de la provincia de Huancane), y con ello elabora deliciosos quesos, que luego son llevados a otros distritos de la ciudad de Puno para su venta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede manejar sus horarios para continuar con sus estudios, es así que lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad, siendo la parte más ardua de su labor en conseguir leche de calidad para elaborar sus quesos, ya que como única fuente de ingreso debe esmerarse en ofrecer a sus cliente el mejor queso para así poder ganar más y ayudar a sus padres en la economía de su casa. Este es el primer préstamo de Frans con MFP y tiene el firme compromiso de no fallar en sus pagos y ser responsable con los demás miembros de su banco comunal. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más leche para elaborar más quesos.
texts.en:
Frans is a young worker of 18 who lives at home with his parents and has great dreams to get ahead in life. He works very hard and his youth helps him help his parents with the household expenses.. Every day he goes out to collect milk from the village of Taraco (in the Huancane District), and with it he makes delicious cheese. He then takes the cheese to other districts in the city of Puno to sell. What he likes most about his work is that he can manage his schedule to continue with his studies. He’s been doing this for 3 years, but the most arduous part of the work is to get the quality of milk that he needs to make his cheese. This is his only source of income and he goes to a lot of trouble to be able to offer his customers the best cheese so that he can earn more and help his parents with expenses of the house. This is Frans’s first loan with MFP and he is determined not to miss any payments and to be responsible with the other members of the communal bank. With these five hundred new sols that he is requesting, he will buy more milk to make more cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more milk to make cheese

loans.name: Maripositas Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: MARIPOSITAS  se encuetra ubicado en el Barrio 30 DE AGOSTO. Zona de la avenida Moscu, este B.E. se encuentra en su 3er cilco, está compuesto por  13  personas, es uno de los Bancos de Emprendimiento  más dinamicos y alegres; dirigido a travez de su PRESIDENTA la Sra. SILVIA,el TESORERO es el Sr.GUIDO Y la SECRETARIA, la Sra. NINETH, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la  venta de Ropa, Zapatos, Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrotes, Empanadas,Panaderia, Peinadoras, etc. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los dias jueves a horas 15:30 PM en la casa de una de las coordinadoras del grupo, la señora Silvia. Los clientes nuevos que hemos captados y se incorporaron en el banco de emprendimiento y asimismo los antiguos estan conformes de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitacion  se les enseñó a hacer una proyeccion de sus ahorros, para incentivarlas a ahorrar.			
			
La Sra. SILVIA es la Presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 años de antigüedad en la Venta de ropa y su nueva innovacion en el mercado de cosmeticos para lo cual va ir destinado este credito; le dedica 8 horas al dia. La Sra. es fundadora del grupo y es muy responsable y cumplida, y no defraudará la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender. 			

El Sr.GUIDO es el Tesorero. Lleva 5 años de antigüedad en el rubro de la carpinteria este nuevo credito le permitirá invertir más en su negocio y mejorar su ingreso para tener una mejor calidad de vida, trabaja 7 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia ,su trabajo es mayormente en su propio domicilio  y de forma ambulante por su barrio ,su meta es de seguir Trabajando y ampliando su negocio con la ayuda de  Emprender. El Sr. es muy responsable y cumplido en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda el grupo y la Intitucion no la defraudará.			

La Sra. ARACELY es la Secretaria; Lleva 6 años en el negocio de venta de frutas, trabaja de lunes a sabado,  desde muy tempranas horas. La Sra. Aracely  es una excelente persona, sabe interactuar con las socias es alegre, creativa y trabajadora. vive en alquiler y tiene 2 hijas bajo su responsabilidad y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en el sustento del hogar.
texts.en:
The Maripositas ("Little Butterflies") Entrepreneurial Bank is located in the 30 de Agosto neighborhood, in the area of Moscu avenue. This entrepreneurial bank is currently in its third loan cycle. It is made up of 13 individuals and is one of the most dynamic and upbeat entrepreneurial banks. It is led by its president, Silvia; Guido is the treasurer, and Nineth (Aracely) is the secretary. The group includes women who sell clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food, groceries, empanadas, bakery products, vanity tables, etc. The meetings take place on Thursdays at 3:30 in the afternoon at the home of one of the group's coordinators, Silvia. The new clients we have attracted and who are joining the entrepreneurial bank, as well as the existing members, all agree about working with Emprender, because its training program teaches them to create projections of their savings, in order to motivate them to save. SILVIA is the group's president. She has 3 years of experience selling clothes, and has recently entered the cosmetics business, for which this loan will be used. She works at this business 8 hours a day. Silvia is the group's founder and is very responsible and dependable; she will not take improper advantage of the opportunity provided to her by Emprender. GUIDO is the treasurer. He has worked for 5 years in the field of carpentry. This new loan will allow him to invest further in his business and improve his income in order to raise his quality of life. He works 7 days a week, 8 hours a day. His work is mainly carried out within his own home, but also on a traveling basis within his neighborhood. His goal is to continue working and expanding his business with Emprender's assistance. Guido is very responsible and dependable within the group, and he will not take improper advantage of the opportunity provided to him by the group and the Institution. ARACELY is the secretary. She has worked for 6 years in her business selling fruit. She works from Monday to Saturday, starting very early in the morning. Aracely is an outstanding individual who knows how to interact with the other members; she is cheerful, creative and hard-working. She lives in a rented home and has 2 daughters in her care. She uses the income she receives to help maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Nolba Maria

texts.es: Nolba Maria Ríos L. tiene 41 años de edad, ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, hace más de  5 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que es el único medio de ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia. Ella inicio este negocio, por medio de su hermano quien le había un automóvil y le había aportado la idea de que realizara viajes expresos a ciertas amistades y así obtendría por lo menos un medio para alimentarse todos los días, y fue así que decidió ingresar en este negocio a pesar de los problemas que ha tenido que enfrentar. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar llantas, mejoras a los asientos y otras cosas. Ella desea comprar placas para otro taxi.
texts.en:
Nolba María is 41 years old and offers transport services. She has been doing this for more than 5 years and it is the only income she has to support her family. She began this business with help from her brother who had a car and gave her the idea to give rides to some of her friends, and in this way she at least could have the means to eat each day. It was also in this way that she decided to invest in her business in spite of the problems that she had faced. This loan is for working capital that she will use to buy tires, improve the seats, and other items. She want to buy plates for another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: Maria Alejandra tiene 48 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el brindar el servicio de costura, hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que aprendió este oficio como un medio de trabajo, a pesar de los años ella logro alcanzar la fama necesaria y obtener muy buenos clientes que llegaban a encargarle algunas hechuras de vestidos y trajes para niños, además la calidad de sus prendas están garantizadas. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de hilos, telas, tijeras, agujas, encajes y cintas. Ella sueña con establecer un taller más grande que genere empleos a otras personas que les guste este oficio.
texts.en:
Maria Alejandra is 48 years old. For more than 20 years she has worked as a seamstress, a skill she learned in order to work on her own. She has been successful at promoting her business and has good customers, who hire her to make dresses and children's clothing. The quality of her work is guaranteed. She asks for financing for working capital to purchase thread, fabric, scissors, needles, lace, and ribbons. She would like to set up a larger workshop, to generate employment for others who like this type of work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mario Aurelio

texts.es: Mario Aurelio tiene 34 años no el primer financiamiento que realiza en Fundación León 2000 por lo que este joven ha luchado por mejorar la condición económica de su familia y ha sido un buen cliente. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Este joven tiene mucho tiempo de estar en este negocio, el ha logrado superar los obstáculos que se le han atravesado el muy humilde y siempre esta proporcionándole a sus hijas lo necesario. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será para la compra azúcar, arroz, aceite, frijoles, gaseosas, pan juegos y detergente ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y quiere ofrecer una variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su deseo es que su pulpería siga creciendo para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario Aurelio is 34 years old, and this is not his first financing with Fundacion Leon 2000. This young man has struggled to improve his family's living conditions, and has been a good customer. He has had a grocery store for a long time, and has successfully faced the obstacles thrown his way. He has always been respectful and constantly provides for his daughters. He requests a loan for working capital to buy sugar, rice, oil, beans, soft drinks, bread, games, and detergent, as Christmas is coming and he wants to offer variety to his customers. His goal is for his store to continue to grow, which will increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elba Rosa Ana

texts.es: La Sra. Elba Vásquez tiene 46 años, es casada vive en casa propia junto a su esposo. Tiene seis hijos sólo el menor está a su cargo el resto de hijos están comprometidos y laboran de forma independiente. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años. Vendiendo mayormente al crédito a trabajadores de los fundos de la zona. Además su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de venta y reparación de bicicletas. Además poseen una parcela de tres Ha la cual arriendan todos los años. Solicita financiamiento para invertir en negocio por campaña de navidad y aprovechar incremento en venta de ropa y regalos. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y hacer crecer sus negocios para apoyar a su menor hijo. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elba Vásquez is 46 years old, married and living in her own home with her husband. She has six children, with only the youngest dependent on her. Her other children have their own lives and work independently. For four years now she has been selling clothing from her home, mostly to farm laborers in the area. Her husband has a shop where he sells and repairs bicycles. They also have a three-hectare plot of land, which they rent every year. She asks for financing for her business at Christmas time, to take advantage of the increase in the sale of clothing and gifts. Her dream is to have better housing and grow her business and support her youngest child. Elba and her husband are grateful for the support we can offer to improve their living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 31 años, una humilde mujer quien vive en su propia casa y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobresalir en la vida. Por tal motivo se dedica al tejido artesanal, siendo esta actividad en el que diariamente teje, mostrando toda su creatividad y habilidad sobre estos tejidos y por lo que son vendidos en la ciudad del Cuzco y en Bolivia, que es donde más demanda tiene sus prendas. Este trabajo le llena de mucha satisfacción, ya que conoce esta labor por medio de su mamá, quien le enseñó cuando ella era una niña. Desde entonces lleva 7 años tejiendo, pese a que la parte más difícil es tener que transportar sus prendas a los distintos destinos de distribución, pero lo hace con mucha ganas ya que espera crecer su taller y mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, además dentro de su banco comunal la consideran como una mujer muy alegre y siempre esta pendiente de todos los acuerdos que tienen sus compañeros. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old. She is a humble woman who lives in her own house and is used to working very hard to get ahead in life. For this reason, she works at sewing traditional clothing. She sews every day, and her work shows such ability and creativity that it is sold in the city of Cuzco and in Bolivia, where it is in high demand.

This work fills Gloria with satisfaction. She learned it from her mother when she was a girl. She has been in business for seven years. The most difficult part of the business is transporting her products to the distant places where they are sold. But she does this with enthusiasm, as she wishes to grow her business and increase her income.

This is Gloria’s 1st loan with MFP, and she commits to making her payments on time. In her communal bank, she is considered a very happy woman, and she always complies with the agreements of the group. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy wool to make more traditional clothing.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Karina Vanessa

texts.es:
Karina es una madre de familia de 18 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hija de 9 meses de nacida en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en casa de sus padres. Este negocio es de gran ayuda para sus gastos familiares. Ella se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a su negocio.

Karina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos para cubrir la demanda por las temporadas de Navidad y Año Nuevo, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación, por ello desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio. Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus familiares y vecinos los que la consideran una muchacha responsable y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Karina is an 18 year old mother who lives in her parents’ house with her husband and nine month old daughter. Her residence is in the city of Cayaltí, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, she has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a small store she manages out her parents’ home. This business has been a great help in covering her family expenses. She does the best she can to move her business forward.

Karina wants to expand her business by purchasing more products to meet the demand for Christmas and New Years. However, she does not have enough capital to take further action so she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest wish is to provide her daughter with a better life and a good education. In order to do this, she wants to continue working and succeeding in her business. Karina is well-known and respected by her relatives and neighbors and is considered to be a responsible and enterprising young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo A. M. esta casado, y tiene 3 hijos, que junto con su esposa son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 12, 11 y 6 años respectivamente. El tiene una soda en Palmares, contiguo a Ferretería Palmares. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de un moto para repartir comida. Este moto le ayudará economiza en combustible por que ahorita, lo hace en carro. El ha tenido la soda hace 3 meses y tiene 12 años de experiencia.  Es la primera vez don Danilo se financia con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El desea que tener un negocio propio y poder dar un buen servicio a domicilio para que su ingreso le pueda ayudar a que sus hijos estudien. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Danilo M. A. is married and has 3 children, who along with his wife are his highest priority. His children are 12, 11, and 6 years old respectively. In the city of Palmares, Danilo manages a soda fountain that is located next to a hardware store. His loan will be used to buy a motorcycle so that he will be able to deliver food. This will help him save on fuel costs because he currently makes deliveries by car. His soda fountain has been in existence for three months, and he has 12 years of business experience. This is the first time Don Danilo has received funding from FUDECOSUR and has no other debts with formal banks. His wish is to establish his business and provide good home delivery service so that he can generate income to support his children’s education. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for making deliveries

loans.name: K´alamarka Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento KALAMARKA trabaja con nuestra Institución hace mas de dos años, este banco se caracteriza porque sus integrantes son 50% varones y 50% mujeres, las socias se dedican al comercio y venta de frutas, los socios la mayoria son transportistas.La señora Durán es una participante antigua y ocupa el cargo de presidenta con el prestamo a logrado diversificar y aumentar la producción de frutas que tiene en la localidad de Sapaqui, con este negocio a podido aumentar su capital y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su númerosa familia. la señora VICENTA, Es una nueva integrante y tiene a su cargo la secretaria, ella se dedica a la venta de CDs en las cuidades de La Paz y El Alto, con el prestamo a logrado traer por cantidad CDs,VCDs, mejorando de esta forma sus ingresos. El señor MOISES,esta en su 3er ciclo, actualmente ocupa el cargo de tesorero, tiene una familia compuesta por 4 miembros, es chofer propietario y con el prestamo a logrado realizar el mantenimiento de su movilidad, tiene pensado comprar varios repuestos como: llantas, pastillas, con el tiempo quiere ahorrar para comprarse otra movilidad, esta es su primera experiencia con Bancos de Emprendimiento lo que le a permitido ahorrar y mejorar sus ingresos para el y su familia.
texts.en:
The K’Alamarka Communal Bank has been working with our Institution for more than two years. The group consists of half men and half women. Most of the women buy and sell fruit, while the men are in the transportation sector.

Sra. Durán is a long-time member and currently serves as the Communal Bank president. Her loan will allow her to diversify and increase her inventory of fruit that she offers from her vending location in Sapaqui. She is requesting to increase her business capital so that she will be able to provide better living conditions for her large family.

Sra. Vicenta is a new member who currently serves as the Communal Bank secretary. She sells CDs in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. Her loan will be used to purchase CDs and VCDs in order to improve her earnings.

Sr. Moises, who is participating in his third loan cycle, serves as the Communal Bank treasurer. There are four members in his family. He is an independent driver and will use his loan to maintain his vehicle. Moises plans to purchase spare parts such as tires and switches. Over time he wants to save enough money to buy another vehicle. This is his first experience working with Communal Banks and having the opportunity to save and improve his family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 58 años, es una alegre y amable mujer que se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, vive sola ya que se separo D. su pareja.DesD. hace 6 años se dedica a este oficio ya que le da buenos ingresos con los cuales pueD. mantenerse y sentirse independiente. El trabajo D. Carmen comienza desD. tempranas horas D. la mañana cuando  apertura  su establecimiento para ofrecer las gaseosas, cervezas entre otras bebidas las cuales venD. y distribuye a sus  asiduos clientes. Ella considera muy rentable su trabajo es por esta razón  que desea ampliarlo, y compra al por mayor gran cantidad D. estas bebidas, las cuales sabe serán muy demandadas en la estación D. verano que ya se acerca.Es su quinto préstamo en MFP y siempre ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en todos sus pagos.Con el dinero del crédito comprará varias cajas D. cervezas y también jabas D. gaseosa que piensa vender con mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and a cheerful, friendly woman who sells drinks. She lives alone and is separated from her common law husband. Carmen has been in this business for the past six years because it provides a good income to support herself and remain independent. She begins work in the early morning hours when she opens her establishment to begin selling sodas, beer, and other beverages to her frequent customers. Carmen believes her business is very profitable, so she wants to expand it by buying more beverages at wholesale. This will enable her to keep up with the high demand for the upcoming summer season.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Carmen has always demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in all of her payments. With the proceeds of her loan, she will purchase crates of beer and sodas in hopes of selling them successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Binta
