texts.fr: Binta M. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TANAFF depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle gère sa boutique où elle vend divers produits tel que du lait, du riz, du sucre de l'huile végétal etc... elle fait également la transformation et vente de savon traditionnel.
texts.en:
Binta M., 47, is married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of TANAFF for six and a half years. She has a little shop where she sells various items such as milk, rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc. She also makes and sells traditional soap.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand her little business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 50 años es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella quien vive en casa de un familiar lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Es así que tiene un negocio, que es la venta de ropa extranjera, desde ese momento se dedica a la venta ambulatoria en las principales ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, durante todos los días de la semana. Irma es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse alguna prenda, ya que la parte que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y es buena dando consejos y proponer que prendas pueden usar. De esta manera lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad, siendo lo más duro y complicado es llevar los fardos de ropa que son muy pesados al lugar de venta. Con el tiempo espera juntar el capital necesario para instalar un puesto en el mercado San José (Mercado Importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus prendas. Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, por lo que esta muy contenta, asimismo se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas sin demora, además se le considera como una persona muy alegre y trabajadora y por ello los integrantes de su banco comunal la estiman mucho. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más ropa extranjera, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de prendas para elegir.
texts.en:
Irma is 50 years old and very hardworking woman. She lives in the home of a relative and desires to have a peaceful retirement. To achieve this goal she has a business selling imported clothing. At the moment, she sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor through the main fairs in the city of Juliaca every day of the week. Irma is a very persuasive saleswoman and always convinces her customers to leave with some clothing. The part of her job that she enjoys the most is conversing with her customers and providing them good advice as to what clothing they should wear. Irma has been in business for 13 years. The hardest and most complicated part is transporting the heavy bundles of clothing to the places where she sells. In time, she hopes to acquire enough capital to secure a vending post at the San José Market (the largest market in the city of Juliaca), where it will be more convenient for her to sell her products.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy and agrees to make all of her payments on time. Irma is also regarded as cheerful and hardworking, thereby making her one of the most respected members of her Communal Bank. With her loan of 1000 soles, Irma will buy more imported clothing so that she can offer her customers a wider selection.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.es: El señor Santos Domingo  H. H., tiene 53 años habita en el Bario Borgoña es casado y su esposa es ama de casa, en ocasiones vende frutas obteniendo ingresos para la aportación  a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores, cuyas edades van entre los  35, 30 y 28 años de edad, todos son independientes pero viven en el terreno del papá en casas apartes, todos se integran en las tareas de la finca,  desearían en un futuro poder tener las posibilidades de construir un cauce, debido a que en la época del invierno se les inunda todas sus casas, ellos tienen 29 años de dedicarse a este rubro y  el principal problema que han enfrentado a lo largo de estos años, han sido el alza de los precios de los productos, esto incrementa de gran manera los costos de producción, para esto han solicitado de un préstamo para poder brindarle un mejor mantenimiento a la producción de este año, todo este fuerte trabajo se ve encaminado a alcanzar un objetivo, el cual es el poder conseguir la legalización de sus tierras, ellos se han sobresalido por ser una familia muy unida y responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Domingo Hernandez is 53 years old and lives in Barrio Borgoño. He is married and his wife tends the house and, occasionally, sells fruit, adding to household income. They have 3 grown children, aged 28 to 35. All are independent but they live on their father's land in separate houses. And they all carry out tasks on their farm.

In the future, they hope to be able to finish constructing a ditch, because each winter all their houses are flooded. They have dedicated 29 years to farming and the main problem they have encountered over all these years is the rising price of products. This raises greatly the cost of farm production and, for that reason, Santos has solicited a loan to better maintain this year's production.

All this hard work is aimed at achieving an objective, which is to achieve the legalization of their lands. They have overcome much by being a very united and responsible family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO MAINTAIN FARM PRODUCTION

loans.name: Plan Autopista Group

texts.es:
EL SR. JACINTO, Es el presedente del banco D. emprendemiento alto plan autopista, es un prestamo que esta en su 2do Ciclo y estan conformado por 10 integrantes 9 mujeres y 1 varon el sr. Jacinto es soltero y tiene un hijo y hasi el papel D. padre y madre desD. hase mucho tiempo y se dedica a la venta D. coca y viaja a Yungas para traer mercaderia D. coca y en sus tiempos libres tambien se dedica a la construcción el prestamo que esta sacando es para aumento D. su capital D. trabajo.  						

La Sra. CANDELARIA, Es la tesorera en el banco y ella tiene dos hijos y se dedica a pasanaquera , vale decir que ella entrega mercaderia D. vivires a pedito D. las personas o a requerimiento y la forma D. pago es a facilidades y tiene su modalidad D. pagos semanales o quencenales y tiene un micro verD. y su esposo es chofer y trabajo con la movilidad.  		

La Sra. EUGENIA, Es la secretaria del banco tiene 3 hijos y se dedica a la venta D. comida en Tablada y su esposo trabaja en la alcaldia del Alto el prestamo es para aumento D. su capital D. trabajo para poder mejorar sus ingresos y asi para poder salir adelanD. y brindar mayor comodidad a sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se observa muchos deseos D. mejorar en su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jacinto is the president of the “Bank of High Enterprise” of the “Alto Plan Autopista District,” which is in its second loan cycle. The bank is maD. up of ten members; nine ladies and one gentleman. Mr. Jacinto is the single father of one son and had played both parental roles for a long time. He sells coca and travels to Yungas to bring the coca items. In his spare time he also works in construction. This loan will be used to increase his working capital. Ms. Canelaria is the bank’s treasurer. She has two children and works as a “pasanaquera,” which means that she delivers merchandise and supplies as requested or required by various people and provides different payment options to her customers, including weekly or bi-weekly installment plans. She also has a small bus that her husband drives. Ms. Euenia is the bank’s secretary. She has three children. She sells food in Tablada and her husband works for the city of Alto. This loan will proviD. working capital so that they can increase their income and move ahead and give a better life to their school-aged children. The family has a great desire to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide working capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge Murilo J. tiene 28 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Platanares con su familia de 7 miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de de cerdos para engorde y venderlos en comercios cercanos. El trabaja con su familia mas que todo en ganadería y cerdos.  Es la cuarto vez don Jorge se financia con FUDECOSUR, obteniendo montos de 200000 hasta 2000000 colones. Estos prestamos le han ayudado a trabajar, prestando capital, con un tasa interes bajo.  El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera tener un beneficio economico para la familia y salir adelante. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jorge Murilo Jiménez is 28, single, and does not have children. He lives in Platanares with his family; there are seven members. He wants a loan to buy pigs to fatten and sell to nearby businesses. He works with his family, mostly with livestock and pigs. This is Jorge’s fourth loan with FUDECOSUR. He has received amounts from 200,000 to 2,000,000 colones. These loans, made with low interest, have helped him to work. He has not had other loans with formal banks. He expects to have an economic benefit for his family and to get ahead. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Teofilo Wilber

texts.es: El Sr. Teófilo I. vive en el Caserío San Juan Bautista perteneciente al distrito de Santiago en casa de su madre junto a su esposa y su menor hijo de 3 años. Labora como obrero de campo en distintos fundos de la zona. Actualmente está trabajando en Agrícola La Venta SA. No cuenta con endeudamiento en ninguna institución financiera. Posee bienes comprados con sus ahorros producto de su trabajo. Su esposa labora como obrera por temporadas, actualmente sólo se encuentra al cuidado de su hijo. Solicita apoyo para terminar de acondicionar un ambiente que le ha cedido su madre dentro de su casa la cual tiene un módulo de material noble. Son jóvenes trabajadores cuyo sueño es poder tener su casa propia y establecerse como una familia trabajando para el bienestar de su hijo. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Mr. Teofilo I. lives in the village of San Juan Bautista in the Santiago district, in a house with his mother and his wife and their youngest son who is three. He is a farm worker on different farms throught the area. At the moment, he is working through the group Agricola La Venta SA. He does not have any debts with any financial institution. He has good customers and has savings as a product of his work. His wife is a temporary laborer, but at the moment she is only caring for their son. He is asking for a loan to end the situation in which they live in his mother's house, so that they have a place made of good materials. They are young workers that have a dream of having their own house, establishing themselves as a family working for the well-being of their son. They give thanks for the support that you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve their living conditions

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 56 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y carismático, vive solo, ya que esta separado y sus tres hijos Martha (32), Robert  (28) y Mario (26), son independientes.Desde hace 6 años se dedica al trabajoso negocio de la venta de pollo, actividad que realiza con muchas ganas y buen humor ya que es un trabajo que le da el sustento para vivir. Lorenzo trabaja desde tempranas horas en la mañana y se prolonga hasta la tarde en el “Mercado de Luciana” (uno de los más concurridos por  la zona en la que vive), siempre atiende a todos sus clientes con una amable  sonrisa  y con un broma lo que  entretiene mucho  a sus asiduos clientes, quienes se han hecho muy amigos de él. En un futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio comprando más mercadería para  así obtener  más ingresos a su economía.Es su quinto préstamo con  MFP y es muy puntual con todos los pagos y así se demuestra su  gran responsabilidad.Piensa invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de gran cantidad  de  mercadería en pollos para obtener mejores ingresos, y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 56, is a hard-working and charasmatic man. He lives alone because he is separated. He has three children. Martha is 32, Robert is 28, and Mario is 26. They are independent. He has worked for six years in the demanding job of selling chicken. He does this with a lot of desire and good humor because his work is what supports him. Lorenzo works from the very early hours in the morning until the early evening. He works at the Mercado de Luciana (one of the most popular markets in the area where he lives). He always waits on all of his customers with a friendly smile and a joke, which greatly entertains his regular customers. His customers have made friends with him. In the future he would like to keep improving his business by purchasing more merchandise to get more income. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He is very punctual with all of his payments, and he demonstrates great responsibility. He plans to use the money from the loan to buy more chickens to get more income and keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to improve his business

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar C. V. tiene 38 años de edad vive en el barrio la Borgoña es casado y su esposa es ama de casa pero le apoya en los trabajos del campo, tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 9 años  los dos mayores  cursan la escuela secundaria, pero en los ratos libres también se involucran en los  trabajos del campo, ellos como familia se dedican al cultivo de piña y granos básicos desde hace 22 años, uno de los principales problemas que han enfrentado han sido la poca fertilidad de su suelo producto de las malas prácticas de mantenimiento a la producción, por tal razón las frutas son de poca calidad, de manera que solicitó este crédito con el objetivo de poder comprar fertilizantes para el uso de los cultivos.
El interés de producir la tierra, sale de de la necesidad de obtener ingresos para sobrevivir y brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia, Don Julio se ha destacado por ser una persona de mucha formalidad y responsabilidad  con sus créditos, pues ellos son una familia de trabajo que poco a poco han logrado obtener una avance económico, gracias a interés de poder de poder brindarles educación, salud y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar C. is 38 years old, lives in Borgoña Barrio, is married and his wife is a housewife who helps with farm chores. They have 3 children ages 16, 14,and 9. The 2 eldest are in secondary school, but during their time off they too are involved in farm work. As a family, for more than 22 years they have dedicated themselves to cultivating pineapples and basic grains.

One of the main problems they have encountered is the poor fertility of their land, a product of bad practices in maintaining production. For this reason, their fruits are of poor quality. For this reason, Julio is soliciting this loan with the objective of buying fertilizers to use in cultivation.

His interest in greater productivity of the soil stems from the necessity of obtaining income for survival and to offer a better future for his family. Julio has stood out as very formal and responsible in his loans. They are a hard-working family who have, little by little, managed to forge ahead economically, thanks to their interest in providing education, health and wellbeing for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO ACHIEVE BETTER PRODUCTION AND SOIL MAINTENANCE

loans.name: Luz Diomira

texts.es:
Luz tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres con el menor de sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de alimentos en el exterior del mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí, todos los días ofrece una variedad de platos típicos, tanto de la sierra como de la costa del país. Usualmente ofrece sopa verde (elaborado con plantas comestibles de la sierra); sopa de mote (elaborado a base de maíz blanco); huevos sancochados de codorniz; champús (bebida elaborada a base de maíz) y cachangas (producto comestible hecho a base de harina de trigo).

Su negocio siempre es muy frecuentado debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos. Luz se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para elaborar más productos por la temporada navideña.

Luz desea ver a su hijo convertido en un excelente profesional por lo que diariamente se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajao. Ella es una madre de familia luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se le presentan.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old, separated with three children. She lives in her parents house with the youngest of her children in the district of Cayaltí, situated one hour from Chiclayo.

For 6 years she has sold food in the exterior of the Cayaltí market. Everyday she offers a variety of typical plates, from the mountains to the coast of the country. Usually she offers sopa verde (prepared from edible plants in the mountains), sopa de mote (prepared from white corn), eggs sancochados de codorniz, champús (a drink made from corn) and cachangas (edible product made from all purpose flour)

Her business is well frequented at this time with what she prepares her food. Luz is requesting her first loan of 1000 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternative that she thinks she will use to buy ingredients and consumables to make more products for the Christmas season.

Luz wishes to see her son become an excellent professional so that daily he pushes to the max in his job. She is a hard working mother that has moved forward in the weight of difficulties that have presented themselves.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ro buy consumables to make food in this Christmas season

loans.name: Daniela Del Socorro

texts.es: La  señora Daniela del Socorro S. G., tiene 19 años de edad vive en los Laureles Norte y es soltera, como toda una mujer joven atesora algún día lograr obtener su casa, casarse y tener hijos, así mismo desea culminar sus estudios profesionales, ella se dedica a la costura, lleva 4 años trabajando en esto, su mama fue la que la impulso a convertirse en costurera, hoy en día comparte el negocio con su madre, su mayor sueño sería algún día lograr montar su propi o taller de costura pero para poder alcanzar este sueño solicitó un préstamo que le traerá mayores ingresos económicos, con el crédito planea comprar telas debido a que está perdiendo ordenes de trabajo, por falta de efectivo, este apoyo beneficiaría a la madre también pues contarían con mejores ingresos que se traducirían a un mejor nivel económico.
texts.en:
Señora Daniela del Socorro S. G. is 19, single, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. Like every young woman, she is saving to have her own home some day, to get married, and to have children. She also hopes to finish her professional studies. She makes a living by sewing. She has done this for 4 years. Her mother motivated her to become a seamstress. Today she shares her business with her mother. Her biggest dream is to some day have enough money to start her own sewing shop, but to reach this dream, she requested a loan that will bring her more economic income. With this credit, she plans to buy fabric because she is losing orders because she doesn't have enough cash. This support will benefit her mother as well becuase they will have more income that will translate into a better financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to carry out more sewing orders

loans.name: Jessica Janina

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado a dos horas de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja como maestro de construcción civil, pero lo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos familiares. Por ello, desde hace un año, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría cerdos y algunas aves de corral para luego venderlas a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona.

La continua demanda por sus animales ha hecho que el número de animales con los que contaba disminuya por lo que Jessica se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y ampliar su negocio.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29, married, and has a 3-year-old son. She lives with her family in the Oyotún district, which is located 2 hours from Chiclayo. Her husband works as a civil construction worker, but he doesn't earn enough to cover all of their family's expenses. This is why she has raised and sold small animals for a year. She raises pigs and some poultry that she later sells to merchants in the area. The continuing demand she has had for her animals has made the number of animals she has decrease. This is why she is requesting a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa for 800 PEN to buy more animals to expand her business. She is quite responsible and devoted to her family. Her biggest dream is to see her son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals to expand her business.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento SANTA RITA se caracteriza por ser un banco formado por socias antiguas, actualmente la mayoria D. las señoras se dedica a la venta D. productos como: celulares, productos D. belleza, ollas D. aluminio,atención en su tienda D. barrio y otras a la elaboración D. mantas, macrame y tejidos.VIQUI, Esta socia es una D. las más antiguas ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, la Sra. trabaja con tejidos y macrame, con el prestamo podra comprar por mayor lana ,cintas, y D. esta manera a conseguido diversificar sus productos y no solo realizar tejidos para niños, sino tambien recibir pedidos para damas y varones, con este aumento D. productos a incrementado sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad D. vida. ADRIANA, esta participando en su segundo ciclo, tiene a su cargo la secretaria, ella  trabaja en una empresa D. limpieza, pero como su sueldo no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es que ella deciD. emprender otro negocio con tejido en macrame, con el prestamo otorgado podra comprar material para elaborar mantas a pedido ,mejorando así sus ingresos D. ella y su familia. LUCILA, ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, tiene una familia D. 4 miembros, ella tiene una tienda D. barrio, con el prestamo podra comprar por mayor y diversificar los productos D. su negocio, con los ingresos piensa ahorrar para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
The enterprise bank Santa Rita is characterized by being maD. up of senior members. Currently the majority of the women make a living by selling products such as cell phones, beauty products, or aluminum pots; attending to a neighborhood store; or making blankets, macramé, or hand-woven items. Viqui is the most senior member and is the president of the group. She works by weaving and making macramé. She will use this loan to buy wool wholesale and ribbon and to diversify her products so she doesn't only weave items for children, but also for women and men. With this increase in products, she will be able to increase her income and quality of life. Adriana is participating in her second loan. She is the secretary of the group and works for a cleaning company. Since her wages don't let her cover all of the costs of supporting her family, she decided to start another business by weaving macramé. With this loan, she will be able to buy materials to make her blankets for which she takes orders and will improve her and her family's income. Lucila is the treasurer of the group and has four people in her family. She has a neighborhood store. With this loan, she will buy items wholesale and diversify the products in her business. With her income, she plans to save money to buy some land.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her amount of merchandise

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es:
“Bolívar ” es un grupo de 9 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo, sobre todo en esta época de fin de año donde la demanda de productos se incrementa.
Ellas  tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de mantas, venta de calzados, venta de yuca y confección de chamarras, esta es la segunda oportunidad que solicitan el préstamo a través del financiamiento de kiva.
texts.en:
"Bolivar" is a group of 9 women and one man who attend their meetings at "Los Andes" focal center. They came together in order to have access to financing since all of them need to increase their capital, especially this time of year when demand for products rises. They all have their own lines of work, such as: prepared meal sales, neighborhood grocery store, cosmetic sales, blanket sales, footwear sales, yucca (cassava, manioc) sales, jacket-making. This is their second loan opportunity though Kiva financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucilda es una emprendedora mujer de 52 años, ella vive con su hija en su casa que es  propia.El tratar de pasar mas tiempo con su familia hizo que piense en tener un negocio en su propia casa y es por ello que puso su tienda de comestibles, y dedicándose a este trabajo tiene ya  14 años, tiempo en el cual ha ganado mucha experiencia en cuanto a la atención al cliente y obteniendo buenos ingresos ya que es muy carismática con todos sus clientes. Las ventas son buenas y ella quiere mejorar su negocio es por esta razón que esta pensando en implementarlo mejor  con gran variedad de  productos que su clientela demanda, para así fidelizarlos y obtener mejores ingresos.Es su quinto préstamo en MFP y siempre ha sido  muy puntual con todos los pagos.Con el dinero del crédito tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de comestibles para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Lucilda is an enterprising, 52-year-old woman. She lives with her daughter in her own home. Because she was trying to spend more time with her family, she started a grocery store in her own home. She has had this business for 14 years, in which time she has gained a lot of experience in serving her customers and making good income because she is very charismatic with her customers. Her sales are good and she wants to improve her business. This is why she is thinking about implementing a larger variety of products that her customers demand so they will be loyal and she can make more income. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has always been very punctual with her payments. With the money from this credit, she has planned to buy a larger quantity of food to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Solidarias está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras y trabajadoras. Una de ellas es Esmeralda R. Z., ella hace tres años instaló una pequeña venta de chiverías, dulces con el tiempo y con ayuda de los préstamos logro introducir granos básicos, jabones, carne, verduras, frutas, y otros productos hasta convertir su venta en una pulpería pero ella sueña que sea una miscelánea. 

Zoraida Leonor B. de 40 años vende productos lácteos como leche, leche agria, cuajada queso, crema y gaseosa. Mientras Azucena C. tiene un tramo de cosméticos en el mercado oriental y que a pesar de que el último incendio de este populoso lugar su economía se vio afectada debido a que su tramo fue uno de los primeros consumidos por las llamas como la del resto de sus compañeros su arduo trabajo le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Solidarias" group is made up of three determined, enterprising, and hard-working women. One of them is Esmeralda R. Z.. She has had a business for three years selling snacks and sweets. With the help of her loans, she has managed to start selling basic grains, soap, meat, vegetables, fruit, and other products to convert her business into a grocery store, but she hopes that it will become a general store.

Zoraida Leonor B. is 40 and sells dairy products like milk, leche agria [a product similar to buttermilk], curd, cream, and soft drinks.

Azucena C. sells cosmetics in the eastern market despite the fact that the last fire in this crowded place affected her business since her stretch in the market was one of the first consumed by flames. But as with the rest of her co-workers, her hard work has helped her get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other food products

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia de 32 años, vive junto a su esposo Eladio de 38 años y sus dos hijos Elena de 13 y Ever de 7 años, en su propia casa, Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y aunque solo pudo acabar la primaria esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para darles a sus hijos unos buenos estudios. A pesar de las variaciones climáticas Lidia sale desde muy temprano en compañía de su esposo a conseguir leche que ordeñaron los ganaderos, para luego dedicarse a la preparación de quesos y que posteriormente son vendidos en los mercados de Juliaca y Huancane. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo, y por lo que lleva haciendo esta actividad más 10 años y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir la cantidad de leche necesaria para preparar los 30 quesos que produce diariamente. Lo que más anhela Lidia es tener una tienda muy grande en la ciudad de Juliaca  donde pueda vender sus deliciosos quesos con más tranquilidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas, asimismo ya se siente comprometida con sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, incrementará su capital de trabajo, para así poder comprar más leche y mejorar los implementos con los que prepara sus quesos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 32 years old. She lives with her 38 year old husband, Eladio, and their two children, Elena, age 13, and Ever, age 7, in their own home. She is a fighter and although she only could finish primary school, she is prepared to work very hard to give her children a good education. Despite the climatic variations, Lidia leaves very early with her husband to obtain milk that the livestock farmers milked. She then prepares cheeses which are sold afterward in the Juliaca and Huancane markets. Lidia enjoys a lot about her work. From doing this activity for over 10 years, she believes that the hardest part is obtaining the amount of milk needed to prepare the 30 cheeses that she produces daily. What Lidia longs for the most is to have a very large store in the city Juliaca where she could sell her delicious cheeses with more ease. This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes not to miss payments of her fees. She also already feels committed to her other companions from her village bank. With the thousand nuevos soles requested, she will increase her working capital so that she can purchase more milk and improve the tools with which she prepares her cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more milk and tools to prepare cheeses

loans.name: Mariama Ba

texts.fr: Mariama Bâ D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont elle a la charge. Avec son crédit elle gère une cantine en face du marché de son quartier où elle vend le petit déjeuné. Elle possède aussi d'une table où elle vend également des légumes frais. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et la scolarisation des ses enfants. Elle est le soutien de la famille, son mari étant malade.
texts.en:
Mariama Bâ D., 38, is married and the mother of 5 children for whom she is financially responsible. With her loan, she runs a little food stall opposite the market in her neighborhood where she sells breakfast. She also has a table where she sells fresh vegetables. She is working hard to improve living conditions for her family and pay school fees for her children. She is the breadwinner, since her husband is ill.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand her little businesses

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de un año se dedica la transporte público en una mototaxi que logró comprar gracias al dinero de sus ahorros. Jorge trabaja en ella todos los días cubriendo rutas en Cayaltí y sus caseríos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que trata de esforzarse al máximo.

Debido al tiempo de uso de su vehículo y a la situación accidentada de las carreteras de la zona, la mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para reparar los desperfectos y otorgarle mantenimiento general.

Jorge desea seguir adelante y continuar trabajando para mantener a su familia y brindarles lo mejor. El es una persona conocida y respetada por sus vecinos y conocidos que lo consideran un padre de familia responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 29 year old father who lives with his wife and his 5 year old son in his parents' home, located in the Cayaltí district, an hour from the city Chiclayo. For over a year, he has worked in public transport in a motorcycle taxi that he managed to buy thanks to the money from his savings. Jorge works in his taxi everyday covering routes in Cayaltí and its surrounding villages. This business is the only source of family income from which he tries to stretch to its limit. Due to the time of use of his vehicle and the rough situation of the roads in the area, the motorcycle taxi has started to suffer some mechanical failures. Because of this he has seen the necessity to request for the first time from Edpyme Alternative a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to repair the damage and give it general maintenance. Jorge wants to move forward and continue working to support his family and give them the best. He is a well-known and respected person among his neighbors and acquaintances who think of him as a responsible and hardworking father.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance expenses

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana de 36 años es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, vive sola en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Maximiliana es la venta de queso, es así que desde muy temprano sale a repartir los quesos que previamente los compró en los poblados de Taraco y Saman, y llevados a los principales mercados de Juliaca, en donde es muy esperada por sus clientes, quienes ya conocen la calidad de su producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la libertad de horarios que tiene, por lo que lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad de manera independiente, siendo lo más trabajoso es conseguir quesos de buena calidad, ya que ella tiene una  reputación ganada ante sus clientes y no quiere perderla. En adelante espera juntar el capital necesario para alquilar un puesto de venta y poder ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para que así no pueda causar problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, ya que es muy estimada por ser una persona muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más quesos, ya que últimamente esta teniendo más demanda por parte de sus compradores.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, 36 years old, is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives alone in a rented room and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Maximiliana's business is the sale of cheese. Consequently, she leaves very early to deliver the cheeses, which she previously buys from the towns Taraco and Saman. She takes them to the main markets of Juliaca, where she is eagerly awaited by her clients, who already know the quality of her product. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has in her work schedule. From doing this activity for six years independently, the most laborious part is obtaining good quality cheese, as she already has an earned reputation before her customers and she does not want to lose it. From now on, she expects to raise the necessary capital to rent a store stall and be able to offer her customers a better service. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay all the dues on time so that it will not cause problems for her other companions from her communal bank as she is very esteemed for being a very responsible person. With the 1000 nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will buy more cheese since lately she has had more demand from her buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cheeses

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora D. 30 años D. edad,vive con su esposo Ricardo y sus hijos Marcia (14) y Ricardo (10) en su casa propia.Gracias a sus buenas cualidades culinarias, se desempeña  desD. hace 15 años en  L. venta D. comida en el restaurant que posee en su casa. Los clientes frecuentan mucho su establecimiento ya que se sienten muy bien con L. atención y con el sabor D. todos los platillos que Yenny prepara, pues cocina todo con mucha dedicación y con los mejores ingredientes que pueD. obtener, es por esta razón  que esta pensando en hacer crecer su negocio. Además del restaurante, Yeny también venD. jugos al costado D. su negocio, con L. única finalidad D. abarcar todas las necesidades D. L. asidua clienteL. que L. visita diariamente.Aunque se encuentra en el cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma promete ser  puntual en sus pagos.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad D. ingredientes para el negocio D. los jugos ya que esta pensando en ampliarlo  y así mejorar.
texts.en:
Yenny is a happy and hard-working 30 year old woman. She lives with her husband Ricardo and her children Marcia (14) and Ricardo (10) in a home that they own. Thanks to her good culinary skills, for the last 15 years she has worked selling food in the restaurant that she runs in her home. Customers visit her restaurant frequently because they feel good about the service and the taste of all the dishes that Yenny prepares. She is very committed to her cooking and uses the best ingredients that she can get. This is why she is thinking about growing her business. Besides the restaurant, Yenny also sells juices to the siD. of her business, with the goal of fulfilling all the needs of the assiduous clientele that visits her daily. Although this is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, she promises to be on time in her repayments. With the money from the loan she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients for the juice business, because she is thinking of expanding it and thus better her situation.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her business.

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr: Assanatou Bâ est mariée, elle est âgée de 44 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demi et a eu 9 expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe une activité de vente de tabac. Ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants et d'appuyer financièrement son papa.
texts.en:
Assanatou Bâ is married, 44-years-old, and has two children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for four and a half years and has received nine loans from them before. She is developing a business to sell tobacco. Her profits will ensure the schooling and health of her children and provide financial support for her father.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promotion of commercial business

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 47 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos ya disipados y vive solo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 10 años ha solventado sus gastos personales y familiares brindando el servicio de transporte público en una mototaxi, usualmente brinda el servicio dentro de la ciudad de Cayaltí y en sus anexos.

El contínuo uso otorgado a su vehículo y la condición accidentada de las carreteras de la zona han hecho que empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Marcial desea empezar en el futuro un negocio de comercio de ganado. El es una persona conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Marcial is 47 years old and is the father of three grown children. He lives alone in the district of Cayaltí, which is situated an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years he has taken care of his personal expenses and those of his family by offering transport services in a mototaxi or motorcycle taxi. He usually offers services in the city of Cayaltí and the surrounding areas. The continual use seen by his vehicle and the poor condition of the roads in the area have meant that it is now having some mechanical problems. For this reason he has found it necessary to request for the first time a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he plans to use to repair and maintain his vehicle. Marcial would like to start a livestock trading business in the future. He is a well-known and well-regarded person in the area in which he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of repair and maintenance of a mototaxi.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda es una madre de familia de 62 años de edad, hace dos meses falleció su esposo y actualmente  vive junto a una hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas en la puerta de su casa. Ella vende frutas de acuerdo a la estación climática a sus habituales clientes. Este negocio le ha ayudado a afrontar los gastos familiares y actualmente se vale de él para sustentarse.

Olinda desea ampliar su negocio durante esta temporada ya que las frutas como el mango, la ciruela, el pacae y el tamarindo abundan durante el verano y estas frutas son muy solicitadas en esta época para preparar bebidas debido al sofocante calor. Olinda no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Olinda no ha decaído a pesar de la ausencia de su esposo y desea seguir trabajando. Su más grande anhelo es instalar una bodega con la cual pueda seguir saliendo adelante en los próximos años.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 62 year old mother. Her husband passed away two months ago and she currently lives with one of her daughters in the district of Cayalti, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years she has run a small fruit-selling business at the entrance of her home. She sells seasonal fruits to her usual customers. This business has helped her to cover household expenses and she currently relies on it to support herself. Olinda hopes to expand her business during this time of year because fruits such as mango, plum, pacay fruit and tamarind are in great supply in the summer. These fruits are very sought after in this season to prepare drinks, because of the stifling heat. Olinda does not have enough funds to do this herself, and for this reason she is for the first time asking for a loan of 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Olinda has not let her husband’s absence get her down, and she wants to keep working. Her greatest hope is to set up a small grocery store with which she can keep moving ahead in the coming years.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit to expand business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine  O. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 54 years old. Josephine is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine  has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Josephine  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her loan to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Josephine  from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 67 years old. Paterna is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Paterna makes and sells a variety of different foods in the local community. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Paterna's 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda D. is from the village of Mamanga Gamay. She is 55 years old. Luzminda is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase new items to sell. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Luzminda's 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb K., 38, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of grinding rice and selling it to her existing and new customers, earning an income of US $5 per day. Her husband transports dirt and sand to fill out the land for people in the province, earning an income of US $14 per day. Both sources of income from K. and her husband help cover the family expenses. K. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a machine to pump sand from the rivers and ponds. This is her third loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. She hopes that in the future she will be able to run a big business of selling dirt and sand. She even wants her children to finish high school and continue to the university.

loans.use: To buy a machine to pump sand from rivers and ponds.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros C., 51, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling watermelons, earning an income of US $10 per day. She is also a fortune teller at her home in the village. In the picture, she is preparing religious tools for sale. C.'s income helps to cover the family expenses.

C. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to buy more watermelons from local farmers in her province for sale and to expand her current business. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to have a bigger stand at the market to sell the watermelons wholesale because her family members are depending on this source of income. She also wants her children to finish high school and continue to a good university.

loans.use: To purchase watermelons for sale and to expand the current business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C., 58, is busy managing her variety store and computer café. A mother of one and married to Alfredo C., she finds pleasure in making her business a lot better by expanding her product line whenever she has the chance.

Remedios has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to take out a loan nine times in CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used almost all the money she loaned to buy additional stock for her variety store .

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of additional capital to her expanding business by buying additional stocks like snacks, beverages and other household commodities. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow through God’s blessing and prays for good family relationships.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks like snacks, beverages and other household commodities.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana A. is from the village of Biasong. She is 36 years old. Ana is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ana harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ana has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Ana is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Ana's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 39, is a housewife who sells barbecue on the side street. Married to Juan Apolonio B., they are blessed with nine children. Of the nine, three are already working, and six stay at home. Her husband works as a head of exploration in a mining company and they live in Caloocan City. In spite of the great size of her family, Mary Ann is a determined businesswoman. Her barbecue stand has been helping her family for three years as an added source of income. She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation* just this year, and has already received three loans from CCT because of good attendance in their weekly fellowship meetings and her regular payment of dues.

She wants to further expand her business this Christmas season by applying for a PHP 8,000 loan so that she can use it as additional capital to buy more meat for her barbecue stand. With her extra earnings she hopes that by next year she can start another business aside from her barbecue stand. 
Her prayer is that some day, all her children can finish their studies and eventually have a job.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more meat for her barbecue stand.

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Maluno. She is 28 years old, married, and has children.

Jocelyn owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Pacita

Pacita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel D. has been in the variety store business for six years. Married to Oscar D., they have six children. Four of them are already working, one is studying in college and one is in elementary school. Her husband works as a cook in a restaurant. She and her family are living in Caloocan City, Metro Manila.

Being a member of Center for Community Transformation* for the past two years, Isabel has already received six loans, with her latest loan amount being PHP 12,000, because of her good attendance at weekly fellowship meetings and her regular payment of dues. She wants to further expand her business this Christmas season by applying for a PHP 14,000 loan and using it as added capital to buy more stock like soft drinks, instant noodles, assorted snacks and other products for her variety store business.

She hopes that both her own and her husband’s hard work will someday pay off with a stable source of income from their expanding business, benefiting not only them but also their children as they each start families of their own.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her variety store business

loans.name: Wina

texts.en:
Wina P. is from the village of Danao. She is 44 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children.

Wina owns and operates a business harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Wina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to raise.

Wina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter works as a secondary school teacher, while the younger children both attend a secondary school.

Purevsuren manages a dairy retail business in a rented stall at a local market. She began her business in 2006 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD). After several successful years in business, her working capital has grown to 450,000 tugrugs (~315 USD). Because of the business’s success, not only is she able to pay for her children’s tuition fees, but she is also able to greatly contribute to the family’s overall financial health.

Purevsuren would like to keep growing her business in the future and says, “I would eventually like to buy a house so that my family and I can live comfortably.” She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of dairy products which she can sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of dairy products

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn A. is from the town of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 27 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Emelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Emelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma C. is from the village of Danao. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Alma owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Alma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anhbaatar

texts.en:
D. Anhbaatar is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". His 7-year-old son attends a local secondary school and his daughter is 1 year old.

Anhbaatar operates a business in his town making wooden products with the help of his wife. They specialize in making furniture, and design and produce a variety of original pieces. Anhbaatar started his business in 2000 with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD). He has gained much experience since he started and participates in many local business competitions to improve his skills and market his business to the public. Today, his working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD) and he has a large base of loyal customers.

Anhbaatar has used his success to greatly improve his family's quality of life. He is a very open-minded person and is eager to achieve his future goals. He says, "My main goal is to expand my business in the future." Anhbaatar is requesting a 1,700,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Sumya

texts.en:
B. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His oldest son, 11, attends a local secondary school while his youngest son, 6, attends a local primary school. 

He and his wife operate a jewelry retail business in a rented stall at a local trading center. They began their business in 2006 with working capital of 300,000 tugrugs. Since then, they have grown their business and now his working capital is 2,100,000 tugrugs. With the business earnings, he was able to purchase a home for his family so that they might be more comfortable. 

B. hopes to continue growing his business in the future and is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of jewelry to sell during the upcoming Christmas and New Year season.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of jewelry

loans.name: Mary Dave

texts.en: Mary Dave C. is from the village of Danao. She is 21 years old and is married. Mary Dave owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Mary Dave joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Mary Dave is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Sosima

texts.en:
Sosima is an expert at making rice cakes and other forms of Filipino desserts. She has been making and selling these delicacies for more than two years. Married to Virgelio R. and blessed with four children, she makes it a point to earn a decent living through her business to help them with their daily needs.

Being a member of Center for Community Transformation* for the past two years, Sosima has already received seven loans. She wants to further expand her business this Christmas season by applying for a PHP 8,000 loan so that she can use it as additional capital to buy more ingredients like sweet rice, sugar and other flavoring to make more rice cakes.

She hopes to save all her earnings so that she can have money for her family especially in times of need.

 * All CCT community partners/ lients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like sweet rice, sugar and other flavoring to make more rice cakes.

loans.name: Bulgamaa

texts.en:
Bulgamaa J. is 41 years old and lives with her three sons in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest son is a university student and her youngest two attend secondary school. Bulgamaa manages a dairy products trading business in her town.

She started her business in 2007 with working capital of 150,000 tugrugs, and has made much progress in her first two years. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase new appliances for her house and expand her yard. Today, her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrugs. Bulgamaa is a very hardworking businesswoman and is known for her good character. For the future, she hopes to expand her business and save money to support her family. She says, "my main goal is to provide a good education for my children." She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase dairy products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products.

loans.name: Unurjargal

texts.en:
Unurjargal C. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her 17 year old daughter attends a local secondary school and her husband helps with the family business. Unurjargal manages a consumer goods trading business and food cafe in her town. She started selling consumer goods in 2002 and quickly built a consistent operation. She used her savings to recently open her cafe. Unurjargal has worked hard to manage both of her businesses and has gained much experience as a businesswoman.

Today, both operations have reached a stable level and she has grown her capital to a level exceeding 4,000,000 tugrugs. She attributes her success to her good customer service skills. Unurjargal is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase groceries for her food cafe.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her food cafe.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
To say that Rosemarie is a small time businesswoman is an understatement, for she has three. From selling rice cake delicacies, direct selling Avon cosmetic products and Boardwalk apparel, she is busy enough so that she with her husband can have a better life to raise their family.

Rosemarie, 46, lives together with her husband and four children in Caloocan, one of the districts of Metro Manila. She decided to start a business nine years ago selling assorted rice cakes for desserts. Today she earns a net profit of PHP 10,600 per month from her three businesses. A member of Center for Community Transformation* just this year, she has already received three loans from CCT because of good attendance at their weekly fellowship meetings and her regular payment of dues.   

Because she sees that her business can be gratefully profitable especially this Christmas season, she now wants to further expand her business by applying for a PHP 14,000 loan so that she can use it as additional capital to buy more ingredients for her rice cake business, more products for cosmetics, and sports apparel, plus more stock of dried fish for sale.

Though she has asthma, she doesn’t let it get in the way of fulfilling her dream of becoming successful in business. “I do all these for the future of my children and to have our own savings so that we can have something to spend in times of need.”

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her rice cake business, and more cosmetics, sports apparel, and stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila F. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 45 years old. Lucila is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucila owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and frozen foods in the market. Lucila has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lucila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lucila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna J. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 40 years old, and is widowed with no children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Edna has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Samet

texts.en: Mrs. Samet S. is a villager in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Mos, is a construction worker who only makes a small income to support the family. Although they try to hard they still don't earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samet S. decided to ask for a loan to buy eight piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business. Mrs. Samet S. is a mother of a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 21 year old daughter in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. Her daughter attends university, her husband is retired and Davaa runs a household goods retail business out of a rented stall in the local market. She started her business in 2005 with working capital of 60,000 tugrugs. Since then, her working capital has reached 350,000 tugrugs and she has become established in the business community. Davaa says, “I am working hard to feed my family.” She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug to purchase products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma Q. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 53 years old. Wilma is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dresses and slippers in the market. Wilma has been engaged in her business for quite a few years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.
