loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a villager in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy six more pigs and pig food for her current breeding. Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one attends the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy six more pigs and pig food.

loans.name: Helfer

texts.es:
Helfer, de 18 años, es un joven muy trabajador y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro.
Todas las mañanas, sale de su casa en busca de la leche con la cual puede elaborar sus deliciosos quesos, él trabaja toda la mañana en compañía de sus padres y llegado el medio día lleva sus quesos hasta el mercado del poblado. Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para ayudar en la economía de su casa.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus quesos, ya que gana un buen dinero por ellos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir la leche, ya que tiene que ser de muy buena calidad. 
Para más adelante, espera reunir el dinero necesario para alquilar un puesto en el mercado, ya que actualmente vende sus quesos de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el primer préstamo de Helfer con MFP, sabe que tiene que esforzarse en su trabajo para no fallar en ninguna de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es uno de los miembros más jóvenes. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más leche, para incrementar su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
Helfer is 18. He is a very hard-working and happy young man. He lives in his parents’ house. What he wishes for most is to build a good future. Every morning he leaves his house looking for milk that he will be able to use to make his delicious cheese. He works all morning with his parents. When midday comes he takes his cheese to the town market. Even though he is still very young, he knows that he has to work hard to help with the household economy. What he likes best about his work is selling his cheeses. He earns good money for them. He has been doing this for three years. The most difficult part is getting the milk because it has to be very good quality. Later, he hopes to get together enough money to rent a stand in the market. He currently sells his cheeses in an ambulatory fashion. This is Helfer’s first loan with MFP. He knows that he needs to put forth a lot of effort in his work in order to not miss any of his payments. He is much loved in his communal bank because he is one of the youngest members. He will use the 500 PEN that he is asking for to buy more milk in order to increase his cheese production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk

loans.name: Reymie

texts.en:
Reymie T.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs. She is a 21-year-old married woman from the village of Cabaruan. Reymie earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Reymie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Reymie is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new livestock to raise and sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia, de 27 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Desde muy joven Lilia se dio cuenta que tenía que ayudar con los gastos familiares, para que la plata alcance en su hogar, es por eso que cuando terminó sus estudios de secretariado empezó a trabajar en la universidad de su localidad como secretaria, donde le va muy bien. Ahora, Lilia ha logrado implementar una tienda de abarrotes para sus padres, con la cual su vida está cambiando poco a poco.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a las personas que llegan hasta la universidad  para pedir información, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener en orden los papeles de la oficina, ya que hay días en que tiene mucho trabajo. 
Para el futuro, espera continuar trabajando duro para ayudar a sus padres y darles una mejor vida.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Lilia con MFP, desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con la mitad del dinero que solicita comprará más productos para la tienda de la familia, y con lo restante pagará sus estudios complementarios a su profesión.
texts.en:
Lilia is 27. She is a happy and unassuming young woman. She lives in her parents’ house. She wishes to help them with the household expenses. Ever since she was very young Lilia realized that she had to help with the family expenses so that there would be enough money. That is why, when she finished her secretarial studies, she started to work as a secretary at the local university. It is going very well for her. Now, Lilia has set up a grocery store for her parents. With the store her life is changing little by little. What she likes most about her work is helping people who come to the university to ask for information. She has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is keeping all the office papers in order. There are days she has a lot of work. In the future she hopes to continue working hard to help her parents and give them a better life. This is Lilia seventh loan with MFP. She wants to make all of her payments on time to be able to have access to another loan. She also knows that she has the support of her communal bank. She will use half of the money to buy more products for the family store. With the rest she will pay for additional professional education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her parents' store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 62 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Junto a sus adorados animales Lucia pasa sus días, ella alimenta y cuida con mucho cariño a sus vacas, para que le brinden mucha leche y pueda elaborar así más quesos. Su lugar principal de ventas es la feria dominical de su pueblo, donde sus quesos son muy demandados y comprados rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es puede elaborar sus quesos en la comodidad de su hogar, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar la alimentación de su ganado, ya que si comen algo indebido su producción de leche puede disminuir. 
Con el tiempo, espera comprará más vacas lecheras, ya que desea incrementar su producción. 

Este es el primer préstamo de Lucia con MFP y está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que de su buena alimentación depende el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 62. She has worked very hard her whole life to get ahead.. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to have a peaceful old age. She spends her days together with her beloved animals,feeding and caring for her cows with great tenderness so that they produce a lot of milk and she can make more cheese. Her main sales are in the Sunday market in her village where her cheese is very much in demand and sells quickly. What she most likes about her work is to make the cheese in the comfort of her home. For the last 35 years she has been working in this and what she considers the most difficult aspect is the feeding of the cows. If they eat something they shouldn't, it can lower their milk production. This is the first loan that Lucia has with MFP and she is very happy with the opportunity to obtain one. In her communal bank she is one of the most solid members among her companions. With the thousand new sols that she is requesting, she will buy more feed (hay) for her animals since the progress of her business depends on how well her animals eat.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for her cows

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria M. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 49 years old. Victoria is married and has children. To make a living, Victoria raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Victoria has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2009, Victoria joined ASKI, Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga S. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian  housing tent called "ger." His son and daughter, ages 14 and 9, both attend a local secondary school. 

Gantulga operates a transportation service in his town. He transports small loads such as luggage or supplies for individuals and local businesses throughout the area. Gantulga started his business in 2008 with capital of 5,000,000 tugrugs after previously operating a window making-business. Since starting his transportation service, he has improved and expanded his business greatly. Today, his working capital exceeds 10,000,000 tugrugs. 

Gantulga is an energetic person and has many goals for himself and for his business. He says, "With my future earnings, I plan to buy two more trucks for my business." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to make improvements to his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 28 años, es un joven muy tranquilo y sencillo, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
La juventud que tiene Manuel es su principal arma para sobresalir en la vida, puesto que su labor diaria no es sólo de un trabajo, sino que desempeña hasta tres a la vez. Su principal ingreso es por la crianza y venta de animales, como llamas, ovejas, gallinas, etc; pero paralelamente ayuda a su hermana con sus tejidos artesanales, ya que sabe que ese también es un ingresos para su familia; y por las noches, toma prestado el motocarro de su cuñado y sale a ganarse unos cuantos soles transportando a las personas, con el único fin, de que la economía de su familia mejore.
Lo que más le gusta a Manuel de su trabajo es cuidar a sus animalitos, ya que les tiene mucho cariño, lleva un año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus animales hasta las principales ferias de la ciudad. 
Para más adelante, espera seguir trabajando duro, ya que lo que más desea es que sus negocios crezcan y le puedan brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Manuel con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por ser el más joven del grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que sabe que tiene que alimentarlos bien para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Manuel, 28 years old, is a quiet and humble young man; he lives in the house he inherited from his parents and he is willing to work hard to improve his quality of life. Manuel’s youth is his main weapon to survive in life, since his daily work is not just one job but sometimes three jobs at a time. His main income comes from raising and selling animals such as llamas, sheep, chickens, etc.; but in parallel, he helps his sister with handmade fabrics, since he is aware this is an additional income for his family. At night, he borrows his brother-in-law’s moto-taxi and goes out to earn a few “soles” transporting people, with the only objective of improving his family’s finances. What Manuel enjoys most about his work is taking care of his beloved animals; he has been doing this for a year now, and he thinks the most difficult chore is taking the animals to the main fairs of the city. In the future, he expects to continue working hard since his biggest desire is to grow his business and increase his income. This is Manuel’s second loan with MFP; he pays on time to avoid problems for the other members of his community bank, where he is well liked for being the youngest in the group. With the five hundred nuevos soles he is requesting, he will buy feed for his animals, since he knows he must feed them well to improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phin N. lives in Kampong village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 0.3-hectare of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. Additionally, she usually cultivates rice in both seasons. On this farm, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. 

Mrs. Phin N. is a widow with five children. Two of her children are farmers, two are attending the local school and the youngest one is 4 years old, too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Myrliza's Group

texts.en:
Myrliza runs a general store selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Myrliza has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Myrliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Myrliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Myrliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Myrliza P. is the leader of an eight member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back their loans if someone is delinquent or defaults.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 51 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Basilio), de 53 años, y sus dos hijas: Sonia de 14 y Nury de 7 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de leche; todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para ordeñar a sus vacas y así conseguir la cantidad de litros necesarios para ir a la feria dominical su poblado y satisfacer la demanda de sus compradores. La leche que vende es de muy buena calidad, ya que se preocupa mucho en la alimentación de su ganado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar a sus animales, ya que les tiene mucho cariño, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar la alimentación de sus vacas, ya que cualquier cosa indebida que se coman podría afectar su producción de leche. 
Para más adelante, espera aumentar el número de vacas lecheras que tiene, ya que desea incrementar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mercedes con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los novecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que sabe que de su alimentación dependerá el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is the 51-year-old mother of a very loving family. She lives in her own home with her 53-year-old husband, Basilio, and their two daughters, Sonia (14) and Nury (7), who are the main inspiration for all of her hard work. Her occupation is the sale of milk; every morning she wakes up very early to milk her cows to obtain enough liters to satisfy the demands of her customers when she goes to her village's Sunday street market. The milk that she sells is of very high quality because she takes great care with the nutrition of her livestock. What she likes most about her job is caring for her animals because she feels great affection for them. She has been in this business for 25 years and believes that the most difficult part is the proper feeding of her cows, since anything undesirable that they eat could affect their milk production. Going forward, she hopes to increase the number of dairy cows that she has because she wants to increase their production. This is Mercedes' first loan with MFP; she knows that she must pay on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank, always conscientious about making sure that agreements between members are fulfilled. With the nine hundred nuevos soles requested she will purchase more grass feed for her animals, because she knows that her business's success depends on their nutrition.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry N. lives in Voat Svay village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land on which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Heng, owns a small restaurant that sells soup to the villagers. In this business, he faces a small problem because he does not have a motorbike for traveling to buy ingredients. His wife decided to ask for a loan to buy the motorbike for her husband's business purpose. Mrs. Ry N. is the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's business purpose

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Clemente), de 49 años, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida.
Muy temprano por la mañana, Norma ordeña a sus vacas para extraer la deliciosa leche que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de su distrito; ella tiene muchos clientes que la esperan para comprarle, ya que la leche que vende es muy sabrosa y de muy buena calidad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar a sus vacas, ya que sabe que de ellas depende la economía de su familia, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la leche hasta el mercado, ya que siempre hay la posibilidad de que se derrame. 
Con el tiempo, desea alquilar un puesto estale en el mercado, ya que actualmente ve de en forma ambulatoria.

Este es el primer préstamo de Norma con MFP y está muy feliz de esta oportunidad, ya que sabe que con ese dinero su negocio podrá progresar; en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que quiere alimentarlos bien para que le brinden buena leche.
texts.en:
Norma is a very hardworking 30-year-old woman who lives in her own home along with her 49-year-old husband, Clemente. She is motivated to work very hard to excel in life. Very early in the morning, Norma milks her cows for their delicious milk, which she later takes to sell at her district's market. She has many customers who wait for her, since the milk that she sells is delicious and of very high quality. Her favorite part of her job is caring for her cows because she knows that her family economic well-being depends on them. She has seven years of experience in the business and finds that the most difficult part is transporting the milk to the market, since there is always the risk of spilling it. In time, she hopes to rent a stationary stall at the market; currently she makes sales on the move. This is Norma's first loan with MFP and she is very happy to have the opportunity because she knows that this money will enable her business to move forward. She is a well-liked and respected member of her communal bank. With the thousand nuevos soles requested, she will buy more feed (grass) for her animals; she wants to nourish them well so that they will provide good milk.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase feed for dairy cows

loans.name: René

texts.es:
René, de 19 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener una buena vida.
Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de quesos. Todas las mañanas, muy temprano, sale de su casa en busca de leche con la cual pueda elaborar sus deliciosos quesos. Él es un joven muy vivaz, motivo por el cual tiene muy clara la idea de que tiene que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer los quesos y los hace con mucho esmero, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es levantarse temprano a recolectar la leche. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de René con MFP y está muy decidido a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participativo y solidario con sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más leche para poder incrementar su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
René is a 19-year-old young man who is very cheerful and hard-working. His lives in his parents' house and his dream is to have a good life. His occupation is the production and sale of cheeses. Very early each morning, he leaves the house in search of milk from which he will make his delicious cheese. He is a vivacious young man who understands well the need to work to help his parents with household expenses. What he likes most about his job is making the cheeses, and he makes them with great care. He has 4 years' experience in the business, and the most difficult part for him is getting up early to purchase the milk. Going forward, he hopes that his business will grow and provide him with a larger income. This is René's first loan with MFP and he is very determined to make his payments on time, since he wants to take out more loans in the future. He participates in many activities at his communal bank and is very supportive of his fellow members. With the five hundred nuevos soles requested, he will purchase more milk to increase his cheese production.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mrs. Ream C. is a villager in the Voat Svay village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a duck breeder. Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food and 120 more ducks for breeding.

Mrs. Ream C. is a widow with three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, another one is a duck breeder and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy duck food and more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en: Juliet E. is from the village of Upper Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Juliet is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Upper Magsaysay. Juliet is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Juliet raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2009, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Mrs. Khy Y. is a villager in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a widow with two children who are all attending the local school. Although Mrs. Khy Y. tries to work hard she still earns less income so she decided to ask for a loan to buy 10-piglet and pig food to start breeding pig.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy 10-piglet and pig food to start breeding pig.

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lanh S. is the group leader of four people who are all living in Voat Svay village in Takeo province. Mrs. Lanh S. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Bao Phon, helps her on the farming. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Lanh S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to make a profit after she sells her cow. Mrs. Lanh S. is a mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while two are attending the local school and the other is staying at home to help  with the housework. Mrs. Yen K. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Um Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-three people who live in Braimbei Mom village in TaK. province make up the village bank group and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Yom U. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keom Chab, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family.  Mrs. Yom U. is a mother of four children two of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Bak's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Bak T. is a group leader of six who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Nis Ny, helps her on the farm. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income.  Mrs. Bak T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse for her husband to transport goods and passengers for an income. Mrs. Bak T. is a mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a horse for her husband to transport goods and passengers for an income.

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: P. Gerelmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her three children, ages 11-17, all attend a local secondary school. Gerelmaa manages a meat trading business with the help of her husband at a local market in her town. Gerelmaa started her business in 2001 with capital of 600,000 tugrugs (420 USD). She has been operating her business successfully over the years and has built a good reputation amongst her customers and suppliers. Today, her working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (3500 USD). For the future, Gerelmaa is working hard to grow her business and continue her success. She says, "My business goal is to deliver quality products to my customers." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (1400 USD) loan to purchase meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Mrs. Sary Oem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 18 people, is located in Prey Theat village in the Takeo province. All the members will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sary O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small field on which to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Nop Sokhom, helps her with the farming. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sary O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to improve their living conditions after she sells her cow. Mrs. Sary O. is the mother of seven children, six of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because this child is only 1 year old. 

Mrs. Kea M. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es:
Betzabeth es una mujer de 35 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es tener una buena vida.
Su negocio es la venta de películas, música, video clips, documentales, dibujos animados, etc. en formatos de DVD, esta actividad le es muy rentable, ya que tiene su puesto de venta en Santa Lucia (Distrito de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde la demanda por sus artículos es grande y le genera buenos ingresos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la posibilidad de ver las películas que desea mientras está vendiendo, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trasladar su mercadería desde la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. 
Con el tiempo, anhela que su negocio crezca y le pueda generar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Betzabeth con MFP y está muy feliz de la oportunidad,  sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre tiene un consejo para sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más DVDs, con los cuales pueda incrementar su stock y ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Betzabeth is a cheerful and hard-working 35-year-old woman. She lives in a rented house and what she most wants is to live a good life. Her business sells movies, music, video clips, documentaries, cartoons, etc, in DVD format. This is a very profitable activity since she has a kiosk in Santa Lucia (a district of the city of Juliaca), where the demand for these items is high and generates a large income. What she likes most about her job is the opportunity to watch whatever movies she wants while she works. She has six years' experience in the business and finds that the most difficult part is transporting her merchandise from the city of Juliaca, since the road is very long and exhausting. She hopes that her business will grow over time and thereby increase her profits. This is Betzabeth's first loan with MFP and she is very happy to have the opportunity. She knows that she must make payments on time and is prepared to do so. She is well-liked among her peers at the communal bank since she always has good advice for them. With the thousand nuevos soles requested she will buy more DVDs, which will augment her inventory and enable her to offer better variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo, de 38 años, es un padre muy amoroso y responsable, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a su hijo Brandon de 5 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Su taller de mecánica es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que es un mecánico muy hábil y cumplido. Desde muy joven trabajó en otros talleres y ahora con mucha experiencia acumulada se ha animado a abrir su propio taller, el cual le está dando los ingresos que necesitaba para pagar los estudios de su único hijo.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arreglar los carros y dejarlos como nuevos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir los repuestos que utiliza en sus reparaciones. 
Para más adelante, anhela juntar el dinero necesario para abrir un taller muy grande, donde pueda brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Hugo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nueva maquinaria para utilizar en su taller y así hacer más rápido su trabajo.
texts.en:
Hugo, who is 38 years old, is a loving and responsible father. He lives in a relative's house with his five-year-old son Brandon, who is the inspiration for all of his hard work. His repair shop is one of the busiest in the city of Juliaca because he is a very skilled and experienced mechanic. From a young age he worked in other shops, and now with all of the experienced he gained he has taken the step of opening his own shop, which has provided him with the income necessary to pay for his only child's education. What Hugo likes most about his job is fixing cars and restoring them to like-new condition. He has 10 years' experience with this and his greatest challenge is obtaining the parts he uses for the repairs. In the future, he dreams of saving enough money to open a larger shop where he can offer better service to his clients. This Hugo's fourth loan with MFP. He is aware that he must pay all of the installments on time in order to receive another loan, and he is an active and experienced member of his communal bank. With the three thousand nuevos soles that he is requesting he will purchase new equipment to use in his shop, which will enable him to work faster.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of machinery

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon K. is a villager in the Neasar Kiri village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2.3 hectares of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. With this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Mon K. decided to ask for a loan for that purpose. 

Her husband, Mr. Meak Chhorn, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Mon K. is the mother of five children, three of whom are laborers while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Hyguor

texts.es:
Hyguor, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su juventud no fue un impedimento para que pudiera implementar un local con cabinas para el servicio de Internet, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que está ubicado en un lugar muy céntrico, como es el mercado Manco Cápac (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca).
Él cuenta actualmente con 9 computadoras, las cuales le dan los ingresos necesarios para pagar sus estudios.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede aprovechar el Internet para realizar sus trabajos universitarios e investigar sobre algunos temas, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, pues sólo cierra para ir a la universidad. 
En el futuro anhela terminar sus estudios y progresar con su profesión.

Este es el primer préstamo de Hyguor con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo; en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará una computadora para incrementar el número de cabinas que tiene.
texts.en:
Hyguor, 22 years old, is a modest and hard working youth, he lives with his parents and is willing to work very hard so that he can improve his quality of life. His youth was not an obstacle in being able to set up a business with booths for internet services, which is very popular, since it is located very centrally, like the Manco Cápac market (important market in Juliaca city). He has 9 computers at present, which give him the necessary income to pay for his studies. What he likes most about his work is that he can use the internet for his university studies and research various topics, he has spent 2 years in this business and what he considers the most difficult is to have to spend all day inside his place of business, as he only closes to go to university. In the future he longs to complete his studies and make progress in his profession. This is Hyguor's first loan with MFP and he is committed to pay all his installments on time; it is very nice at his communal bank, since he is the youngest in the group. With the PEN700 he is asking for he will buy a computer to increase the number of booths.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Jamyansharav

texts.en:
Jamyansharav lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son attends university.

Jamyansharav operates a meat retail business in town. She began her business in 2000 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs. After nine years of operating, she has grown her business and now her working capital is 500,000 tugrugs. She hopes to continue to grow her business, improve her family’s standard of living and purchase a car in the future. 

She is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase livestock so that she can grow her inventory this winter.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Katerinne

texts.es:
Katerinne, de 18 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Su negocio es la venta de regalos para matrimonios, todos los días ella sale a vender de forma ambulatoria sus preciosos artículos para el hogar, pero donde le va mejor es cuando se ubica en la puerta de las iglesias, pues aprovecha para vender a las personas que asisten a las bodas.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es envolver los regalos, ya que se divierte mucho haciéndolo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil tener que caminar todo el día bajo el ardiente sol. 
Espera que con el tiempo pueda tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus artículos con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Katerinne con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Katerinne is a hard-working and cheerful young woman of 18 years. She lives in her parents' home, and what she most wants is to excel in life. Her business is the sale of wedding gifts. Every day she goes out on foot to sell her beautiful household goods, but she is most successful when she stands outside churches and takes advantage of the opportunity to sell her items to wedding guests. What she likes most about her job is wrapping the gifts because it's fun. She has two years of experience, and the most difficult part of the work is having to walk all day under the blazing sun. She hopes that in time she will be able to open a store to sell her items in a more leisurely manner. This is Katerinne's first loan with MFP, and she is very happy about the opportunity and intends to make all of her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank. With the seven hundred nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more merchandise to improve her business's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia, de 20 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida.
La vida de Lilia no fue muy sencilla, desde muy pequeña siempre se preocupó por ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en el cual ofrece muchas prendas de vestir tejidas a mano, como chalinas, guantes, etc.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus prendas hasta su puesto de venta, ya que los fardos que lleva son muy grandes y pesados. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda atender a sus clientes con más comodidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lilia con MFP y está decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por sus compañeras. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar más prendas y así tener más tejidos para vender.
texts.en:
Lilia is a hard-working and fiesty young woman of 20 years. She lives at her parents' house and wants to work hard to improve her quality of life. Lilia's life has not been easy: she has worried about helping with household expenses from a very young age. Today she has a clothing sales business with a kiosk located at a market in San José (an important location in the city of Juliaca), where she offers many hand-woven garments such as scarves and gloves. What she likes most about her job is weaving, and she does this very skillfully. She has two years of experience and finds that the most difficult part is transporting her garments to the market, since the bundles she carries are large and heavy. In time, she hopes to have a clothing store where she can attend to her customers more comfortably. This is Lilia's first loan with MFP and she is determined to pay her installments on time. At her communal bank she is well-liked and respected by her fellow members. With the seven hundred nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more wool to make her garments so that she will have more items to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 21 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Su puesto está ubicado en el M. Manco Cápac (M. importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de verduras como zapallo, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, etc. Su puesto es muy concurrido por sus clientes, motivo por el cual su mercadería se vende muy rápido.
Lo que más le gusta a Liz de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir a la calle. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender sus verduras con mayor comodidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Liz con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus socias debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más verduras, ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Liz is a hardworking and fiesty young woman of 21 years. She lives in her parents' home and what she most wants is to succeed in life. Her kiosk is located at Manco Cápac, an important market in the city of Juliaca. She sells vegetables such as pumpkins, carrots, tomatoes, onions, etc. Her booth is busy with customers, so her merchandise sells very quickly. Liz's favorite part of her job is talking with neighboring saleswomen. She has 4 years of experience in the business, and the most challenging part for her is having to stay at her kiosk all day without being able to walk down the street. In the future, she hopes to have a very large store where she can sell her produce more comfortably. This is Liz's first loan with MFP and she aspires to be very punctual with the payment of her installments. She is well-liked by the members of her communal bank due to the joy she inspires in the group. With the thousand nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more vegetables, since she wants to improve her sales booth.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth, de 19 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Tejiendo chullos (prendas para la cabeza), chalinas, guantes, etc, Lizeth pasa sus días. Sus tejidos los vende en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la mina La Rinconada (poblado minero), donde con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, ya que desde muy pequeña aprendió a hacerlo, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados a las prendas que hace, pues debe ser muy detallista.
Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindarle una mayor comodidad a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lizeth con MFP y planea ahorrar poco a poco para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 19 years old and a hardworking, modest young woman. She lives at home with her parents and her greatest hope is to succeed in life.

Lizeth spends her days weaving wool caps, scarves, gloves, etc. She sells her finished articles from a small vending post located in La Rinconada (a mining town) where she has been able to quickly build up her clientele. Weaving is the part of her job that she enjoys most. She learned this skill when she was very young and now has been in business for three years. Lizeth says that finishing a single garment is difficult because it requires a lot of detail. In the future, she hopes to have a larger shop so that she can provide greater convenience to her customers and improve her income.

This is her first loan with MFP. Lizeth plans to save little by little so that she can make her payments on time. She does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank, where she feels very happy. With her loan of 700 soles, she will buy wool for producing more hand-woven articles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 62 years old and lives with his wife in Khar-khorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has two adult sons, the oldest of whom lives and works nearby while the youngest is in the army. 

Purevdorj and his wife operate a retail clothing business in the local market. He began his business in 2007 and since then, has learned a great deal about business and the local business environment. When he was a young man, Purevdorj had a terrible accident and lost one of his hands. While his disability has made life more difficult for him, he has never let it keep him from working hard and being successful. 

He would like to expand his business in the future and says, “All I want is to help my children to lead happy lives.” Purevdorj is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of clothing from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, de 54 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de la vida a trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener un futuro tranquilo.
Su puesto de venta de ropa está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella vende específicamente polos para jóvenes y es muy buena vendedora, puesto que siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle más de un prenda de vestir.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 33 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir a la calle.
Para más adelante, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para tener una tienda de ropa.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Maria con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más polos, ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Maria, age 54, is a woman who has worked hard throughout her life to get ahead. She lives in her own house, and her greatest desire is to have a tranquil future. The stand where she sells clothes is located in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Specifically, she sells polo shirts for young people, and she is an excellent salesperson, since she always convinces her customers to buy more than one garment. What she likes most about her work is conversing with the salespeople from neighboring stands. She has been in this line of work for 33 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is having to spend the entire day at her sales stand without being able to go out onto the street. For the future, she hopes to be able to save enough money to open her own clothing store. This is Maria's fifth loan with MFP; she knows that she needs to pay it on time to avoid causing problems for the other members of her communal bank, where she is well-liked. With the 3000 Peruvian nuevos soles she is requesting, she will purchase more polo shirts, since she wants to increase the sales volume of her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing additional merchandise

loans.name: Uberlinda

texts.es:
Uberlinda, de 56 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, vive en una habitación alquilada y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Ella se dedica es la venta de diversos artículos por campaña, actualmente se encuentra preparándose para vender en las fiestas navideñas, ya que sabe que esta fecha es muy buena para el negocio y sus ventas siempre son muy altas. Por eso está comprando panteones, champagne, chocolate para tasa, etc, para implementar su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, ya que es una vendedora muy persuasiva y convincente, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca vendiendo sus productos, ya que realiza sus ventas de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Uberlinda con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más panteones (queques), ya que es lo que más se vende en estas fechas.
texts.en:
Uberlinda, age 56, is a very determined and hard-working woman. She lives in a rented room, and what she desires most is to have a tranquil old age. She works selling a variety of seasonal products; she is currently preparing to sell during the Christmas holidays, since she knows that these days are excellent for business, and her sales are always very high. For this purpose, she is buying panettones (traditional Christmas cakes), champagne, chocolate for beverages, etc., to sell in her business. What she enjoys most about her work is selling, since she is a very persuasive and convincing salesperson. She has been doing this work for 10 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is having to walk through the streets of the city of Juliaca selling her products, since she sells in an ambulatory manner. This is Uberlinda's fourth loan with MFP, and she is very punctual with her payments, since she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank. She feels very happy with her communal bank, and she knows that it will help her to get ahead. With the 1000 Peruvian soles she is requesting, she will buy more panettones, since they are the best-selling product during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing additional merchandise

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa C. is 38 years old and lives with her father and two children in the Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger." Her son and daughter, ages 17 and 15, both attend a local secondary school and help their mother in their spare time. Her father has cancer and lives with them as he is receiving treatment. 

Ariunaa manages a clothing trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She sells a wide variety of men's and women's clothing to her many customers. Ariunaa started her business in 2006 and has built a stable operation over the last three years. She has a loyal customer base who like the stylish clothes she sells. 

Ariunaa is focused on the future and hopes to further expand her product line in the near future. She also plans to begin teaching at a local secondary school to supplement her income. "If I get a teaching job, I will hire (a) salesperson to handle the day-to-day operations of my clothing business," she said.

Ariunaa is a hardworking and open-minded businesswoman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to import clothing from China to sell in her business.

loans.use: To import clothing from China

loans.name: Battseren

texts.en:
Battseren T.  is 35 years old and lives with her son in the Tuv province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son, Tumenbayar, is 9 years old and attends a local secondary school.

Battseren operates a clothing-making business in her town. She makes variety of traditional Mongolian clothes such as deels and hantaaz (traditional Mongolian coats and shirts). Battseren started her business in 2008 with capital of 500,000 tugrugs after working as a sewing technician for a private company. She has built a stable business in her first year of operation and has become an experienced seamstress. She has many loyal customers who are very satisfied with her quality products. She recently hired two new assistants to keep up with demand and her working capital now exceeds 4,800,000 tugrugs. 

Battseren has many plans for the future and hopes to soon expand her work area. She says, "By expanding my business operation, I will be able to better keep up with demand." She is requesting a 2,400,000 tugrug loan to purchase fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Bisoboka Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en: Nusula N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working lady with a business of selling yellow bananas, commonly known as "bogoya", from Lugalambo. She has been selling these alongside the Lugazi-Jinja road for over 19 years. She says that she is also a farmer growing passion fruit, beans and maize, which she also sells. Nusula is married, with nine children all in school and five other dependants who she cares for. She needs a loan to be able to buy more yellow bananas for resale so that she can make money to educate her children and improve their general welfare.

loans.use: Buying more bogoya for resale

loans.name: Julie's Group

texts.en:
Julie L. is from the city of Capatan Tuguegarao. She is 49 years old. Julie is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Capatan Group".

Julie is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Julie owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream to the local community. Julie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Julie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy's Group

texts.en:
Mary Joy A. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 23 years old. Mary Joy is the group leader for a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

Mary Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling pork and chicken barbeque. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.


In 2008, Mary Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mary Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products offered

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en: Aida T. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Aida is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tucal Center. Aida is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing mechanical services to local community members. Aida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2009, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Myrna's Group

texts.en: Myrna R. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Myrna is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sta. Cruz Center. Myrna is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2009, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario F. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 45 years old. Rosario is married. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over  years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom Y. is a villager in Yok Bat village in Kandal province and she owns a small restaurant selling Chinese noodles. In this business, she now has a small problem because she does not have money to buy tables and chairs for her business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy these. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are teachers while the others help her at the business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap N. is a villager in Ta Non village in Takeo province. She is a silk weaver in the local village. In this business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy more silk for her business, so she decided to ask for a loan to this for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Sreong Vannak, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for an income. Mrs. Sopheap N. is a mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more silk for her business.

loans.name: Luwayo Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Mary, 48, is a determined and hard-working lady and a single mother of 7 children aged 12 to 32 years, and she takes cares for 4 dependents. She has run a retail shop and a waragi (Ugandan beer) business for 8 years in Luwayo, and she is happy to say that her loans have enabled her children to attend school and it is now a family of the educated. In her shop, Mary sells food and refreshments from which she makes profits that enable her care for her children singlehandedly and have also revitalized her businesses. She needs a loan to help purchase more stock for her grocery shop. 

She is a member of a group that is requesting loans for all.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim U. is a villager in Kor village in Takeo province, and she is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. San Kosal, sells garlic in the local market. Although they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Nim U. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start breeding pigs. Mrs. Nim U. is a mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start breeding.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon L. is from the village of Danao. He is 33 years old and is single. Marlon owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Marlon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be his first from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en: S. Bazarragchaa is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two young daughters in Khar-khorin, the captial city of the ancient Mongolian empire. They live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger." His oldest daughter is 6 years old and recently started kindergarten. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home to look after their youngest daughter. Bazrragchaa operates a wooden products and jewelry-making business in his town. He started his businesses in 1997 and has built a stable operation over the years. Currently his jewelry sales bring in the most profit, and he plans to soon stop makng wood crafts and focus on jewelry full-time. Bazarragchaa has become an experienced jewelry maker over the years and always works hard to grow his business. He says, "I am conducting my business in order support my two daughters." He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials and tools used in jewelry making.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Nezikokolima Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Yeko is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working business lady who has been selling agricultural products, such as matooke and sweet potatoes, for so long! Yeko started on a very small scale in the Lugazi Central market but, at the moment, she is able to make decent profits. She says that her loans enable her to stock quality produce for her customers and as a result, she gets more profits. Yeko needs a loan to help increase the capital in her business so that she is able to buy more produce to resell, especially now when the consumption rate is high. 

She is a member of a group, each requesting a loan.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto P. is from the city of San Luis, Tarlac. He is 42 years old. Ernesto is single. To make a living, Ernesto owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services in the local community. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ernesto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Dashtsermaa

texts.en:
Dashtsermaa G. is 61 years old and lives in Bayankhongor province in central Mongolia. She lives with her youngest son in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a ger. Her oldest son is 27 and lives on his own and her youngest is 24 and manages a transportation service in the area.

Dashtsermaa operates a jewelery trading business in her town. She imports a variety of jewelry items from India, which are very popular among Mongolian consumers. Dashtsermaa started her business in 2008 after conducting a clothing trading business for several years. She had success selling clothes, however, over the years her profits declined due to other clothing businesses opening in her town. Dashtsermaa has grown her jewelry business steadily over the last year and has many plans for the future. She hopes to soon expand her product line by importing Indian fabrics to sell along with her jewelry. She says, "managing my business succesfully enables me to support my two sons." Dashtsermaa is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase fabrics from India to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics from India to expand her business.

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Tatu S., age 37, is married and has three children ages of 15, 11 and 7 years.  She has a salon and has sold fabrics since 2008 and she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $75.

This will be Tatu’s first loan, called a motisha loan, from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Tatu hopes to obtain a loan to grow her two businesses.
	
Tatu will share this loan with her small loan group, which totals eight members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Tatu is first on the left.

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Gina

To make a living, Gina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling confectionery products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

loans.name: Nelicel

texts.en: Nelicel B. is from the village of Danao. She is 26 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Nelicel owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2005, Nelicel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren D. is 51 years old and lives with her four children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All three of her daughters currently attend college and her youngest son is in high school.

Dulamsuren operates a meal service business in her town. She makes a variety of traditional Mongolian meals and sells them throughout her town. Her primary customers are local office workers who enjoy her convenient service for lunch. Dulamsuren started her business in 2004 after working as a cook at a secondary school. Her business is very important to her and her family as she must pay all of her children's tuition fees. Dulamsuren is a very passionate woman and invests all of her energy into accomplishing her goals. She says, "all I want is for my children to be educated and have a better life." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to help her pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To help her pay her children's tuition fees.
